loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro has his own house, which is located in the zone of Tacagua in the city of La Paz. He has a wife (Beatriz Laime, weaver of the sweaters that are marketed in galleries that sell inexpensive clothing) and they also have a 6 year-old child. Isidro makes a living by working for a telephone company. He has used his previous loans for construction on the land that he used all of his life savings to buy. On his property he will build a retaining wall in order to stabilize his land.

This is the third loan that Isidro has requested, and as in the previous cases, the socioeconomic analysis determines him to be well-qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Isidro tiene casa propia, el domicilio se encuentra en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene una esposa (Beatriz Laime, tejedora de chompas las cuales se comercializan en galerías donde se vende ropa barata) y un hijo de 6 años. Para subsistir Isidro es empleado de una compañía telefónica, créditos anteriores le sirvieron para construir en el terreno que compro con sus ahorros de toda la vida, en su propiedad levantará un muro de contención para estabilizar su terreno.

Este es su tercer crédito con nosotros y como en los casos anteriores, el análisis socioeconómico lo califica favorablemente, por lo que puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a retaining wall

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio lives in his parent’s house in the zone of Pasankeri, on the west side of the city of La Paz. Lucio is married to Paulina Arequipa, an artisan that makes folkloric suits for a branch store. The couple has two children and the husband does private consultations for handcrafted dental prosthesis (modern instruments are not available.)

Lucio’s parents gave him a space in order for him to be able to construct his home since now they only have one room for the entire family (it is necessary to mention that the past credits were used for the construction of a flagstone in the said room) They will construct walls and a roof for the two rooms. This is the third credit that Lucio has done with IMPRO he is well-qualified for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Lucio vive en casa de sus padres la cual esta en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Lucio esta casado con Paulina Arequipa, una artesana que realiza trajes folklóricos para una tienda del ramo. La pareja tiene dos hijos y el marido realiza prótesis dentales en forma artesanal (no dispone de equipo ni instrumentos modernos) para consultorios particulares.

Los padres de Lucio le otorgaron un espacio para que pudieran construir sus vivienda ya que sólo cuentan con una habitación para toda la familia (es necesario mencionar que créditos anteriores le sirvieron para construir una losa en dicho cuarto). Por eso, se construirán muros y techo para dos habitaciones. Este es su tercer crédito con nosotros y califica favorablemente para este nuevo préstamo.

loans.use: Construction of walls and a roof for two rooms

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco is a hard-working father who has always looked after the welfare of his two sons. He is a driver and travels between the cities of Huancayo and Concepcion in his vehicle every day. He has been doing this for the last seven years.

It is gruelling work, sitting behind the wheel of a car all day, every day. It is also potentially dangerous, particularly when the roads are bad. Nonetheless, Marco is the main breadwinner of his family and has to endure. His wife also works and runs a small grocery store from the basement of their house.

This loan is for Marco to repair his small car and to improve the décor of his wife’s store. Your support is crucial for this family to improve its quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Marco es un padre de familia muy trabajador que siempre ha velado por el bienestar de sus dos hijos, por ello, diariamente trabaja como chofer, usando su propio auto cubre la ruta de la ciudad de Huancayo hacia Concepción. Ya son 7 años de labor constante de esta manera, no es fácil sentarte frente al volante y manejar durante todo el día, este oficio también es muy riesgoso y aún más cuando la carretera no está en buen estado. Pero Marco es el sostén de su casa, debe seguir, su esposa también trabaja, ella atiende en su casa una pequeña bodega. El deseo de ambos es asegurar un futuro económico mejor para sus dos hijos que aún están en la escuela. El préstamo que solicita Marco es para reparar y mejorar su camioneta y a su vez implementar la pequeña tienda de su esposa. Tu apoyo es indispensable para que esta familia mejore su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To repair the vehicle used as public transport and to improve the decor of his wife's grocery store

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria is a very hardworking woman, and this quality of improving each day and carrying out quality work has been passed on to her children who are always grateful to her. Gregoria teaches them this art so that they can create beautiful pieces of handiwork to sell in the tourist markets. She also creates typical embroidered clothing that she adorns with creativity and attention to detail. The artwork of Gregoria’s hands is admired by everyone in her town and her embroidery and hand-made items are in demand by tourists. In order to attract customers and fill current orders Gregoria has requested a loan to buy materials to make her embroidered and handcrafted items. Please consider supporting the dreams of Gregoria to keep working as well as the dreams of her children who will carry on the legacy of this art.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Gregoria es una mujer muy empeñosa, y esta cualidad de mejorar cada día y realizar un trabajo de calidad, ha transmitido a sus hijos que siempre estarán agradecidos con ella. Gregoria les enseña todo el arte para elaborar bellos artículos de artesanía que venden en las ferias turísticas. También realiza el bordado de fustanes de trajes típicos que elabora con creatividad y detalle. El arte que las manos de Gregoria tienen es admirado por la gente de su localidad y sus bordados y manualidades son muy solicitados por los turistas. Para atraer clientes y satisfacer los pedidos que ya tiene Gregoria pide un préstamo para comprar el material para sus bordados y artesanías. Apoya los deseos de seguir trabajando de Doña Gregoria y la de sus hijos que heredarán este arte.

loans.use:
To purchase materials for the fabrication of handicrafts and the embroidery of clothing typically worn in the region.

Comprar material e insumos para la fabricación de artesanía y el bordado de fustanes como prenda típica de su región.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hidelisa

texts.es:
Hidelisa has had a grocery store for four years where she sells essential items. She has three children and it is because of them that she works hard to get ahead. Years ago, Hidelisa had a store that she was forced to relocate due to the fact that it was very far away from her home. Now her grocery store is much closer to home, however the change meant a decrease in daily income. In time, she found new customers and has seen increasing sales every day. At this time Hidelisa’s business needs to grow in order to compete, and it is for that reason that she requests this loan, to buy merchandise as well as fix up her shelving and display areas in the store. Your support will help Hidelisa’s grocery store become the busiest in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Hidelisa tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad desde hace 4 años, ella tiene 3 hijos y por el bienestar de ellos lucha para salir adelante. Años atrás Hidelisa tuvo una tienda que tuvo que trasladar debido a que quedaba muy lejos de su casa, ahora la bodega de Hidelisa está mucho más cerca de su casa, este cambio significó una caída en los ingresos diarios, pero con el paso del tiempo, se hizo de nuevos clientes y ha visto crecer sus ventas día a día. Hoy por hoy el negocio de Hidelisa necesita crecer para estar acorde con la competencia, y para ello, es el préstamo que pide, para comprar mercadería, arreglar los estantes y mostradores de tu tienda. Tu apoyo servirá para que la bodega de Hidelisa sea la más concurrida de su zona.

loans.use:
To improve the infrastructure of her store and to purchase new merchandise for her shop.

Arreglar la infraestructura de su tienda y comprar nueva mercadería para su bodega.

loans.name: Siulepa

texts.en:
Siulepa S., 44, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also friends 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Siulepa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business. Her husband assists her business as a financial supporter when he receives his salary from Ott Transport as a full time employee.

loans.use: purchasing equipment such as shovel, bushknife, weedkiller machine, spade, chemicals

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a member of the Las Kantuta de Willkauta Communal Bank, situated in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito Juli and the region of Puno. She decided to join this bank with the goal of improving her handicraft and embroidery business.

With her previous loans of S/. 300.00 and S/ 500.00, she was able to increase her production and her income.

With this loan of S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase 20 meters of a puffy type of fabric, 2 kg of wool in a variety of colors, and a cow as a means of savings capital.

She is currently happy being that she is able to sell two to three embroidered panoramas per week thanks to her husband’s support, producing about 8 panoramas per month to people that pass through Juli.

Juana is 32 years old and completed her studies up to middle school. She is the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Her vision for the future is to improve her embroidery, spend time fattening cattle and see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta de Willkauta ubicado en el Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco del distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito Juli y la Región Puno, decidió pertenecer a dicho Banco con el fin de mejorar negocio de Bordado y Artesanía.

Con los créditos anteriores de S/. 300.00 y S/ 500.00 soles logró incrementar su producción e ingresos económicos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 20 metros de bayeta de lanilla, 2 kilos de lana de colores y una vaca como capital de ahorro.

Ella se encuentra contenta ya que logra vender dos a tres panoramas semanales, esto gracias al apoyo de esposo, entregando así 8 panoramas mensuales a los intermediarios de Juli.

Juana tiene 32 años de edad, su nivel de instrucción es secundaria completa, es madre de dos hijos (un hijo y una hija). Su visión a futuro es mejorar sus bordados, dedicarse al engorde de ganado vacuno y ver a sus hijos profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase wool and fabric wholesale, and purchase a cow.

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama S., 37, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also to friends 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Lama’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business. Her husband helps out with maintaining her business.

loans.use: purchasing equipment such as shovel, bushknife, weedkiller machine, spade, chemicals

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena L., 55, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also friends 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

SPBD loans are Elena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business. Her husband helps out with maintaining her business.

loans.use: purchasing equipment such as shovel, bushknife, weedkiller machine, spade, chemicals

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
Leilani M., 27, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the ice cake (popsicle) business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also to friends 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 360 Tala (~150 USD).

SPBD loans are Leilani’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business while her husband helps out with maintaining her business.

loans.use: Purchase plastic cups, sugar, concentrate

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama T., 28, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in the donut/snacks business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also to friends 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

SPBD loans are Miriama’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business, while her husband helps out with maintaining her business.

loans.use: To buy a sack of flour, sugar, cooking oil, cream, also replace stove for business

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La E., 46, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the chips business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also to friends 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).

SPBD loans are La’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business. Her husband always assists her with this project.

loans.use: Purchase bananas, plastic papers, salt

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Mrs Elsa is 35 years old and married to Gabriel Benito, 34, who has supported her in her embroidery and animal husbandry activities. They have four children, two daughters and two sons. She has had five years of secondary school education.

Elsa is a member of the Las Kantuta de Willkauta Community Bank in the town of Mulla Contihueco, Juli district, Chucuito-Juli province, Puno region. She became a member as she needed capital to start her business. With an initial small loan, she purchased ten metres of woollen cloth to embroider, thus supplementing her income. With this loan, repayable over six months, she plans to purchase thirty metres of woollen cloth, twenty balls of wool in different colours and a bullock to raise and fatten.

She has shown that she can achieve a higher level of productivity now that, unlike in the past, she can purchase her material in larger quantities. In addition, she is gradually improving her business. Her main wish is to purchase a truck for the cattle raising business, put the embroidery business on firmer footing, and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta de Willkauta del Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco del distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito -Juli, de la región de Puno, decidió ser socia por falta del capital para mantener su negocio de Bordado de Lanilla, por ello inicialmente accedió a un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con ello adquirió diez metros cuadros de bayeta de lanilla, ello permitió a incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 30 metros de bayeta, 20 ovillos de lana de colores y un torito para engorde. Ella manifiesta que logró incrementar su material de producción, ya que antes no compraba en mayor cantidad como lo hace ahora, además poco a poco está mejorando su ingreso. Por todo ello agradece a Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por dar la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito, ya que con ello han mejorado sus ingresos y producción. Señora Elsa tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, madres de 4 hijos (dos hijas y dos hijos), vive con su esposo Gabriel Benito de 34 años de edad quien le apoya en hacer bordado y engorde, para sobresalir juntos y unidos en la familia. Su mayor sueño es adquirir un vehículo de carga para el negocio de engorde de ganado vacuno, formalizar una empresa de bordado y que estudien sus hijos y hijas.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock, and wool and other fabrics in bulk

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati F., 43, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the vegetable business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also to friends 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Fati’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business. Her husband is always the backbone of her project.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizer and spade, bush knives

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Mrs Elvira is 38 years old, married, and has five chidren, four boys and a girl. She lives in the town of Mulla Contihueco, Juli district, Chucuito-Juli province, Puno region and has completed six years of primary education.

For the last ten years, she has been involved in fabric embroidery, having learned the craft from her older brother and the women’s organization in her town. In addition, she is involved in raising cattle and animal husbandry. She speaks both Castillan (European Spanish – Translator) and Aymara (native language of indigenous Aymara people of Peru and Bolivia – Translator)

Elvira decided to become a member of the Las Kantuta de Willkauta Community Bank in order to expand her embroidery business, which she felt was more profitable than animal husbandry. With an initial small loan, she purchased 30 metres of woollen cloth for her business. With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to purchase 40 metres of the same material.

Elvira is very happy that her business has grown and her income has increased, thus enabling her to feed her children. Her greatest desires are to build a home for her family, be successful in her embroidery business, and to educate her children in such a way that they can achieve a measure of success in life.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elvira tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto de primaria, es madre de 5 hijos (4 varones y 1 mujer), habla aymara y castellano, está casada y viven en el Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco del Distrito Juli, Provincia Chucuito-Juli y en la región Puno. Ella se dedica a la actividad económica de Bordado de Bayeta, hace 10 años atrás, gracias a que le enseñó su hermano mayor y en la organización de mujeres del Centro Poblado. Además como actividad complementaria realiza crianza de animales y chacra. La señora Elvira decidió pertenecer al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta de Willkauta, por incrementar la producción, ya que en ese entonces había mayor ganancia en los bordados, así accedió al primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, con ello adquirió 30 metros de bayeta de oveja. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará 40 metros de Bayeta de oveja. Este préstamo será cancelado en un plazo de cuatro meses. Ella está muy contenta ya que incrementó su producción y mejoró sus ingresos económicos, así logra cubrir los gastos de alimentación de sus hijos. Su sueño más grande es construir su casa, ser intermediaria y hacer estudiar a sus hijos de alguna manera para que sean algo en la vida.

loans.use: Purchase of woollen cloth in bulk

loans.name: Taemanu

texts.en:
Taemanu M., 28, is married with 1 child. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also to friends 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).

SPBD loans are Taemanu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will spend all the loan money on starting up her business. Her husband helps out with maintaining her business.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizer and spade, bush knives

loans.name: Abdilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Abdilia lives in Ticuentepe and has worked selling fruit for the last six years. She started the business through her own hard work but she has encountered innumerable problems along the way due to a lack of the money she needs to buy the fruit. Ms. Abdilia is married and all of her daughters are already married.

Ms. Abdilia's husband is a builder and helps his wife by contributing his income towards the cost of maintaining and improving their home. Both have worked very hard their whole lives in order to provide for the family and to create a home with good living conditions. They are requesting this loan in order to install a brick floor in the home, as they currently have a dirt floor.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Abdilia habita en el municipio de Ticuentepe, es comerciante y se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de frutas. El negocio lo inició con esfuerzos propios y los problemas que ha encontrado en el camino son innumerables debido a la falta de capital para comprar las frutas. Doña Abdilia es casada y todas sus hijas ya están casadas.

Su esposo trabaja como albañil y apoya a su esposa en los gastos del hogar y en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación. Han trabajado fuertemente toda la vida para tener un patrimonio familiar, y también han trabajado duro para darle las condiciones necesarias a su casa de habitación. El motivo del préstamo es ponerle ladrillo a su casa de habitación, el cual es de tierra

loans.use: Install a brick floor in her home.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Saul C. and I work in the purchase and sales of vegetables.  I am 54 years old, married with four children—three of which are adults, while the smallest one helps me run the business.  My wife is a merchant and we help each other in sustaining our home. 

My customers are great since my business is located in the municipal market of Nacaome, a high-traffic market visited by many people from various communities.  Currently, I need to purchase more vegetables to satisfy the demand of my customers; also, I need to offer a greater variety of vegetables.  This is why I am requesting a loan to be able to continue growing my business and supporting what is most important to me in this life—my wife and children. 

 Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

hola mi nombre es Saul C., me dedico a la compra y venta de verduras, tengo 54 años de edad y estoy casado, tengo 4 hijos los cuales 3 son independientes y el pequeño me ayuda con mi negocio, mi esposa es comerciante y nos ayudamos mutuamente con el sustento de nuestro hogar, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicado en el mercado municipal de nacaome y este mercado es bien visitado por mucha gente de varias comunidades, en estos momentos necesito incrementar las compras de verduras esto es para satuisfacer las necesidades de mis clientes aparte que tengo que tener mas variedad de verduras, por lo que estoy solicitando una ayuda monetaria para poder salir adelante con mi negocio y lo mas importante en mi vida que es mi esposa e hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Andrea Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ms. Andrea is 48 and lives in Ticuantepe, an area well-known for its agriculture. She is married and has two children (13 and 14 years old). Both are currently in secondary school.

Ms. Andrea works in the farming industry and has been cultivating vegetables for the last two years. The experience that she has gained during those two years has helped her improve her products. She is now requesting a loan so that she can purchase the supplies necessary to keep her crops healthy. Since these products are costly, she plans to purchase them with the money from the loan she is requesting. This will ensure that she has good crops, which will in turn enable her to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Andrea de 48 años de edad, habita en Ticuantepe, un lugar de características agrícolas, es casaday tiene dos hijos de 13 y 14 años, ambos se encuentran estudiando la educación secundaria.

Doña Andrea se dedica a la Agricultura, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace 2 años,la experiencia que ha adquirido a través de estos dos años le ha ayudado a ir mejorando su producto. Solicita un crédito para comprar los insumos que su cosecha necesita para mantenerse sana, por el alto costo de éstos los comprará por medio del crédito que está solicitando y así garantizará una buena cosecha; y su cosecha a la vez garantizará el pago de su crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers.

loans.name: Ricardo De Jesús

texts.es:
Ricardo has worked the land his entire life--his parents taught him to farm at a very young age. He has been working his own land for eight years and dedicates great effort to maintaining it and improving production.

His land needs to be maintained during the harvest in order to yield good results and this maintenance entails applying fertilizers and insecticides. Therefore, Ricardo is requesting a loan to be able to purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

Ricardo lives in the Ticuantepe municipality, an area which is well-known for producing excellent fruit, such as pineapple and pitahaya [or dragon fruit]. He has a 15-year-old son who is also learning to farm. In the future, Ricardo would like to be able to increase production and be able to generate more income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Don Ricardo se ha dedicado trabajar la tierra toda su vida, desde muy pqueño sus padres le enseñaron el oficio de la Agricultura. Tiene 8 años de cultivar sus tierras, a las cuales le ha dedicado un gran esfuerzo por mantenerlos y sacar adelante su producto.

La tierra necesita de mantenimiento durante la cosecha para dar buen fruto, y ese mantenimiento conlleva laaplicación de abonos e insecticidas, y para eso solicita el préstamo Don Ricardo para comprar estos abonos e insecticidas.

Don Ricardo habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, municipio reconocido por la producción de excelentes frutos como son la piña y pitahaya. Tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad y quien está aprendiendo los oficios de la agricultura. Desea en un futuro poder aumentar la producción y generar mejores ingresos para su familia

loans.use: Production maintenance.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina P., 29, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the snacks business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also to friends 5 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

SPBD loans are Paulina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will spend the whole amount of her loan to replace all the supplies for her project while her husband works at the Water Authority and that will be a financial support for her business.

loans.use: Purchase bananas, plastic papers, salt

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Sandra has worked very hard along with her husband in order to improve their eight children's lives. She works in housekeeping and also sells beauty products through a catalog. Her husband is a musician and together they work every day to ensure that their children are educated and that they grow up to be good, respectable people. Their greatest desire is that their children succeed in life.

Ms. Sandra has been selling beauty products for credit through catalogs for ten years now and this loan will allow her to purchase more of these products so that she always has merchandise on hand to offer her clients. Her future plans include being able to dedicate herself 100% to her business and to be able to solidify the business so that she can guarantee her children the education that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Sandra junto a esu esposo han luchado muy duro para poder sacar adelante a su numerosa familia de 8 hijos. Doña Sandra es empleado doméstica y también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Su esposo es músico, y junto a ella velan cada día por la formación de sus hijos para que estos sean personas honradas, de bien y sobre todo con muchos deseos de superación.

Doña Sandra tiene 10 años de tener el negocio de las ventas al crédito por catálogos, y el préstamo le ayudará en la compra de los productos que ofrece, y así siempre tener productos que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Sus planes futuros son poder dedicarse 100% al negocio de las ventas, así como también poder establecer su negocio, para poder asegurarle a sus pequeños la educación que ellos necesitan.

loans.use: Working capital, purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela is a 34 year old woman who was taught by her mother from the time she was a little girl the fine work of handicrafts. Thanks to this work she was able to leave her place of birth, Capachica, in search of better opportunities, and now resides in the city of Juliaca, the city where she was able to build her home thanks to the benefits she obtained from the art of her knitting. At this time Ángela cannot count on having enough wool to keep producing her garments. For that reason she appeals to your heart with the hope of receiving financing so that she can reach all of her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Ángela es una mujer de 34 años de edad, desde niña su querida madre le inculcó la bella labor de la artesanía, gracias a ese trabajo pudo salir de su puedo natal, Capachica, en busca de mejores oportunidades, actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, ciudad donde hizo construir su vivienda gracias a los beneficios que obtuvo con su arte del tejer. En estos momentos doña Ángela no cuenta con suficiente materia prima (lana) para seguir produciendo sus prendas de vestir, por ello recurre a tu solidario corazón con la esperanza de recibir vuestro financiamiento para cumplir cada uno de sus metas.

loans.use:
To acquire wool in order to be able to continue knitting garments, which is the work which sustains her.  

Adquirir lana para continuar tejiendo sus prendas, que es la labor que la sustenta.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Mrs Concepcion is a member of the Las Kantuta D. Willkauta community bank in the town of Mulla Contihueco, Juli district, Chucuito-Juli province, Puno region. She is 67 years old, has had two years of primary education and speaks Aymara (the native language of indigenous Aymara people of Peru and Bolivia – translator). She has eight children, four boys and four girls, none of whom lives with her.

For the last ten years, Concepcion and her husband have been involved jointly in weaving woollen cloths, for which they have a ready market. Having expanded their business with a previous loan, they now supply half of the embroiderers of their town with their required woollen cloths.

With this loan, repayable over four months, they plan to purchase four kilograms of wool to weave black woollen cloth. Concepcion and her husband are content, as they sell 80 metres of cloth every week for approximately $1.75 per metre, which covers their food and other expenses. Their plan is to improve the quality of their product so than they can attract more embroiderers as customers.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Concepción pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta D. Willkauta, del Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco, del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito-Juli y región D. Puno. Ella tiene 67 años D. edad, estudió hasta segundo grado D. primaria, habla aymara, madre D. 08 hijos (4 varones y 4 mujeres), D. los cuales nadie D. sus hijos vive con ella. Actualmente conjuntamente con su esposo se dedican a la Confección D. Bayeta D. lanilla, en donD. provee a la mitad D. las bordadoras del Centro Poblado, así garantiza su negocio. Esta actividad la desarrolla hace diez años atrás. Con los primeros préstamos del Banco Comunal incrementó la producción y sus ingresos económicos. Con este préstamo D. S/ 500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 5 kilos D. lana negra para la confección D. bayeta. Ella y su esposo están felices, ya que semanalmente logran tejer 80 metros D. bayeta y los venD. a S/ 5.00 nuevos soles el metro, así cubre sus gastos D. alimentación y otros. Su visión es mejorar su tejido para proveer a más artesanas y vivir feliz.

loans.use: Purchase of wool in bulk

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Sonia is a married, 33 year-old woman. She is a small merchant who has a store in her house. She lives in Colonia Máximo Jérez in the city of Managua. Sonia's husband works in a free-trade zone in the city. This small family plans to improver their quality of life, for which they work for daily.

Although Sonia has been working in her store for the last two years, sometimes she still struggles to sell her merchandise, which makes it difficult to make ends meet. Sonia also sells food on Sundays to augment her income. Sonia wants to expand her business, because of which she is asking for a loan to buy shoes to sell in her store, and raw materials to make the food she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia es una mujer de 33 años de edad, está casada. Es una pequeña comerciante que tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Habita en la Colonia Máximo Jérez de la ciudad de Managua. El esposo de Sonia trabaja en una zona franca de la ciudad. Los planes de esta pequeña familia es poder mejorar su nivel de vida y para eso luchan diariamente.

Sonia tiene dos años de haber empezado el negocio de la pulpería, aunque en ocasiones presenta ventas bajas y eso le dificulta su situación económica. Como actividad Sonia también desarrolla la venta de comida los días domingos y así poder generar más ingresos. Sonia quiere empezar a crecer, es por eso que solicita el préstamo, para compra de zapatos para venderlos en la pulpería y compra también de materia prima para la elaboración de comidas.

loans.use: Purchase shoes and raw materials to sell in her store.

loans.name: Melba

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Melba R. and I sell candy, snacks, and prepared breakfasts and lunches.  I am a native of Nacaome in the department of Valle.  I am a single mother of three adult children. 

I have 34 years of experience in this business; I started with a small snack business selling tacos, baleadas (tortillas with beans), quesadillas, tortillas with cheese, etc. and currently I run a cafeteria which is growing very quickly.  My cafeteria is located in the Calvario neighborhood, a centrally-located area with substantial foot traffic.  

My current goal is to supply my business in order to attend to my customers better and cover the increase in demand for my goods.  Now that my business has grown, so many customers come that sometimes I’m left without fast food to serve them.  This is why I am requesting a loan in order to continue growing my business since it is my only source of income to support my home. 

 Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

hola mi nombre es Melba R. me dedico a la venta de golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos soy originaria de Nacaome, departamento de Valle, soy madre soltera y tengo 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. 
tengo 34 años de experiencia en este negocio, comenze con una pequeña venta de golosinas como ser tacos, baleadas, quesadillas, tortillas con quesillo etc, y actualmente tengo un comedor el cual esta creciendo mucho y rapido. mi comedor esta ubicado en el barrio el Calvario, este es un  lugar centrico y muy transitado por muchas personas,  mi objetivo en este momento es surtir mucho mi negocio asi poder atender mejor mis clientes y cubrir con la demanda de los clientes ya que ahora vienen muchos clientes y me estoy quedando sin comida rapido, por tal razon deseo solicitar una ayuda para poder salir adelante con mi negocio que es unico que me da ingresos para poder sustentar mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, flour, bread, beans, coffee, soft drinks, dairy products, juices, oil, butter, salt, glasses, napkins, plates, rice, sugar, churros, eggs, lard, cheese, cold meats

loans.name: Gagau

texts.en:
Gagau L., 42, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the taro / banana business. She sells to the village community and relatives and also at the public market 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Gagau L.’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will spend the whole amount of her loan to replace all equipment for her project. Her husband is always the backbone of her project.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, insect sprayer, bushknife, shovel

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Husband and wife, Mario (shown in photo) and Eusebia are responsible and hardworking parents, who, since marrying, left their birthplace of Pusi in search of better employment opportunities. Currently they live in the city of Juliaca with their children. These responsible parents started out by selling clothing in the mining camp Rinconada, and after gathering considerable capital, they joined forces with some friends and rented a storefront where they now buy and sell gold. This business is becoming fruitful but they know that with a greater investment they will reap greater benefits. This is why Eusebia became motivated to request this loan in order to increase their capital investment. She is committed to repayment in a punctual and responsible manner, because she considers the person who gives her a helping hand to be deserving of care and respect.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Los esposos Mario (en la foto) y Eusebia son padres responsables y trabajadores, desD. que contrajeron matrimonio abandonaron su pueblo natal, Pusi, en busca D. mejores oportunidades D. trabajo. Actualmente junto a sus hijos viven en la ciudad D. Juliaca. Estos responsables padres se iniciaron vendiendo ropa en el campamento D. la mina Rinconada, luego D. reunir un considerado capital, se unieron en sociedad con algunas amistades y alquilaron un local, ahora se dedican a la compra y venta D. oro. Este negocio está empezando a darles buenos frutos, pero consideran que con mayor inversión podrían obtener mejores beneficios. Fue entonces doña Eusebia quien se anima a solicitar este préstamo para incrementar su capital D. inversión. Ella se compromete a pagar D. manera puntual y responsable, porque considera que a la persona que le tienD. la mano le debe cariño y respeto.

loans.use:
Increase investment capital for their business of buying and selling gold.

Incremento de su capital de inversión para su negocio de compra y venta de oro.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Mrs Celia is 28 years old and has three dependent children (two boys and one girl). They live in the town of Mulla Contihueco, Juli district, Juli Chucuito province, Puno region.

Celia has completed secondary school education and is a member of Las Kantuta de Willkauta Community Bank. She runs a grocery store and with her first loan of approximately $100, she increased the retail stock of her grocery store by buying ten crates of beer. Concurrently, Celia is involved in embroidery in order to supplement her income.

She is grateful for the help given to her by the bank to make her a responsible, punctual and sharing woman. Her wishes are to expand her business and become a wholesaler in her district, and for her children to have professional jobs.

With this loan, repayable over six months, she plans to purchase five boxes of biscuits, twenty crates of soft drinks, and five gallons of butane gas.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Celia, tiene 28 años de edad, su nivel de educación alcanzado es superior no universitario, es madre de 3 hijos ( dos varones y una mujer), ellos aún dependen de ella, viven en el Centro Poblado de Mulla Contihueco, distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito Juli y región de Puno. Actualmente pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta de Willkauta del Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco, por iniciativa propia y para incrementar su mercadería en su Tienda de Abarrotes, con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró 10 cajas de cerveza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará 5 cajas de galleta, 20 gaseosas y 6 galones de gas. Paralelamente se dedica en el Bordado de Bayeta para tener mayor ganancia y mejores ingresos. Ella esta agradecida por lo que ayudó a ampliar su negocio, mejorar sus ingresos económicos, ser responsable, puntual, compartir experiencias con las compañeras en las reuniones que tienen. Así se siente feliz y contenta ser parte del Banco Comunal. Su visión es agrandar su negocio y ser mayorista en Juli, y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of various items in bulk

loans.name: Talaitupu

texts.en:
Talaitupu L., 38, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the crab fishing business. She sells to the village community and relatives and also at the fish market when they catch a lot, 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Talaitupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also support her kids at school and make her church contribution. Her husband is always engaged in operating the business.

loans.use: replace all tools for her project of fishing crabs, coco wire, new canoe, etc.

loans.name: Faleifue

texts.en:
Faleifue L., 40, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the popcorn business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also at the local primary school 5 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Faleifue’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also support her kids at school and make her church contribution. Her husband is always engaged in operating the business.

loans.use: replace stove, cooking equipment; also pay for overhead cost of business

loans.name: Atina

texts.en:
Atina I., 35, is married with 1 child. She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the local community and relatives and also to shops arround town 5 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

SPBD loans are Atina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also support her child at school and make her church contribution. Her husband is always engaged in operating the business.

loans.use: Purchase a new overlock sewing machine, thread, and Elei printing materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a loving mother and a native of the province of Huancane. Twenty years ago she relocated to the city of Juliaca. She makes a variety of shirts for children, men and women. Esther began working in a shop, but a short time after learning this craft, and with effort, she opened her own shop. She achieved this with the help of her husband, but due to many problems she decided to separate from him and continue on her own. This diligent mother continued working for the good and tranquility of her children. Now she relies on the unconditional support of her children, who, after finishing their studies actively help her in making the clothing. This hardworking family is able to make a large number of shirts each week, which are sold wholesale in the city of Cuzco. Esther and her children wish to increase their business and it is for that reason that they appeal to your kind heart and ask for a loan which they will use for the purchase of fabric and other materials.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Esther es una madre muy amorosa natural de la provincia de Huancané, hace más de 20 años que radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, ella viene dedicándose a confeccionar variedad de poleras para niños, caballeros y damas. Esther se inició trabajando en un taller, pero poco tiempo después aprendió esta labor y con esfuerzo logró implementar su propio taller. Esta actividad la realizaba con su esposo, pero desilusionada y por muchos problemas decidió separase de él y continuar sola. Eso no fue razón para que esta diligente madre continúe luchando por el bienestar y tranquilidad de sus hijos. Actualmente cuenta con apoyo incondicional de ellos, quienes luego de concluir con sus estudios la ayudan activamente en la confección de las prendas. Esta laboriosa familia semanalmente logra confeccionar gran cantidad de poleras, que son vendidas al por mayor en la ciudad del Cuzco. Esther y sus hijos desean reforzar esta actividad por ello recurren a tu solidario corazón para solicitar un préstamo que utilizarán en la compra de insumos y materiales textiles.

loans.use:
Acquisition of materials for the fabrication of winter clothing.

Adquisición de insumos y materiales para la fabricación de ropa de invierno.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Mrs. Reyna belongs to the Las Kantuta de Willkauta Population Center Mulla Contihueco Communal Bank of the Juli district, province of Chucuito Juli, region of Puno. She decided to become a member because she lacked the capital to acquire more material for embroidery.

With the first loan of 300 new soles ($125) that she received, she bought 4 kilos of black yarn and 50 balls of colored yarn. With this loan of 800 new soles ($300), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy 5 kilos of red yarn and a young bull to fatten in order to increase her income and production of embroidery.

Reyna is happy with her work and her greatest dream is to improve the production of her embroideries and sell them abroad. She would use the money to pay for her children’s studies, as tomorrow they will be professionals.

She is 24 years old, lives with her husband, and studied until the 11th grade. Her husband supports her in her embroidery art and he weaves cloth on a loom and makes polleras (pleated skirts) in order for the two of them to be united and excel together.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Reyna pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta de Willkauta del Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco del distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito Juli y región Puno. Ella decidió ser socia por falta del capital para adquirir más material para producción de bordado.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles adquirió 4 kilos de lana negro y 50 ovillos de lana de colores. Con este crédito de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en un plazo de seis meses, comprará 5 kilos de lana rojo y un torete para engordar, así mejorará sus ingresos económicos y su producción de bordados.

Ella esta contenta con su trabajo y su mayor sueño es mejorar su producción de Bordados para comercializar a mercados externos y con ello solventar los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos, para que ellos mañana más tarde sean profesionales.

Tiene 24 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria, vive con su esposo quien le apoya en el arte del bordado, teje telar de bayeta y confecciona polleras, para sobresalir juntos y unidos.

loans.use: Buy yarn in bulk and buy a young bull

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en:
Tumema L., 37, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to friends, relatives,and the local community; also in harvest season they supply the puplic market 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Tunema’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also support her kids at school and make her church contribution. Her husband is self-employed and helps to maintain the business.

loans.use: Purchase gromozone chemicals, weedkiller sprayer machine, shovel, bushknife,  wire for fence, etc.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin is a young entrepreneur who, at 21 years old already knows the real meaning of work and how much dignity it brings to one's life. Since finishing his secondary studies he has learned different trades, resulting in opening and operating his Internet "cabina," (a place to use the Internet for a fee) and with the effort and support of his parents he was able to buy six computers. Unfortunately, three months ago he was the victim of a robbery. Since then, in an area of his home he has created a dance school, and in addition, this hardworking young man decided to purchase and rent out sound and lighting equipment for various social events. All of this effort is made with the goal in mind of reopening his Internet "cabina" and provide good service to his community. This exemplary young man needs your collaboration in order to accomplish his goal. Edwin promises not to betray your trust.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Edwin es un joven emprendedor que a sus 21 años ya sabe el verdadero significado del trabajo y cuan dignificante es en la vida. Desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios ha realizado diferentes oficios con el fin de abrir e implementar su cabina de Internet, con el esfuerzo y apoyo de sus padres logró comprar 6 computadoras, pero desafortunadamente hace 3 meses sufrió un robo. Desde entonces en uno de los ambientes de su casa puso una academia de baile, ya que también cuenta con dichas cualidades, adicionalmente a esta labor, este empeñoso joven decidió adquirir y alquilar equipos de sonido y de luces para diversos eventos sociales. Todo este esfuerzo es para implementar nuevamente sus cabinas de Internet y prestar un buen servicio a su comunidad. Este ejemplar joven requiere de tu colaboración para cumplir su propósito, Edwin promete no defraudar tu confianza.

loans.use:
Increase capital in order to continue with his diverse trades with the end result of accruing  money and recover the lost business caused by a robbery.

Incremento de capital para continuar con sus diversos oficios a fin de reunir dinero y recuperar el negocio que perdió debido a un robo.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Hello, our group, New Dawn, consists of three business partners, Sonia F., 46 years old, Mayra L., 35 years old, and Vera H., 35 years old.  All of us have the support of our husbands to provide for our families. Our group has been around for 14 years and we live in San Lorenzo, Valle department.  
Our work is in the sales of tortillas and fresh juice. In our country, the tortilla is an indispensable food that nearly the entire population uses as an accompaniment to every meal.  The sales of fresh juice is  great also, since it is very hot where we live.  In addition, the natural drinks are very healthy and refresh the body, and people prefer them as they are rich in vitamins.  The juices we sell the most are those of Melon, orange juice, lime juice, and Watermelon juice.
Right now, all of the products have suffered a rise in prices and everything is more expensive. As a result, we need a loan in order to be able to inject capital into our business and continue to meet the demand of our clients, who are many since we sell our goods in the municipal market of San Lorenzo.  We need your help to accomplish our goals.
Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

hola nuestro grupo Nuevo Amanecer esta conformado por 2 socias mas, en total somos 3, Sonia F. 46 años de edad, Mayra L. de 35 años de edad y la sra Vera H. de 35 años de edad todas nosotras tenemos el apoyo de nuestros esposos para la alimentacion de nuestras familias.
nuestero grupo tiene 14 años de conocernos todas vivimos en San Lorenzo, departamento de Valle, 
nuestro rubro es el de venta de tortillas y refrescos naturales, en nuestro pais la tortilla es un alimento indispensable ya que casi toda la poblacion la utiliza como acompañante de los tres tiempos de comida, 
la venta de refrescos naturales es muy buena tambien ya que en el lugar en donde nosotros vivimos es muy caliente y los frescos naturales ademas que son saludables refrescan el cuerpo y la gente los prefiere ya que son ricos en vitaminas. los que mas se venden son los de melon, naranja, lima y sandia.
en estos momentos todos los productos han sufrido una alza en sus precios y todo esta mas caro, por lo que necesitamos un prestamo para poderle inyectar capital a nuestros negocios y asi poder cubrir con la demanda de nuestos clientes que son muchos ya que nuestras ventas las realizamos en el mercado municipal de San Lorenzo.
necesitamos la ayuda para cumplir nuestas metas.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, salt, lime, fruits, water and sugar.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es:
Clemencia has always had the desire to bring out feminine beauty so she decided to study cosmetology. She began working part time in a beauty salon, and after gaining some experience she was able to open her own salon. In addition to doing good work, she has the qualities of charisma, cheerfulness and good taste, which bring her many clients—clients who come with many requests and for whom she provides new services. Clemencia has in mind several beauty products she would like to buy to complete her salon and to offer better service to the clients who have made this beauty salon one of the most popular in the area. Toward this end, Clemencia appeals to you for your financial support and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Clemencia siempre tuvo gran inclinación por resaltar la belleza femenina, es por ello que decidió estudiar cosmetología, se inició trabajando medio tiempo en un salón de belleza, luego de adquirir mayor experiencia pudo abrir e implementar su propio salón. Su trabajo es complementado con su carisma, alegría y buen gusto, cualidades que le permiten contar con gran cantidad de clientes, clientes que al mismo tiempo le hacen un sin fin de solicitudes y nuevos servicios. Clemencia tiene en mente adquirir algunos artículos de belleza, para terminar de implementar su salón y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes que hacen de este centro de belleza en uno de los más concurrido de su localidad. Con ese fin Clemencia recurre a ustedes para un apoyo económico que promete pagar debidamente.

loans.use: To buy the beauty products needed to complete her salon and offer better service to her clients

loans.name: Pama

texts.en:
Pama M., 34, is married with 2 children. She has 3 years of experience in the Vegetable Garden business. She sells to the village people 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Pama’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All the loan money will be used to start the business.

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizers, and equipment

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary and her hard-working husband acquired a car several years ago in order to provide public transportation in their community. Thanks to the efforts of both and the good maintenance of their vehicle during these years, they have been able to prevent many mechanical problems. Now, this indispensable tool of their trade, having covered great distances, is in need of repair. It is for this purpose that they are asking for a loan. The money, which Mary hopes to receive from generous donors, will be repaid within 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Mary y su laborioso esposo hace algunos años adquirieron un automóvil a fin de brindar servicio de transporte a su comunidad, gracias al esfuerzo de ambos y al cuidado que le dieron a su movilidad durante estos años pudieron evitarse de muchos problemas mecánicos.Ahora, su indispensable herramienta de trabajo tras contar con enormes distancias de recorrido necesita ser reparada, es por ello que recurren a tu persona con el fin de solicitarte un préstamo, dinero que en estos momentos doña Mary espera recibir de vuestros generosos corazones con el compromiso de retornar en un lapso no mayor de los 6 meses.

loans.use: Repair mechanical problems of the automobile that is used for public transportation

loans.name: Tatupu

texts.en:
Tatupu M., 53, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the village people 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Tatupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All the loan money will be used to start the business.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, and material

loans.name: Lanuola

texts.en:
Lanuola L., 44, is married with 8 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to friends, relatives, and the local community; also, in harvest season, they supply the public market 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Lanuola’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan money will also support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband is self-employed and works to maintain the business.

loans.use: Purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, weedkiller sprayer machine, shovel, bushknife, and wire for fence

loans.name: Santa Juliana

texts.es:
Santa Juliana is very popular at the Cerro Colorado market in the city of Juliaca. After she gave birth to her beloved children, she decided to leave her hometown of Huata with the hope of finding a better future for them. This devoted mother began selling groceries as a street vendor until she had enough savings to acquire a stall in the market. Currently, Santa Juliana’s stall is very busy with customers who are well satisfied with the affordable prices and with the attention they receive from her. Thanks to the income from her business, she succeeded in providing a good education for her three children who are now all professionals and independent. The greatest treasure of this loving and charming woman is her grandson who has become the light of her life and for whom she wants to proviD. security and tranquility. She hopes that with your support, she will be able to expand her business, buy merchandise and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Santa Juliana es muy popular y querida dentro del mercado Cerro Colorado D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, desD. que les dio el don D. vida a sus queridos hijos decidió abandonar su pueblo natal, Huata, con la esperanza D. buscar un mejor porvenir para los suyos.Esta diligente y amorosa madre se inició vendiendo abarrotes en forma ambulatoria, luego D. ahorrar lo suficiente pudo finalmente adquirir un puestito D. venta al interior del mercado. Actualmente su puesto es muy concurrido por sus clientes, clientes que se sienten satisfechos por los cómodos precios y buena atención que reciben D. esta esmerada madre. Gracias a este negocio, logró brindarle estudios superiores a sus 3 hijos, quienes ya son profesionales e independientes.El tesoro más granD. D. esta amorosa y encantadora mujer su querido nieto, quien se convirtió en la alegría D. su vida y a quien desea ofrecer seguridad y tranquilidad, espera que con el apoyo que reciba D. vosotros pueda ampliar su negocio, comprar mercadería y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: To increase the merchandise at her grocery stall in order to provide a secure future for her beloved grandson.

loans.name: Muta

texts.en:
Muta P., 35, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to friends, relatives,and the local community; also in harvest season they supply the public market 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).

SPBD loans are Muta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.The loan will also support her children's school fees and her church contribution. Her husband is self employed and works to maintain the business.

loans.use: Purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, weedkiller sprayer machine, shovel, bushknife, and wire for fence

loans.name: Lauama

texts.en:
Lauama S., 39, is married with 2 children. She has 4 years of experience in the Vegetable Garden business. She sells to the village people 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).

SPBD loans are Lauama’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use all the loan money to start the business.

loans.use: Buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer for soil, also spade

loans.name: Ofu

texts.en:
Ofu V., 49, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the grocery business. She sells to the whole district community and relatives, and also tourists as they drive past, 7 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Ofu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will also support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband is self-employed and works to maintain the business.

loans.use: Purchase a sack of rice, flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, snacks and twisties, bag of chewing gum and lollies, a new scale, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
An affectionate mother, Juliana’s dearest wish is to be able to provide an excellent education for her two beloved children. The economic situation of Juliana’s family allowed her to finish only secondary school, but she always demonstrated great enthusiasm for improving herself and for persevering in life, and this is how, with effort and dedication, she succeeded in opening a “bodeguita”—a small store. Over a period of years, this little general store has become one of the busiest in town. Thanks to the success of her store and profits made by her husband, they were able to build a second and third floor to their house. Now they can rent out the rooms, and the money earned will partially cover the cost of their children’s education. Your support gives hope to this devoted mother. With the borrowed money, she will be able to increase the merchandise in her store and save toward her children’s university education.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Juliana es una madre muy cariñosa y humilde de corazón, las posibilidades económicas de su familia sólo le permitieron concluir sus estudios secundarios, pero siempre demostró gran entusiasmo por superarse y perseverar en la vida, es así que con esfuerzo y dedicación logró abrir su pequeña bodeguita que durante estos largos años le costo implementar.Esta tiendita con el transcurso de los años se convirtió en una de las bodeguitas más concurridas de su localidad, gracias a ello y a los beneficios que con esfuerzo consigue su esposo, pudieron construir la segunda y tercera planta de su vivienda, habitaciones que ahora se encuentran en alquiler, dinero con el que logran cubrir en parte la educación de sus hijosEl anhelo más grande que Juliana cobija en su corazón es poder brindarle estudios superiores a sus 2 amados hijos, esta diligente madre se encuentra esperanzada en tu apoyo, con el dinero solicitado podrá incrementar la mercadería de su tienda, y podrá tener más ahorros para solventar la universidad de sus hijos.

loans.use: Increase the merchandise for her store, save money to pay university costs for her children

loans.name: Sareta

texts.en:
Sareta S., 56, is married with 8 children. She has 4 years of experience in the sewing business. Her business serves the people in her village 5 days per week.

Sareta has never had a loan with SPBD before. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Sareta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy needles, materials and thread to help run her business.

loans.use: To buy needles, materials, and thread.

loans.name: Tuinanau

texts.en:
Tuinanau T., 52, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the Taro and banana business. She sells her produce to her friends, relatives,and local community. Also, during the harvest season, she supplies the public market with her goods 5 days per week.

Tuinanau has had 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD). SPBD loans are Tuinanau’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband works as a self employed laborer to maintain business.

loans.use: To purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, weedkiller sprayer machine, shovel, bushknife, claves, and wire for a fence.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys is a hard-working woman who, day by day, makes the effort to support her children so that they can live without economic deprivation. Every day, after preparing the day’s meals for her children, this devoted mother leaves the house early to perform her daily function—providing public transportation for the people of Juliaqueña. Thanks to her dedication throughout her years of work, she was able to build a home and provide security and tranquility for her family. Gladys’s children are now in university and need money for school supplies. She is asking for a loan to pay for these school expenses, and with the money she earns from her work she will repay the debt within the designated time period.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys es una mujer trabajadora que día a día se esfuerza para mantener sin privaciones económicas a sus queridos hijos, esta diligente madre, desde muy temprano, luego de preparar los alimentos del día para sus hijos, abandona su hogar para cumplir su función cotidiana, brindar servicio de movilidad urbana a la población Juliaqueña.Gracias a su dedicación y entrega a lo largo de estos años de trabajo pudo hacer construir su vivienda y ofrecerles seguridad y tranquilidad a su familia. Los hijos de Gladys están ahora en la universidad y necesitan compra los útiles necesarios, cantidad de dinero con la que Gladis no cuenta, ella pide este préstamo para comprar los útiles de sus hijos y con su trabajo diario promete pagar su deuda en el plazo indicado.

loans.use: To  buy school supplies for her children attending university

loans.name: Fuaselela

texts.en:
Fuaselela F., 45, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the Taro and banana business. She sells her goods to her friends, relatives, and the local community. Also, during harvest season she supplies the public market 4 days per week with her produce.

Fuaselela has had 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Fuaselela’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband also helps operating the business.

loans.use: To purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, a weedkiller sprayer machine, shovels, bushknifes, claves, and wire for s fence.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of farming and raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. This diligent man regularly participates in the agricultural fairs that exist in his region. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Emiliano hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his lambs will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

Emiliano es un responsable padre e hijo amoroso, desde niño aprendió la noble labor de la agricultura y producción de ganado, actividades que heredó de sus padres y que ahora con satisfacción viene desempeñando. Este diligente hombre participa constantemente en las ferias agropecuarias que existe en su localidad, gracias a su valioso conocimiento de estas actividades pudo obtener buenos resultados de sus ventas. El deseo de esta emprendedor caballero es contar con mayor inversión de capital, dinero que le permite comprar y vender animales menores. Emiliano espera seguir dedicándose a esta labor, cree que mejorando la raza y alimentación de sus ovejitas y borregas mejorarán sus ingresos, es por ello que recurre a tu solidario corazón con la esperanza de recibir tu pronta respuesta.Vuestro aporte permitirá mantener en constante desarrollo a este ejemplar hombre.

loans.use: To buy a better breed of sheep and better feed so that he can continue raising and selling his livestock

loans.name: Mery Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Mery Elizabeth belongs to the May 3rd Communal Bank, in the key district, located in the Province of El Collao, region of Puno. She works buying and reselling local products such as potato flour, potatoes and grains. She sells them in the markets of Juliaca, Puno and Arequipa. At 15 years old she learned about business because her parents at that time could not afford her educational expenses.

Now she is 27 years old, with a husband of the same age, and she has a secondary school education. They have a daughter and both have continued with the business in order to support their household. To do this, they decided to take out a loan to deal with the demand for merchandise requested by customers. The first loan was for 300 new soles ($125), which they received from the Communal Bank. With the loan they bought 20 arrobas (500 pounds) of potatoes and 10 arrobas (250 pounds) of potato flour which they sold, and as they continue having demand, they need an additional loan.

With this loan of 1,200 new soles ($450), which she will repay over 4 months, she will buy 30 arrobas (750 pounds) of quinoa which she will take directly to the city of Arequipa.

Her future vision is to have a delivery vehicle that she can use to move or transport merchandise from one place to another and sell her products to be a great wholesaler. She also wishes for her daughter to study to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mery Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal 3 de mayo, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia El Collao Ilave de la región de Puno. Se dedica a la compra y venta de los productos de la zona como: chuño, papa y cereales, y los comercializa en los mercados de Juliaca, Puno y Arequipa. A los 15 años de edad aprendió a negociar por necesidad ya que sus padres en ese entonces no podían solventar sus gastos en educación.

Ahora ella tiene 27 años de edad, cuyo nivel de instrucción es secundaria completa y su esposo también tiene la misma edad. Tienen una hija, ambos han continuado con el negocio emprendido para sostener su hogar. Por ello decidieron acceder al crédito para cubrir la demanda de los mercados que les pedían, y primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que recibió del Banco Comunal con el cual compró 20 arrobas de papa y 10 arrobas de chuño el cual los comercializo y como sigue teniendo demanda sigue adquiriendo más crédito.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprará 30 arrobas de quinua que llevará directamente a la ciudad de Arequipa.

Su visión futura es tener un vehículo de carga para trasladar o transportar mercadería de un lugar al otro y capitalizarse para ser un gran mayorista, y que su hija estudie para ser una profesional.

loans.use: Purchase quinoa (a grain) in bulk.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta S., 32, is married with 1 child. She has 4 years of experience running her Vegetable Garden business. She sells her vegetables to the public 5 days per week.

Henrietta has had no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Henrietta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband helps out with the business as well.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and also for home improvement

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia S., 37, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the Taro and banana business. She sells bananas and taro to her friends, relatives, and the local community. Also, during the harvest season she supplies the public market with her produce 3 days per week.

Amelia has had 5 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD). SPBD loans are Amelia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.This loan will support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband also helps to operate the business.

loans.use: To purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, a weedkiller sprayer machine, shovels, a bushknife, claves, and wire for a fence.

loans.name: Taase

texts.en:
Taase N., 44, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells the produce to friends, relatives, and the local community. Also, during the harvest season she supplies the public market with bananas and taro 3 days per week.

Taase has had 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). SPBD loans are Taase’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband also helps to operate the business.

loans.use: To purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, a weedkiller sprayer machine, shovels, a bushknife, claves, and wire for a fence.

loans.name: Fitu

texts.en:
Fitu M., 33, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells her produce to friends, relatives, and the local community. Also, during the harvest season she supplies the public market with bananas and taro 3 days per week.

Fitu has had 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Fitu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband also helps to operate the business.

loans.use: To purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, a weedkiller sprayer machine, shovels, a bushknife, claves, and wire for a fence.

loans.name: Glenis Guadalupe

texts.es:
Glenis is asking for a loan because a few years ago she began the process of improving her home. She is bricking the living room of her house, which she does little by little because she has a low income and has a family to provide for with her husband, who works for a construction company.

Glenis has two children, a 2 year-old daughter and a 15 year-old son. She has a store in her house, which she opened with her husband's savings and assistance. In her first business she sold soft drinks and within two years has been able to improve her inventory in variety and quality.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Glenis está solicitando el crédito porque desde hace algún tiempo se encuentra en proceso de mejoramiento de vivienda, pondá ladrillos en la sala de su vivienda, el cual lo tiene que hacer poco a poco, ya que sus ingresos son bajos, y también tiene una familia que mantener junto a su esposo, él es albañil y trabaja en una empresa de construcción. Tiene 2 hijos una niña de 2 años y un varón de 15 años. Glenis tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, el negocio lo empezó con ahorro y ayuda de su esposo. Su primer negocio fue la venta de refrescos y en 2 años ha podido incrementar su inventario en variedad y calidad.

loans.use: Brick the living room of her house

loans.name: Carmelo De Jesús

texts.es:
Carmelo B. is a humble laborer who comes from a simple family that has taught him the value of hard work. Carmelo works as a mechanic, a job that has supported him the past 20 years.

Carmelo is single and has two sons, 8 and 9 years old, for whom he works hard to provide daily meals. He also tries to be a good example for his sons so that in the future they will be good people. Thanks to his dedication to his work he was able to become independent, as he began as an assistant mechanic.

Carmelo hopes for a future in which he can open her own workshop. But, for now, he will increase the safety of his house by building a wall which will protect him from the delinquents that live in his neighborhood, Hialeah.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.
