Before starting this business, he was a taxi driver. Currently the restaurant going well and he would like to expand the shelter so he can serve more customers. Davit is requesting a loan of US$700 to expand his restaurant.

loans.use: To expand his restaurant

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Single and 26 years old with one child, Mr. Yawo A. was born in Missawomé, a village in Togo. Not having had much education, he left his village very early for the city of Lomé where he hoped to earn a living. He then got involved in small businesses. These experiences served him well because he was able to choose and succeed in one of these businesses since 2005, namely the buying and selling of assorted general food products. He is a retailer and often adapts to his customers’ needs which has given him a monopoly over most of his customers compared to his competitors. In order to better serve his customers, Mr. A. would like to take out his first loan so he can increase his stock by buying 10 boxes of beverages and 8 sacks of rice.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Célibataire, âgé de 26 ans, avec un enfant à la charge, monsieur A. Yawo est né à Missawomé un village du TOGO. N’ayant pas trop fréquenté, il quitta très tôt son village pour la ville de Lomé où il compte gagner sa vie. C’est ainsi qu’il s’est lancé dans de petits commerces. Ces expériences lui ont servit car il a su choisir et exceller dans l’un des commerces depuis 2005, l’achat et vente de divers produits d’alimentation générale. Il est alors détaillant et s’adapte souvent au besoin de ses clients ce qui fait qu’il monopolise la plupart des clients face à ses concurrents. Dans le souci de mieux servir ses clients, monsieur A., voudrait prendre ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de 10 cartons de boisson et de 8 sacs de riz.

loans.use: Purchase of staple products

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov C. (shown in the picture with her daughter), 42, and her husband, Mr. Pich Pin, 36, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Their oldest daughter is a silk weaver and two of the children are in a local school.

Mrs. Sreypov has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Pich is a hairdresser in the village.

Sreypov is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material for her weaving business and to buy a hairdresser’s chair for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and buy a hairdresser’s chair for her husband

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun B., 58, and her husband, Mr. Sokhorn Khat, 58, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married during the Pol Pot regime and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Their oldest daughter is married and another one is a silk weaver. Two sons are in a local school and one is in university.

Mrs. Saroeun has been a silk weaver since 1979, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sokhorn is a farmer. He grows rice, tomatoes, and corn on his farm.

Saroeun is requesting a loan of US$100 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Kanzoro Marie Thérès

texts.fr:
Married with one child, Mrs. Kanzoro Marie Thérèse D. was born in Lomé on February 6, 1979. She gave herself one challenge in life: to run a successful business. After thoroughly studying the lay of the land, she got involved in the sale of plastic goods--utensils, chairs, etc. She is the sole retailer in the area, which has given her a monopoly. Thus, her business is experiencing amazing growth. At this stage of growth, an increase in her working capital would be welcomed. This is why she is asking for her first loan, which will allow her to increase her total number of chairs to 100.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée mère d’un enfant, madame D. Kanzoro Marie Thérèse est née à Lomé le 06 février 1979. Elle s’est lancé un défit dans la vie : réussir son propre affaire. Après une étude minutieuse du terrain, elle s’est lancée en 2006 dans la vente d’articles en plastiques, ustensiles, chaises… Elle est la seule détaillante dans le milieu, ce qui fait qu’elle a le monopole. L’activité connaît alors une croissance fulgurante. A ce stade de sa croissance, une augmentation de son fonds de commerce serait bien venue. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce premier prêt qui lui permettra d’augmenter le stock de ses chaises de 100.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic chairs

loans.name: Afouavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afouavi L. was born in Lomé. She is 40 years old, married, and has 6 children. She is a fighting woman who has struggled a lot to meet the needs of her family. Since 1993, this courageous woman has sold cooking utensils as well as corn, which she sells at the market not far from her house. She would like to boost her sales by varying the types of cooking utensils she has and also by increasing her supply of corn. This loan, her first, will allow her to buy 5 sacks of corn and 15 boxes of utensils.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Madame L. Afouavi est née à Lomé. Elle a 40ans, mariée avec 06 enfants à la charge. C’est une femme battante qui lutte beaucoup pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Depuis 1993, cette brave femme est dans la vente des ustensiles de cuisine qu’elle distribue et de céréale, le maïs qu’elle vend au marché non loin de chez elle. Elle voudrait à présent donner un coup de pousse à son activité, en variant la gamme de ses ustensiles de cuisines, et aussi augmenter son stock de maïs. Ainsi ce premier crédit lui permettra d’acheter 5sacs de maïs, 15cartons d’ustensiles.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and cooking utensils

loans.name: Theng

texts.en:
Mr. Theng Y., 44, and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Chhoeng, 39, live along national road number one about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2003 and have one daughter.   

Mr. Theng has been a motor taxi (Tuk Tuk) driver since 2005. He works in Phnom Penh City, while his wife works at home caring for their daughter. Currently his motor taxi is broken needs repair. Also, the staircase to their home is old and needs fixing. He is requesting a loan of $1200 to repair his motor taxi and make a new staircase to replace the old one.

loans.use: To make a new staircase to replace the old one and repair his motor taxi (Tuk Tuk)

loans.name: Chanbunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Chanbunthoeun N., 32,  and his family live in a small village off of National Road Two about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh.  Chanbunthoeun and his wife, Mrs. Chinda Dok, 27, have been married since 2001 and have one daughter.

Mr. Chanbunthoeun has been driving a motorbike taxi in Phnom Penh for seven years. His wife is a garment factory worker. Phnom Penh may well be one of the world’s largest cities, but it doesn't have even one municipal bus.  Motorbike taxis and tuk-tuks, with the rare exception of an automobile taxi, are only way to get around.  On a good day, Chanbunthoeun can make about 25,000 Riel (US) $6.  

He is requesting a loan of US$1000 to fill up the ground around his house and lift it higher so his family can keep dry during the rainy season.

loans.use: To fill up the ground and lift his house higher

loans.name: Essossina Group

texts.fr:
Essossina is a partnership composed of three women that was created in 2007. Its goal is to increase the living conditions of its members by way of economic ventures, to create solidarity within the group, and to foster mutual aid among its three members. All three women are married and they range between 30 and 40 years of age. This group has taken out a loan before and repaid it in full. The women are involved in the buying and selling of grains, boubous (types of robes), and sewing materials. They would like to take out a loan to buy 4 sacks of corn, 1 sack of millet, 30 scarves, and 10 boubous.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

ESSOSSINA est un groupe de solidarité constitué de trois femmes crée en 2007. Il a pour objectif d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres par l’exercice des activités économiques et de créer une solidarité en son sein et faire des entraides mutuelles entre les membres. Ils sont tous mariés et leur âge varie entre 30 et 40 ans. Cette association a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé. Ces femmes exercent le commerce de céréales, des boubous, et des articles de mercerie. Actuellement, elles désirent renouveler leur crédit pour acheter 4 sacs de maïs, 1 sac de mil, 30 foulards et 10 boubous.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials and grains

loans.name: Ama Egnonam

texts.fr:
Born on March 16, 1974 in Atakpamé, Togo, Mrs. Ama Egnonam O. now lives in Lomé and is married with two children. She never received an education, but she knows how to get by in life. Starting in 2004, she got into the charcoal business, a field in which she is an expert. She learned how to make charcoal when she was young from her mother, who also made charcoal. Thus, she knows how to discern high quality charcoal, which she then offers to her customers. She buys charcoal from the surrounding villages that she then resells in Lomé. The only problem that Mrs. Ofriman has encountered is that she does not have enough money to buy sufficient quantities of charcoal. She has to travel often to buy charcoal, which increases her costs. Thus she is requesting her first loan so she can increase her working capital and decrease her costs as a result.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 16 mars 1974 à Atakpamé au TOGO, madame O. Ama Egnonam vit aujourd’hui à Lomé, mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle n’a jamais fréquenté mais elle sait se battre dans la vie. Depuis 2004, elle a commencé le commerce de charbon, un domaine qu’elle maîtrise très bien. En effet elle a appris à faire du charbon depuis son jeune âge auprès de sa maman qui en fabriquait. Ainsi elle sait distinguer la bonne qualité qu’elle met à la disposition de sa clientèle. Elle en achète dans les villages environnants qu’elle revend ensuite à Lomé. Le seul problème que rencontre madame OFRIMAN, c’est qu’elle ne dispose pas d’assez de fonds pour en acheter en quantité suffisante. Elle fait alors régulièrement le déplacement ce qui augmente ses charges. C’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son fonds de roulement afin d’amoindrie ses charges.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Mamata

texts.fr:
Mamata D. is 39 years old, married, and mother of five. She lives in Wome, a city about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She resells loincloths and other products. Mamata would like to use her loan to buy two rolls of cloth, boxes of milk, bags of rice, boxes of soap and jars of jam. This would allow her to grow her business, increase her income, and provide for her children.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Mamata D. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle réside à Wome, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé la capitale togolaise. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes et des produits divers. Mamata souhaite par ce crédit acheter 2 balles de pagnes, des cartons de laits, des sacs de riz, des cartons de savons et des boîtes de conserves. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, de tirer plus de profits et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other goods to grow her business

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr:
Rafiatou D. is 29 years old, married, and mother of two. She runs a shop in which she sells luggage and other products in Wome, a city about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She would like to use this loan to buy bags; boxes of soap, sugar, and milk; jars of jam; and plastic bowls in order to resell them. The growth of her business will allow her to earn more to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Rafiatou D. est âgée de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle tient une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des sacs de voyage et d’autres produits divers à Womé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire avec ce crédit, acheter des sacs, des cartons de savons, de sucres, de laits et de boîtes de conserves ainsi que des bassines en plastique pour la revente. L’augmentation de la capacité de son commerce lui, permettra de gagner plus pour l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy goods to resell in her shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr:
Gilbert T. is 37 years old, married, and father of three. He lives in Wome, a city about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He distills “sodabi,” a liquor made from palm wine. Gilbert would like to use this loan to buy palm trees from which to get the wine, which he will use to make the liquor. This loan would allow Gilbert to increase his business and sales, and thus his family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Gilbert T. est âgé de 37 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite à Wome, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est distillateur de « sodabi », une liqueur préparée à base de vin de palme. Gilbert souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des palmiers pour en tirer le vin qui lui servira à préparer de la liqueur. Ce crédit permettra à Gilbert d’augmenter la capacité de son activité et de ses ventes, et par ricochet l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy palm trees from which to get wine for liquor sales

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi A. is 32 years old, married, and a father of two children who are in school. He lives in Wome, a city about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been driving a motorcycle taxi for more than two years and wants to use this loan to buy a new motorcycle to improve his work conditions and to earn more money which will improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Komi A. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants tous à l’école. Il habite à Wome, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est conducteur de taxi moto depuis plus de 2 ans et désire par ce crédit acquérir une nouvelle moto pour améliorer les conditions de son travail et de gagner plus de sous qui permettra une amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for his taxi business

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
Thérèse S., 35, is a widow raising 2 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Kadior for two years. She intends to invest her loan in selling cosmetics (perfumes, deodorants, bath gels, body lotions, etc.) in a conveniently located canteen in town to bolster her business. Her income will allow her to contribute to daily expenses and improve living conditions for her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Thérèse S., 35 ans, veuve, 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kadior depuis 2 ans. Elle compte investir son prêt dans la vente de produits cosmétiques (parfums, déodorants, gels de bain, crèmes pour le corps etc…) dans une cantine bien placée en ville pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Purchase of cosmetics to be sold in a canteen

Achat de produits cosmétiques à vendre dans une cantine

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata D., 46, is married and the mother of 7 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Khodoba in Thiès for 7 years. She is also responsible for one other child. She wants a loan to pursue her business selling fruit, cola, and thioub (locally dyed cloth). It’s a business that is going well. Fatoumata wants to improve the living conditions and health of her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Fatoumata D., 46 ans mariée, mère de 07 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba à Thiès depuis 7 ans. Elle a aussi un autre enfant à sa charge. Elle veut un prêt pour poursuivre son commerce de fruits, cola et thioub (tissu teinté). C’est une activité qui marche bien pour elle. Fatoumata cherche à améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Selling fruit, cola, and thioub (locally dyed cloth)

commerce de fruits, cola et thioub

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Seynabou G., 43, is married and the mother of 7 children with 2 other children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Khodoba in Thiès for 7 years. Her business is buying and selling seasonal fruit (mangoes, oranges, mandarins, etc.) Her income permits her to improve the living conditions and health of her family and pay school fees for her children. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Seynabou G., 43 ans mariée, mère de 07 enfants avec 02 autres enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba à Thiès depuis 7 ans. Elle achète les fruits de saison (mangues, oranges, mandarine etc) et revend pour poursuivre son commerce de fruits. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
buying and selling seasonal fruit

commerce de fruits de saison

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou M., 52, is married and raising one child. She has been a member of the village bank of Khodoba in Thiès for 7 and ½ years. She buys seasonal fruit (mangoes, oranges, mandarins, etc.) and cartons of eggs and retails these items. The income from her business allows her to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Fatou M., 52 ans mariée, 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba à Thiès depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle achète des fruits de saison (mangues, oranges, mandarine etc) et des tablettes d’œufs et revend au détail. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Buying and selling fruit and eggs

Achat et revente de fruits et œufs

loans.name: Lang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lang is a 46 year old woman. She is living with her husband; her 2 children have grown up. Her husband is a bronze-smith worker, whose frequent income is about 1,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She has been a TYM partner since 1998. For 10 years, she has been using the loans efficiently; the family’s financial situation has improved, and one of her 2 children is attending a college. In order to renovate the farm, she plans to borrow 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong. Family’s frequent income is about 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lăng năm nay 46 tuổi. Hiện nay chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành. Chồng chị đi đúc đồng thuê cho thu nhập ổn định 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Đến nay qua 10 năm sử dụng vốn vay đúng mục đích và có hiệu quả kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng ổn định. Chị là người phụ nữ rất chăm chỉ, chịu khó và có rất ngiều kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi vì thế dự án chăn nuôi của gia đình chị luôn mang lại hiệu quả cao nhờ đó chị đã nuôi được 1 con trưởng thành, 1 con đang học đại học. Để có vốn đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại phục vụ cho chăn nuôi vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 9.000.000đ

Thu nhập bình quân 2.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: invest in live-stock farm

loans.name: Gam Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Gam Thi P. is a 33 year old woman. She has 2 small children. In 2000, she became a TYM partner, making loans to invest in order to improve her family’s financial situation. She has been using most of the loans to buy scrap-iron in adjacent areas and then reselling it to manufacturers; the rest of the loans are invested in a live-stock farm. For 8 years, the family budget has been greatly growing; they saved money to build a small 4-roomed house and to provide their children with the most possible facilities. She plans to use the next loan of 9,000,000 to renovate the farm and buy 5 more pigs. Family’s frequent income is 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Gấm năm nay 33 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có hai con còn nhỏ. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để làm ăn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Chị đã sử dụng phần lớn vốn vay cho chồng đi thu mua phế liệu về bán, phần còn lại chị đầu tư mua lợn về nuôi. Qua 8 năm tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế nhà chị đã tăng lên rõ rệt, anh chị đã tiết kiệm và xây được 4 gian nhà ngói và có điều kiện để đầu tư, chăm sóc cho các con nhiều hơn.Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9.000.000đ sể sủa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm 5 con lợn về nuôi.

Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: invest in live-stock farm

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr:
Rokhaya P., 44, is married and responsible for 11 children and 2 other people. She has been a member of the village bank of Mbirdiam in Thiès for 7 and ½ years. She wants to buy merchandise (oil, rice, candy) for her little village store and baskets of mangoes to sell by the piece. The income from her business will permit her to improve the living conditions and health of her family and pay school fees for her children. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Rokhaya P., 44 ans mariée, 11 enfants et 02 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbirdiam à Thiès depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de la marchandise (huile, riz, bonbon) pour sa boutique villageoise et des paniers de mangues à revendre au détail. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise and fruit for resale in her village shop

Achat de produits pour boutique villageoise et de fruits à revendre

loans.name: Mazizini Ushirika Group

texts.en:
Praxeda F., age 36, is married with three children (ages 11, 6 and 4). She has been selling powdered soap for 5 months now..She works from 10am to 6pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$45.

In the past, Prexida has taken one loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She hope for a new loan to increase her business. She will share this loan with her group, Mazizini Ushirika, which totals 16 members.These members hold each other accountable for back their loans.

In the picture Prexeda is 3rd from left standing

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
Wilber is a diligent young man who finished high school a few months ago. His financial limitations did not allow him to continue his studies at University, so he opted to continue studying at a Technical College. This young man, with the support of his brothers, decided to work as a blacksmith, making a variety of steel rings for cord. This small, but indispensable business generates the income that allows him to cover the costs of school. Wilber is hard-working but does not have sufficient raw materials to continue making steel rings at this time. He needs a loan of $375, money with which he plans to purchase iron and wire to continue his work.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva volunteer.

Wilber es un diligente joven que hace algunos meses concluyó sus estudios secundarios, sus posibilidades económicas no le permiten seguir estudios universitarios, por ello, optó por continuar una carrera técnica superior. Actualmente este joven, con el apoyo de sus hermanos decidió dedicarse a elaborar variedad de argollas para sogas, este pequeño, pero indispensable negocio le está generando ingresos que le permiten cubrir las necesidades de sus estudios superiores.Este joven hacendoso en estos momentos no cuenta con suficiente materia prima para seguir elaborando sus argollas, desea obtener un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero con el que tiene planeado comprar fierro y alambre para seguir con su trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase iron and wire to continue making steel rings for cord, enabling him to pay for technical school.

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Hello, our group is called “El Amanecer” (the dawn), all of us are merchants and have small businesses, which we manage.  Thanks to these businesses we can contribute to our family expenses and offer our children a better education and lifestyle.  Considering that the economic situation in our country gets more difficult every day, we decided to look for a way to finance our businesses.  We currently need more merchandise to be able to offer our clients a variety of products.  

These are the activities we work on:

Ana H.:  I have a small store were I sell agribusiness products, located in the downtown area of my community.  I’ve worked on this activity for several years, I use the income to help my husband with the family expenses.  I am married and have three children that are in school.

Elizabeth R. H.:  I work making and selling delicacies, I sell them in my community.  I have two children who are in school; thanks to this business they have the opportunity to study. 

Fidelia F.: Hello, I make and sell delicacies, I sell them in a Basic Education Center located in my community.  I have two children.  At this time I need to purchase more products to make more food and this way be able to offer more variety and increase my income, which I need to provide for my family.
Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

hola nuestro grupo se llama EL AMANECER todas nosotras somos comerciantes y contamos con pequeños negocios los cuales son administrados personalmente por nosotras y gracias a estos negocios podemos colaborar con los gastos de nuestras familias y asi poder ofrecer a nuestros hijos una mejor educacion y estilo de vida. 
Tomando en cuenta que la situacion economica en nuestro pais es cada dia mas dificil por lo que decidimos trabajar y buscar financiamiento para nuestros negocios.
Actualmente necesitamos surtir mas y asi poder ofrecer a nuestros clientes una mejor varidad de productos.

estas son las actividades que nosotras hacemos:

Ana H.: cuento con una pequeña tienda de venta de agro insumos agropecuarios la cual la tengo ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para apoyar a mi esposo con los gastos familiares, soy casada y tenemos tres hijos los cuales los tres estan en la escuela.

Elizabeth R. H.: me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas, las que distribuyo de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, tengo 2 hijos los cuales los tengo estudiando, y gracias a este negocio mis hijos tienen la oportunidad de estudiar.

Fidelia F.: hola me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas las que distribuyo en un centro de Educacion Basica de mi comunidad, tengo 2 hijos, actualmente necesito comprar mas producto para hacer mas golosinas y asi poder ofrecer mas variedad de golosinas y tener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesito para alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase wheat and corn flour, sugar, basic grains, dairy, deli, tortillas, meat and agribusiness products.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua D. sells different varieties of oil and other foodstuffs. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Ekua and her three children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna N., 39, is married with 5 children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Santhiaba for a year and a half. She has a little shop in Boucotte open-air market where she sells unisex clothing, toiletries, underwear, cloth, and shoes. Maimouna wants to bolster her business and help her husband to cope with family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Maimouna N., 39 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba 1 depuis 1 ans et demi. Elle dispose d'une cantine au marché boucotte ou elle vend des habits unisexe, effets de toilette, linge de corps, tissus et chaussures. Maimouna veut renforcer son commerce et aider son époux sur les différentes charges familiales . Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
buying and selling clothing and toiletries

Achat et revente d'habit et effet de toilette

loans.name: Solidaridad Y Union Group

texts.es:
Hello, our group is called “Solidaridad y Union” (solidarity and union). Our group’s characteristic is that we are truly united and we are all responsible with our payments, meaning that we are on time with our payments. This is the second loan we request.

We have been working as a group for five years, during this time we have been able to get organized and form our own businesses, in which we do very well. We make lollipops, jelly, "flan" (cream caramel), candy, etc. We make desserts. One of us goes out to sell and the rest stay at home because we also have clients come to the houses to buy our products. Thanks to the first loan we were able to grow our businesses. At this time the sales are high and we can’t keep up with the demand, this is why we need your help, so that we can make our businesses grow more and this way meet the needs of our clients. Thanks to this activity we have been able to get our families ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

hola nuestro grupo se llama Silidaridad y Union, la cualidad de nuestro grupo es que somos bien unidas y todas somos resposables en nuestros pagos es decir que somo puntuales en nuestros pagos, este es el segundo credito que estamos solicitando.

tenemos cinco años de trabajar como grupo, en estos años hemos podido organizarnos para crear nuestros propios negocios en los cuales nos va muy bien, nosotras nos dedicamos a elaborar paletas, gelatinas, flanes, dulces etc, todo lo que hacemos son postres, unas de nosotros sale a la calle a vender nuestos productos y otras se quedan en las casas porque ahi tambien llegan muchos de nuestros clientes a comprar nuestros productos, gracias a la primer ayuda logramos hacer crecer nuestros negocios, pero en este momento las ventas son bastantes y no nos damos abasto para tener la demanda de nuestros productos, por tal razon estamos solicitando nos ayuden una vez mas para poder hacer crecer mas nuestos negocios y asi poder cumplir con las necesidades de nuestros clientes. gracias a estas actividades hemos logrado salir adelante con nuestras familias.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make desserts

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is thirty five years old. She has three children who are in school. She has been trading in weave-ons and local soaps for ten years now. Her dream is to expand her shop to include assorted weave-ons and hair creams, shampoo and activators to make it a one-stop shop for her customers, especially beauticians who typically demand such items. She is a group member of “Yesu Nti” (meaning for the sake of Christ) Trust Group. Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy assorted weave-ons and hair creams, shampoo and activators

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is forty years old. She is a wife and mother of two children. She is a resourceful mother and a successful business woman. She works hard to support her children in school. At the moment, her two children are in senior high school.

Augustina sells linen, sewing materials and flowers. She has inadequate working capital to support her business growth. She believes that with the loan, she will better be able to supply her customers with quality products. She hopes to increase her income, since quality comes with a higher price she can charge her customers. Augustina wants to use the loan to buy more pieces of linen clothes, sewing materials and flowers.

Augustina belongs to the community group called Beloved Trust Group. In this group, members agree to act as social collateral to guarantee access to loans and to help repay the loans for one another.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of linen clothes, sewing materials and flowers.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa, 52 years old, is married with six children, all of whom are still in school. Theresa believes in hard work and dedication. Trading for the past twenty years, she has amassed lots of marketing experience, making her one of the successful traders in the Koforidua market in Ghana. She trades in batik tie and die, kente clothes, lace materials and school uniforms. For lack of adequate working capital, she mostly buys her supplies on credit at a relatively high price and pays it back when the goods are sold. She believes a loan will enable her to grow her business. She wants to use the loan to purchase batik tie and die, lace clothes, kente clothes and school uniforms in bulk to enable her to reduce her cost of sales. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. She is a member of the community group called Blessing Trust group. The group guarantees a loan through a repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To purchase batik tie and die, lace clothes, kente clothes and school uniforms in bulk

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 56 year old business woman. She is married with four children. Currently, two of them have successfully completed teacher training school. She has been a seamstress for twenty years. She sews all forms of womans clothes with various kinds of styles that suit the tastes of her customers like kabas and slits, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes. She also sells clothing materials and trains two apprentices in sewing. She would like to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, and thimbles to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to provide her daughter with a quality education. She is a member of the community group called Royal Priesthood Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans.  Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount. Janet is the photograph standing and wearing green outfit with one of her apprentices.

loans.use: To buy supplies of sewing material

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is a fine lady. She is a 38 year old business woma, a wife and a mother of three children. She trades in batik tie and die and lace materials. She would like to use the loan to purchase to buy those items in build and begin selling jewelry.  She plans to use part of her profits to provide her children with quality education. She is a member of the community group called ‘For Christ Trust group’. The group guarantees a loan through repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To purchase batik tie and die, lace clothes and jewelry

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 54 years old. She is married with five children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, and biscuits in the local market. She wants to use the loan to buy her goods in bulk to expand her business. Rose hopes to make good income from the expanded business to enable her provide the children with quality education. She belongs to the community group called ‘Beloved Trust Group’. The group guarantees a loan through repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy rice, canned foods, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders in bulk

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 47 years old. She is a wife and a mother of two children.  One has completed senior high school and the other is in primary school. She has been trading in jeans, blouses and skirts, womens slippers, dressing bags and plastic materials for the past twelve years. Mercy says her working capital was provided by her husband, but is not adequate for her business; she cannot purchase quality products in large numbers. With a loan she has have resources to meet the tastes and preferences of her customers. She would like to use the loan to buy clothes, lace cloth, and linen materials. She belongs to the community group called Love Trust Group.  Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy clothes, lace cloth, and linen materials to sell.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is married with two children. She started trading at fifteen years  old and now is 32. She enjoys trading and has lots of marketing experience. She trades in underwear and ladies dressing bags.  She would like to use the loan to sell plastic materials like buckets, bowls and plates. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Love Trust Group. The group guarantees a loan through repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy plastic materials like buckets, bowls and plates to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is divorced with one child. She is a 45 year old trader. She has been trading in jeans, trousers, blouses and skirts, women slippers and dressing bags for the past nine years. Beatrice says her working capital was provided by family members and friends, but has not been adequate for her business. It is not enough to purchase high quality products in good quantities. With the loan she will be able to purchase good quality stock for her customers.  She belongs to the community group called ‘Jehovah Nissi Trust Group’. Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy more jeans, trousers, blouses and skirts, women slippers and dressing bags.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes J. is 55 years old. She is married with four children. At the moment, three have completed senior high school. She sells babies clothes, pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, and feeding bottles, as well as plastic chairs at the local market. She would like to use the loan to buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastic materials to provide her children with a good education. She is a member of the group called ‘Israel Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans and provide peer pressure to repay loans.  Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount

loans.use: To buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastic materials.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 39-year-old trader. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She has sold used clothes at the Koforidua market of Ghana for the past twelve years. With this business, she has been able to support one of children to complete senior high school.

With low capital, she is not able to buy larger bale quantities of used clothes to sell. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes, with variety, to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children’s education.

She is a member of the group called ‘Esther Trust Group’. In this group, members provide one another social collateral to access loan funds and peer pressure to repay the loan. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay. If one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a mother of two children who are currently in school. She is 43 years old. She trades in funeral clothes, lace materials and textiles. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to expand the sale of her stock. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level.

She wants to use the loan to make a bulk purchase of funeral clothes, lace materials, and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education.

Faustina belongs to the community group called ‘Jehovah Nissi Trust Group’. The group guarantees a loan through a repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay. If one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To purchase funeral clothes, lace materials, and textiles.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina is 35 years old. She is married with two children who are currently in school. She owns and operates a grocery and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods, cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies,  and biscuits in the local market of Koforidua, Ghana. She wants to use the loan to buy rice, canned foods, milk, food spices, washing soaps and powders in bulk to expand her business. Mina hopes to make good income from the expanded business to  support her children in school. She belongs to the community group called ‘Living Faith Trust Group’. The group guarantees a loan through a repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of rice, canned foods, milk, food spices, washing soaps and powders.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is twenty eight years old . She is married with two children in school. She has been trading rice and fresh tomatoes for five years. Her experience in trading has made her one of the most successful traders in the market. She considers the loan a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar and cartons of vegetable and palm oil. Francisca belongs to the community group called ‘Living Faith Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral  and provide peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar and cartons of vegetable and palm oil.

loans.name: Fatou Gassama

texts.fr:
Fatou Gassama S. is a widow and has 8 children to support. She's been a member of the Kadior village bank for 7 years. She would like to buy "monkey's bread" (baobab fruit), milk, sugar, palm oil and lemons. She intends to make and sell fruit juice and ice cream, and to retail the palm oil and the lemons. The profits of her business will enable her to provide for day-to-day expenses, and to improve the living conditions and the health status of her family. She's applying for a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou Gassama S., veuve avec 08 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kadior depuis 7 ans. Elle veut acheter du pain de singe, du lait, du sucre, de l'huile de palme et du citron. Elle va préparer et vendre du jus et des crèmes glaces et revendre l'huile de palme et le citron. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne et d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To make and sell fruit juice and ice cream, and to retail palm oil and lemons

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Maria Delfina A. and I work buying and selling shoes, jeans, shirts, blouses, sandals, etc.  I am 59 years old, I’ve had my business for a few years.  Thank God I was able to get my children and my home ahead with this business, considering that I took care of all the expenses by myself.  My business is in a very good location within the city, reason why I have a good number of customers.  At this time, I need help to be able to make a large purchase of shoes for an order received and for which I don’t have enough capital.
Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.
hola mi nombre es Maria Delfina A. me dedico a la compra venta de zapatos, jeans, camisas, blusas, sandalias, etc, tengo 59 años de edad, tengo mi negocio hace varios años, gracias a Dios con mi negocio logre sacar adelante a mis hijos y mi hogar, ya que yo sola costeaba todos los gastos de mi hogar.
mi negocio esta en un buen punto de la ciudad, por lo que tengo un buen numero de clientela, en estos momentos estoy solicitando ayuda para poder hacer una compra grande de zapatos ya que me hicieron un engargo grande y no tengo el capital suficiente para poder comprar dicho encargo,

loans.use: Purchase shoes and jeans

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has been trading in the market for the past ten years. She is divorced with two children. Mary enjoys selling and is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. She trades onion, ginger and eggs. She wants to use the loan to buy and then sell rice, sugar and vegetable oil. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her children in school. She belongs to the community group called ‘Living Faith Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral  and provide peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and vegetable oil for sale.

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Ciriaca C., I am 43 years old, I am a single mom. I have a son who is older and independent, sometimes he helps me at home.  I work selling dairy, my business is located in the main market of the community, I have good clients who like the quality of my products and above all, its hygiene.  At this time, I need to increase the inventory to sell more and get ahead with my business, which is the only thing generating income for my home.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.
hola mi nombre es Ciriaca C. tengo 43 años de edad, soy madre soltera, tengo un hijo que ya esta grande y es independiente y en algunos casos me ayuda en mi hogar.
me dedico a venta de lacteos, tengo mi negocio en el mercado municipal de esta comunidad, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta la calidad de mi producto y sobre todo lo higienico que es , en estos momentos necesito surtir mas mi negocio, para poder vender mas y asi salir adelante con mi negocio que es lo unico que me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase dairy products.

loans.name: Olga Zulema

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Olga M., I am 26 years old, I am married and have 2 children; one of them is in school and the other one is a newborn.  I work selling brand new shoes and have good clients.  At this moment, I am responsible for my children and for the home expenses because my husband moved to a different country to find work and it’s not going very well for him.  Thank God I have this business and I can get ahead by myself.  However, I need help to increase the inventory to make more profit because I wish to renovate my home.  This is why I need your help with my business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.
hola mi nombre es Olga M. tengo 26 años de edad, estoy casada y tengo 2 hijos, uno de ellos esta en la escuela y el otro esta recien nacido, me dedico a la venta de zapatos nuevos y mis clientes son muy buenos, pero en estos momentos a mi me toca sola cargar con todos los gastos de mis hijos y de mi hogar ya que mi esposo se fue a trabajaar a otro pais y no le va muy bien. 
gracias a Dios que tengo este negocio y puedo salir adelante sola, pero necesito una ayuda para poder surtir mas mi negocio ya que necesito mayores ganancias porque deseo remodelar mi casa de habitacion, por tal razon solicito a uds que me ayuden a salir adelante con mi negocio.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale shoes

loans.name: Hilda Senayda

texts.es:
Hello.  My name is Hilda M., and I am dedicated to selling dry, semi-dry and smoked cheese, and cheese curds.  I am 35 years old and I’m married with three children.

My husband is in the United states, which makes it more difficult for me to support my family.  I have sold cheese for three years, and it’s going well for me, but I need higher sales, so I am asking for a loan to purchase more products.  With the mney I earn I will be able to continue raising my children, which is the most important thing in my life.  I need help to move forward.  Thank you!
Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.
hola mi nombre es Hilda M. me dedico a la venta de quesos seco, semi seco, ahumado, quesillo, y cuajada, tengo 35 años de edad estoy casada con tres hijos, mi esposo esta en estados unidos por lo que me toca mas dificil a mi el sustento de mi familia, tengo 3 años de vender quesos y me va bien, pero necesito tener mayores ventas y por eso estoy solicitando credito para poder comprar mas productos, con las ganancias que obtenga poder seguir alimentado mis hijos que es lo mas importante en mi vida. necesito ayuda para poder salir adelante. gracias.

loans.use: Purchasing cheese

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama C., age 35, is married and has 5 children to support. She's been a member of the Khodoba village bank in Thiès for 6 years. She would like to strengthen her business which consists in buying and reselling fruits. Marima intends to buy entire baskets of mangoes and to sale the fruits at retail. The profits will enable her to improve the living conditions of her family. The loan she's applying for will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariama C., 35 ans mariée, 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba à Thiès depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter et revendre des fruits. Mariama va acheter des paniers de mangues et revendre au détail. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Mango fruits retail business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou Kairé is 62 years old, married, and supports three children and three other adults. For three and a half years she has been a member of the Kairé village bank. She buys local products like palm oil and dried fish wholesale and sells them retail. The income from her transactions permits her to improve her standard of living. She seeks a loan that will be repaid in six months.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou Kairé, 62 ans mariée, 03 enfants et 03 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kairé depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle achète des produits locaux comme l’huile de palme et le poisson sec et revend au détail. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Trade in local products (palm oil, dried fish)

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Marielena belongs to the Girasoles Village Bank situated in Pamplona Alta in the district of San Juan of Miraflores, Lima.

Marielena is a married, 46-year-old woman with three children, ages 26, 24 and 10 years old. She has a family mechanic business with her husband and oldest son. They started their business more than 16 years ago with a secondhand welding machine. Now, Marielena has more machines and her business is growing. She desires to expand her business with more car parts and supplies.

Marielena needs a loan of 2,400 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to expand her business and provide better service for her customers.

Marielena has had difficult times, especially with her youngest son. Her son was born with a frontal tumor on his head, and he needs therapy for his condition. Though this treatment is very expensive, Marielena is confident that she and her family will move forward.

Marielena likes to embroider and work with alpaca wool, and enjoys free time with her son.

loans.use: Marielena needs a loan of 2,400 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to expand her business and provide better service for her customers.

loans.name: Fidelia Concepción

texts.en:
Fidelia belongs to the Girasoles Village Bank situated in Pamplona Alta in the district of San Juan of Miraflores, Lima.

Fidelia is a 47-year-old woman with three children, ages 20, 18 and 7 years old, and two grandchildren. She makes jewelry cases that she sells mostly in downtown Lima. Fidelia and her family have engaged in this business for more than 15 years, though now she works alone.

Fidelia needs a loan of 2,000 Nuevo Peruvian Soles for more materials to make her boxes and further expand her business.

Fidelia hopes to open a jewelry store as one of her future plans.

loans.use: Fidelia needs a loan of 2,000 Nuevo Peruvian Soles for more materials to make her boxes and further expand her business.

loans.name: Adriana's Group

texts.en:
Norma, Adriana and Liz belong to the Girasoles Village Bank in Pamplona Alta in the district of San Juan of Miraflores, Lima.

Adriana is a married mother of seven grown children. Liz is one of her daughters, with three children of her own. Together they decided to sell artisan handicrafts and cured fabrics. They have a workshop in their house, but sell their products in downtown Lima.

Norma is a married mother of two children. She sells vegetables and soup in the markets by cart, working with her mother. Norma's husband drives a taxi that they rent on a daily basis.

Adriana, Liz and Norma need respective loans of 1,400, 1,200 and 400 Nuevo Peruvian Soles. Adriana and Liz will buy more materials and products for their fabric-work, while Norma will further stock her business.

Adriana and Liz hope to eventually separate and run personal, independent businesses. Norma and her husband have saved to buy a car and her husband will work as a taxi driver.

loans.use: Adriana, Liz and Norma need respective loans of 1,400, 1,200 and 400 Nuevo Peruvian Soles. Adriana and Liz will buy more materials and products for their fabric-work, while Norma will further stock her business.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia is 77 years old. She doesn’t have an education and speaks only Aymará (an Andean native language). She is married and has six children, five of whom have their own families. She owns her own home, which is located in Chimbo center in the Yunguyo district and province. For 50 years, Rosalia has raised the cows and pigs that her husband buys in various fairs and which he also sells in the Chacachaca and Yunguyo fairs.

Rosalia is a member of the Central Progreso Community Bank where she had an initial loan of 300 soles (about $105). She invested the loan money in the purchase of a calf. With this loan of 2,500 soles (about $900), which will be paid back in 4 months, Rosalia plans to purchase two small bulls. The bulls later will be sold for profit. As a member of the Community Bank, Rosalia has learned to make payments on time and support the bank. Her biggest dream is for her children to have good jobs. She also would like to buy a few more cows.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Rosalia tiene 77 años D. edad , no tiene estudios y habla solo el aymará, está casada, tiene seis hijos D. los cuales cinco ya tienen familia, la casa donD. vive es propia y se ubica en el centro poblado D. Chimbo, del distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo. La actividad a la que se dedica es la crianza D. vacas y chancho, que su esposo compra en las diferentes ferias, los cuales también venD. en las ferias D. Chacachaca y Yunguyo, se dedica ha esta actividad desD. hace 50 años atrás

Es socia del Banco Comunal " Central Progreso" donD. tuvo un crédito inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual invirtió en la compra D. una ternera. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará dos toretes pequeños, los cuales serán vendidos para generar ganancias. Al pertenecer al Banco Comunal ella aprendió a ser puntual y solidaria. Su sueño mas granD. que tiene es que sus hijos tengan un buen trabajo y a ella le gustaría comprarse unos cuantas vacas mas.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock (calf)

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Maria, 41, lives in the city of Managua, in the neighborhood of Sabana Grande. She has two young children and she and her husband want to provide the very best for them, especially with regards to education. Her husband works hauling goods in a horse-drawn wagon.

Maria makes a living making and selling "cosa de horno" (a traditional cornbread-like food made from maize), a product very popular with her customers. Her grandmother taught her the skill that has long enabled her to earn a living and still does today. Her plan is to increase her volume of production so that she can become a distributor.

The loan that Maria has applied for will go to buying maize to make cosa de horno, the first step in her plans to increase production and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Don Maria tiene 41 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de managua, en la comarca sabana grande. Tiene dos hijos menores de edad a los cuales junto a su esposo quieren darles lo mejor y sobre todo educación. Su esposo trabaja en acarreo en una carretón de caballo.

Doña Maria se dedica a la venta de cosa de horno, producto muy demandado por sus clientes, que se hace a base de maiz. Su abuelita le enseñó este oficio y con el cual ella ha podido y puede ganarse la vida. Sus planes son generar mayor volumen de producción para poder llegar a ser un distribuidor.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de maiz para la elaboración de cosa de horno, ya que quiere aumentar sus productos para empezar su crecimiento.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for bakery business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Salomé

texts.es:
Salome, 60, is a lady who has had to work since she was very young, first to help her parents and then to help her own family. She owns a taxi which her husband drives daily to support their family. She also works, as a secretary for the taxi cooperative of which she's a member. She has four children, three now prepared for life and one still at school. Twelve years ago she pulled her savings together to buy the cab. Her short-term plan is to get enough money together to buy another one.

The goal of remodeling her house is the one that she wants to fulfill now and she's asking for a loan to invest in a false ceiling, one step along the way to ultimately seeing the whole house transformed.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Salomé es una señora de 60 años, que desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y después para hacerse cargo de su propia familia. Doña Salométiene un vehículo taxi el que su esposo lo trabaja diariamente para llevar el sustento a la familia. Ella también trabaja como secretaria de la cooperativa de taxi de donde ella es miembro. Tiene cuatro hijos a los cuales tres ya preparó para la vida y uno todavía se encuentra estudiando. Hace doce años juntó todos sus ahorros para poder hacer la inversión en la compra del vehículo, sus planes a corto plazo son poder reunir suficiente dinero para poder comprar otra unidad vehicular.

La meta de poder llegar a acondicionar su casa la quiere cumplir en estos momentos, y solicita el crédito para invertir en la construcción de un cielo falso en su casa de habitación y así poder poder verla algún día construida totalmente.

loans.use: Home remodel.

loans.name: New Paradise Group

texts.es:
Hello.  Our group is called New Paradise, and we are housed in the Jasmin neighborhood in the town of Paraiso.  We know each other very well since we have been neighbors for several years, and we all have a lot of appreciation for each other.  The loan that we are asking for is very important because we need to acquire more prime materials because lately, the prices of these materials have been going up, and it has made it a little difficult to stay in business since we have low stock, so we need to stock up on materials.

Our group is formed of: Nely Suyapa C., “I have made and sold tortillas for five years, during which I have had my daughters’ help making tortillas.  I have struggled the whole time, because I am a single mother and my work doesn’t allow me to take care of my children and home;” “Jose H., who has a glass store and makes lattices, display cases and everything related to windows.  He has been dedicated to this business for five years, and the money he makes helps him fulfill his obligations and satisfy his household needs.  Wilmer A. has a glass store, and has been in this business for two years, during which time he has been the only wage-earner in his family.

We are all asking for your financial support so that we can move forward with our businesses and our families.  Thanks!
Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.
hola nuestro grupo se llama NUEVO PARAISO estamos ubicados en barrio el Jazmin del municipio del Paraiso, nosotros nos conocemos muy bien ya que somos vecinos de varios años y todos nos tenemos mucho aprecio. con este credito que estamos solicitando sera de mucha importancia porque necesitamos adquirir mas materia prima ya que en estos ultimos dias se ha encarecido la compra de estos materiales y hace un poco dificil tener en existencia ya que el capital de trabajo es muy poco por tal razon necesitamos abastecernos de materiales. nuestro grupo esta conformado por: Nely Suyapa C.: elaboro y vendo tortillas, actividad que tengo de realizar hace 5 años, tengo la ayuda de mis hijas para la elaboracion de las tortillas, durante todo este tiempo he tenido que luchar para salir adelante porque soy madre soltera y este negocio me permite atender mis hijas y mi hogar. Jose H.: el tiene una vidrieria en la cual elabora celosias, vitrinas y todo lo relacionado con vidrios, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, con los ingresos que obtiene le ayudan a cumplir con las obligaciones y satisfacer las necesidades de su casa. Wilmer A.: el tiene una vidrieria, tiene dos años de haber inagurado su negocio, durante todo este tiempo ha sido la unica fuente de ingresos a su hogar. todos solicitamos su apoyo monetario para poder salir adelante con nuestros negocios y nustras familias. gracias.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for window stores and supplies for making tortillas.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula is 53 years old. She wasn’t able to go to school. She married and lives with her husband. Together they own their own home, which is located in Chimbo center, in Cuturapi district in Yunguyo province. For 10 years Ursula has owned a small store where she sells sugar, gas, beer, soft drinks and sweets. She also sells cows and pigs in Chacachaca.

Ursula is a member of the Central Proreso Community Bank, where she had an initial loan of 300 soles (about US $105). She used the loan to pigs which since then have been sold. With this loan of 1,000 soles (about $375), which will be paid back in 4 months, Ursula plans to buy rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks and candies – this will increase the merchandise in her store.

Ursula has learned to make her payments responsibly and she is very thankful because her prior loan helped her expand her business and increase her income at the same time. Ursula’s biggest hope is for her children in Lima to do well, work hard and get ahead. She would like to buy more livestock, expand her business further and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Ursula tiene 53 años D. edad, no pudo estudiar, se casó y vive con su esposo, la casa que tienen es propia y se ubica en el centro poblado D. Chimbo, Distrito D. Cuturapi , provincia D. Yunguyo. Tiene una pequeña tienda donD. venD. azúcar, gas , cerveza, gaseosas, dulces, desD. hace 10 años. También se dedica a la venta D. vacas y chanchos, ganado que venD. en Chacachaca.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal " Central progreso" donD. tuvo un crédito inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que compró dos chanchos los cuales ya los vendió. Con este crédito D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas y golosinas, incrementando D. esa manera su mercadería.

Ella aprendió es a ser responsable en sus pagos y está muy agradecida porque le ayudó a incrementar su negocio y a la vez sus ingresos económicos. El gran anhelo que ella tiene es que sus hijos que están en Lima, se encuentren bien, trabajen y salgan adelante. Le gustaría comprar mas ganado y incrementar su negocio y su ingreso económico.

loans.use: Purchase of various products

loans.name: Unity And Strength Group

texts.es:
Hello.  Our group is Unity and Strength.  It consists of three individuals.  We live in the same community in Aldea el Puente Yusguare.  This is the first help we are asking for, now that we have come to develop our economic activities for a few years without credit help or permanent consulting.  This is why we’re asking for credit to help us start and develop our activities, and our families, and with the strength and dedication we can give our children all of the necessities of life, and an education, so that they can get involved in our production and sales.

We need unconditional support to continue working and to move forward.  We have dedicated ourselves to the production of meat and chicken tamales.  We also make tortillas, small cakes, and white bread in our earthen oven.
Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer

hola nuestro grupo es UNION Y FUERZA estamos conformadas por 3 integrantes, residimos en la misma comunidad del Aldea el Puente Yusguare, es la primera ayuda que estamos solicitando, ya que hemos venido desarrollando nuestras actividades economicas desde hace un par de años sin tener apoyo crediticio ni asesoria permanente, por tal razon estamos solicitando el credito para poder tener un crecimiento en nuestras actividades y asi poder lograr un desarrollo en nuestras familias ya que con esfuerzo y dedicacion damos educacion y todas las necesidades a nuestros hijos, a quienes tambien involucramos en nuestra produccion y venta. 
necesitamos un apoyo incondicional para poder seguir trabajando y salir adelante.
nosotras nos dedicamos a la produccion de nacatamales de carne y pollo, hacemos tortillas, pastelitos, pan blanco en horno de barro.

loans.use: Purchasing corn and wheat flower, salt, lime, sugar, firewood and vegetables.

loans.name: Loren

texts.en:
Loren belongs to the Girasoles Bank situated in Pamplona Alta in the district of San Juan of Miraflores, Lima.

Loren is a married woman with three children, ages 24, 23 and 5 years old. Her youngest son is in kindergarten. Loren makes clothes in a workshop in her mother-in-law´s home. This is a family business, which she started with only one sewing machine.

Loren needs a loan of 1,600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($575) to buy fabric and adhesive to further expand her clothing business.

She is very enthusiastic about her business and confident that she can do much more with a small loan.

loans.use: Loren needs a loan of 1,600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to buy fabric and adhesive to further expand her clothing business.

loans.name: José Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jose works for a company that distributes water to all parts of Nicaragua. He's a pump operator. He's worked for the company for 17 years and sometimes works seven days a week. His goal when he started his job was to be able to lift up his family, to provide them with food, education and housing. He has two young children. Work on his house has moved along slowly, always depending on what money he brought in.

Jose's next step is to continue the construction of a bedroom so that he can make his two young children more comfortable. That's why he's asking for the loan, to buy the materials he needs for construction.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Don José trabaja en la empresa encargada de distribuir agua a todo el país, se desempeña como operario de bomba. Tiene 17 años de trabajar para esta empresa, y algunas veces tiene que trabajar los siete días de la semana. Su meta cuando empezó este trabajo era poder sacar junto a su esposa a su familia adelante y poder darles educación,alimentación y una casa donde vivir. Tiene dos pequeños niños. El progreso de la construcción de su casa se ha ido dando poco a poco, todo en dependencia de los ingresos que ellos generan.

Su siguiente paso es poder continuar con la construcción de un cuarto de habitación para darle mayor comodidad a sus pequeños niños, es por eso que solicita el préstamo, para comprar materiales necesarios para esta construcción.

loans.use: Continue construction work on bedroom.

loans.name: Daniela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Daniela del Carmen is a woman who, at 37, feels satisfied with her life. She's finished her education and now earns a living teaching school, something for which she feels great love and to which she's dedicated because it's thrillling for her to pass along knowledge to her students.

Daniela is married and has a 12-year old son. Her husband works as a manager of a bodega and helps her with family expenses. She lives in the Ticuantepe neighborhood where she has a small house which she's improving so that it's more habitable for her son. She will use the loan to extend a bedroom and replace the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Daniela del Carmen es una mujer que a sus 37 años se siente satisfecha con su vida, ha podido terminar sus estudios y ahora se dedica a la profesión de la docencia, la cual dice que ejerce con mucho amor y dedicación ya que le encanta poder llevar un poco de conocimiento a sus alumnos.

Daniela es casada, y tiene un hijo de 12 años. Su esposo trabaja como Responsable de Bodega, y apoya a su esposa con los gastos de la familia. Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, y es ahí donde ella tiene su pequeña casa de habitación a la cual les está haciendo mejoras para poder darles mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, el préstamo lo usará para ampliar un cuarto de habitación y cambiar techo.

loans.use: Ampliar cuarto de habitación y cambio de techo

loans.name: Susana's Group

texts.en:
Susana and Flor belong to the Girasoles Bank situated in Pamplona Alta in the district of San Juan of Miraflores, Lima.

Susana is married with three children. She makes corduroy purses in her house and sells them in the central market. Before she bought only a small amount of fabric, but now she buys larger quantities, permitting her to grow her business.

Flor is a mother of four children and has four grandchildren. She makes meals in her home and delivers the food to different locations and is paid on a weekly basis.

Susana and Flor need respective loans of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles, totalling 2,000 Soles, to further expand their businesses. Susana will buy fabrics and adhesive. Flor will buy food products.

Susana and Flor are very enthusiastic and her confident in their endeavors and that they will move forward.

loans.use: Susana and Flor need respective loans of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles, totalling 2,000 Soles, to further expand their businesses. Susana will buy fabrics and adhesive. Flor will buy food products.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia belongs to the Tulipanes Village Bank.

She is 40 years old, married and has four children. With her husband, they have a joiner’s workshop and a tapestry workshop in their house located in La Victoria Association. They employ people to help them, and Dionisia also helps to sew.

Dionisia needs a 1,200-soles loan to buy clothes and sponges.

She dreams about extending her business. She would like to pay her debts and educate her children.

Here is the link to the description of her first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=37208&_tpos=5&_tpg=1

loans.use: Dionisia needs a 1200 soles loan to buy clothes and sponges.

loans.name: Ermilia

texts.es:
Ermilia has operated a store in her home for the last 18 years. At the beginning she only sold lemons but gradually expanded the business. She has also spent 20 years making tamales to sell in the store. At weekends she delivers tamales to local bakeries. The loan she requested is to be used to stock the store with more products. She would like to convert it into a store with a wider range of products and sell cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Ermilia tiene una bodega en su casa desde hace 18 años. Al comienzo solo vendía limones, pero fue ampliando el negocio poco a poco. Pero, ella también prepara tamales desde hace 20 años, los cuales vende en su bodega. Los fines de semana reparte tamales a panaderías de la zona. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para surtir la tienda con productos. A Ermilia le gustaría convertir su tienda en una tienda-bazar y vender cosméticos.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
For four years Maribel has taken orders for clothing from her customers. She buys the clothes wholesale and then sells them to her neighbours who might request clothes, blankets, sneakers etc. It was her sister who encouraged her to start this business. Maribel also lends money to her neighbours.

Beforehand Maribel used to work as a domestic servant, but because she had to look after her own daughters, she quit this job. The loan requested is to be used to buy clothing for her customers. Maribel would like to open a clothing store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Maribel desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos. Ella compra la ropa por mayor y luego la vende a sus vecinos, quienes le solicitan ropa, frazadas, zapatillas entre otras cosas. Fue su hermana quien le animó a incursionar en este negocio. También hace préstamos de dinero a sus vecinos.

Maribel antes se dedicaba a trabajar como empleada doméstica, pero debido a que tenía que cuidar a sus hijas, dejó esta labor. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para invertir en la ropa que le piden. A Maribel le gustaría poner una tienda de ropa en su casa.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo used to work as a domestic servant five years ago, but she quit this job as she had to look after her own children. Her sister advised her to start work selling clothes. That was how she got started, and she spent three years in this line of work. However, for personal reasons she has had to stop for the time being. The loan she has requested is to buy land and to build her own prefabricated house.

Consuelo wants to start up her clothing business once again and to open a business in her own home so that she can look after her children without having to leave her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Consuelo trabajaba como empleada doméstica hace 5 años, pero tenía que cuidar a su hijos, por lo que abandonó esa labor. Su hermana le aconsejó que trabajara vendiendo ropa por pedidos, fue así que Consuelo se ha dedicado por 3 años a esta actividad. Sin embargo, por problemas personales ha tenido que dejarlo por el momento. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar un terreno y construir su casa propia con material prefabricado.

Consuelo quiere retomar su negocio de venta de ropa por pedidos y abrir un negocio en su casa, para así no salir y cuidar a su hijos.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land and build her own prefabricated house.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia posesses a great talent for creating beautiful woven works such as, hats, jackets and gloves for children, women, and men. She started more than 11 years ago when she decided to leave her home village of Lampa, and root her family in the city of Juliaca.

After seeing that the income of her husband, Mario, as a master bricklayer was insufficient to cover the costs of the home, Julia decided to create her own source of income. She appropriated a small area in her little house to create a weaving workshop. Thanks to her beautiful works she has a large quantity of orders, orders that she cannot fill right now due to lack of raw materials (wool). For this purpose Julia is requesting a loan and hopes to touch your generous hearts that you may be willing to contribute to her work.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia posee gran talento para realizar bellos trabajos tejidos, tales como: chompas, chalecos y guantes para niños, caballeros y damas. Empezó hace más D. 11 años cuando decidió salir D. su pueblo natal Lampa y radicar junto a su querida familia en la ciudad D. Juliaca.
