Julia, al ver que los ingresos que su esposo Mario obtenía con su labor D. maestro albañil era insuficiente para cubrir los gastos D. su hogar, decidió crear su propia fuente D. ingreso económico.Para ello adecuó un pequeño espacio D. su pequeña casa e instaló su taller D. tejido, gracias a los hermosos trabajos que realiza logró contar con gran cantidad D. solicitudes, solicitudes que en estos momentos no pueD. cumplir por la falta D. materia prima (lana), con ese propósito Julia se presenta y espera tocar corazones generosos que estén dispuestos a colaborar con su labor.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for weaving and to complete client order that are currently pending because she does not have wool.

loans.name: Dante

texts.es:
Dante and his wife have been selling food in the evenings for the past two years. They sell the food on the street near their house from 4:30pm to 10:00pm. But as Dante is a bricklayer, from Monday to Friday his wife is the one in charge of the business. He just works there on weekends. The loan he has asked for is to be used to buy cooking utensils and the awnings he needs for the street food business. Dante would like to have his own premises and open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Dante y su esposa venden comida todas las noches desde hace 2 años. Ellos salen a vender a la avenida cerca de su casa, desde las 4.30 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche. Pero Dante es albañil, por lo que de lunes a viernes su esposa es la que se encarga del negocio. Él lo hace los fines de semana. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los utensilios de cocina y los toldos que necesita para armar su negocio de comida en la calle. A Dante le gustaría tener un local y poner un restaurante.

loans.use: To purchase cooking utensils and awnings so he can set up his street food business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Keeping her family together and in complete harmony is what sustains the daily effort and work of Cecilia and her husband, Jose, parents of 6 children who are the engine that drives her and Jose to move ahead, persevering in their daily activities. Cecilia and her husband worked selling general goods on foot, for many years, in the city of Juliaca. But, the benefits that they gained from this business were insufficient to sustain and educate their family. So, following the advice of some friends, they decided to change careers and acquire knitting machines.

At first the job was very difficult, since they had never done this type of work before. However, over time they became known for their great ability in knitting. They knit beautiful, colored gloves, scarves, and hats that are sold in the San Jose market in Juliaca. Cecilia is considering increasing the volume of production to improve their family's income. Support this diligent mother, who with talent and patience strives ahead for her children.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Mantener a su familia unida y en completa armonía es lo que sostiene el esfuerzo y trabajo diario de doña Cecilia y su esposo José, padres de 6 hijos, quienes fueron el motor que les impulsó a seguir adelante perseverando en sus actividades diarias. Cecilia y su esposo, durante muchos años se dedicaron a la venta de abarrotes en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca, pero los beneficios que obtenían por este negocio les resultaba insuficiente para el sostén y educación de su familia, por ello, siguiendo el consejo de algunas amistades decidieron cambiar de oficio, para ello adquirieron maquinas de tejer, en un principio les resultaba complicado porque nunca antes se habían dedicado a esta labor, pero con el transcurso del tiempo lograron adquirir gran conocimiento y habilidad en este rubro. Actualmente tejen hermosos y coloridos guantes, chalinas y chompas que son vendidas al por mayor en el mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca. Doña Cecilia considera que aumentando el volumen de producción mejorará el ingreso económico de su familia. Apoyemos a esta diligente madre que con talento y paciencia va sacando adelante a los suyos.

loans.use: More capital to increase production volume of the clothing accessories they make.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Candida is 55-years-old, is single, and has three children. Two of her children emigrated to Panama and support her economically. She only lives with one of her children. She lives in the Hialeah neighborhood in the city of Managua, a neighborhood that was established in the center of the city many years ago.

Doña Candida is dedicated to selling applicances and beauty products, an activity that she started years ago with her own savings. She started selling small quantities, but thanks to her good management, she has been able to increase her inventory. The loans that she has requested have helped her invest in her business. She will use this credit to purchase appliances like fans and irons, so she can continue increasing the variety of products she offers. She hopes to be able to increase the profitability of her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Candida tiene 55 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos emigraron hacia Panamá y le apoyan económicamente, sólo vive con uno de sus hijos. Habita en el barrio Hialeah de la ciudad de Managua, un barrio en el centro de la ciudad establecido desde hace muchos años atrás y que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad.

Doña Candida se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos y productos de belleza, actividad que empezó hace ya algunos años con ahorros propios, empezó vendiendo pocas cantidades pero gracias a su buena administración ha podido crecer en inventario, los préstamos que ha solicitado le han ayudado en la inversión a su negocio, éste crédito lo usará en la compra de electrodomésticos como abanicos, planchas para seguir aumentando la variedad de los productos que ofrece. Espera poder aumentar la rentabilidad de su epqueño negocio

loans.use: To purchase appliances to invest in her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Alber

texts.es:
Alber is an able and intelligent young man, who has matured with time and established many goals for his future. After finishing high school, and being unable to continue to university, he saw the need to generate his own income and obtained a sandwich truck. Alber offered his delicious hamburgers to neighbors, friends, and general customers in a popular intersection in his home town of Juliaca. This work was very satisfying, but did not permit him to focus on his studies.

As a result, 2 years ago Alber decided to change jobs and try his hand at a pre-owned cellular phone business, something he can commit to only on weekends, giving him enough time for school. This business has proven to be very profitable, which is why he decided to increase investment to expand his business and be able to finish his professional studies with peace of mind. In order to do this, asks for this loan, and we know that your collaboration will be very well invested in the hands of this young entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Alber es un hábil e inteligente muchacho que con el transcurso del tiempo fue madurando y proyectando muchas metas para su vida futura, al concluir sus estudios secundarios y no poder continuar estudios superiores se vio en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, para ello adquirió su carrito sanguchero. Alber ofrece sus apetitosas hamburguesas a sus vecinos, amigos y clientes en general en una concurrida avenida de su ciudad natal Juliaca. Esta actividad le trajo satisfacción, pero no le permitía dedicarse completamente a sus estudios. Es por ello que hace 2 años decidió cambiar de labor e incursionar en el negocio de la venta de celulares de segundo uso, actividad a la que se consagra sólo los fines de semana y le da el tiempo suficiente para sus estudios superiores. Este negocio le está resultando muy rentable. Por ello que decidió aumentar el monto de inversión para ampliar su negocio y poder concluir con tranquilidad sus estudios profesionales, para ello recurre a solicitar este préstamo, sabemos que vuestra colaboración será muy bien invertida en las manos de este emprendedor joven.

loans.use: Increased capital to invest in his cellular phone business.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
Ana is an enterprising woman who started her business after leaving her last job. She combined the money that the company paid her and a little of the savings she had and decided to invest in the business of selling used clothing because that’s what her mother does. She started approximately a year and a half ago when her mother invited her to set up a location in the city’s market that moves from place to place next to where she sells clothing. Because she realized it was a good business, she decided to invest her savings in that and now it generates a good profit for her.

She needs a loan for US$300, which she plans to repay in five months, to buy more clothing and have a variety of garments in her business. With your help Ana will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana es una mujer emprendedora que inició su negocio cuando se salio de su ultimo empleo, junto su liquidación y un poco de ahorros que tenia, entonces resolvió invertirlos en el negocio de venta de ropa usada, ya que su mama se dedica a ello. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 1 ½ año cuando su mama la invito a que instalara un local en el mercado rodante de la ciudad, a un lado de donde ella vende ropa y como se dio cuenta que era buen negocio decidió invertir sus ahorros en esto, actualmente le genera buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mas ropa y tener variedad de prendas en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Ana saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Jessenia

texts.es:
Jessenia has been making foam rubber toys for children for the past four years. She learned how to do this work from her parents who have been making toys for many years. Together with her brother, Jessenia makes the toys in their home and then delivers them to the markets where their products are in demand. However, when the circus is in town, she sells the toys directly to the public. The funds she received was used to buy the material that she needs for the toys. Jessenia would love to have more customers to whom she can sell the toys.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Jessenia se dedica a fabricar juguetes para niños en base a espuma desde hace 4 años. Ella aprendió esta labor por medio de sus padres, quienes trabajan haciendo juguetes desde hace muchos años. Junto con su hermano, ella fabrica los juguetes en su casa y luego los reparte a los mercados, donde le solicitan esta mercadería. Sin embargo, en temporada de circos, Jessenia sale a vender sus juguetes al público. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para comprar el material que necesita para elaborar los juguetes. A Jessenia le gustaría tener más clientes a quienes ofrecer sus juguetes.

loans.use: To purchase the material she needs to make toys

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
Fifteen years ago, Gudelia decided to sell beer and soda in her house because there were few stores close by. Actually, however, there were soon various bodegas around; consequently, she decided to engage in a parallel activity. It was this way that her daughter proposed the idea of selling clothing and shoes by request. Gudelia has been doing this for four years. Her clients are her friends and the acquaintances of her daughter and husband. Gudelia also sells cosmetics through a catalogue. The loan for which she has asked is for buying more clothing to offer her clients. She would like to have a place in the market and sell her products there.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 15 años, Gudelia decidió vender cervezas y gaseosas en su casa debido a que habían pocas tiendas alrededor. Sin embargo, en la actualidad las bodegas abundan, por lo que decidió incursionar en alguna otra actividad paralela. Fue así que su hija le propuso la idea de vender ropa y zapatillas por pedidos. Así pues, Gudelia se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años. Sus clientes son sus amistades y conocidos de su hija y esposo. Gudelia también vende cosméticos por catálogo. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar la ropa que ofrece a sus clientes. A ella le gustaría tener un puesto en el mercado y vender sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz started her business because she very much likes sales and it allows her to meet many people besides having an income. She started approximately eight years ago and began selling novelty items such as tiaras, necklaces, glasses, belts and women’s handbags. Her sister-in-law invited her to go on trips to Moroleón, Villa Hidalgo and León, Guanajuato, where they can buy merchandise at better prices and because of that her business started growing. The prices were more accesable and most of the merchandise that she would bring was from orders and purchased on credit and that helped her to have a better clientelle.

She is requesting a loan for US$975, which she plans to repay in six months, to construct a room to be able to increase the size of the business and offer more convenience for her clients in addition to better service since they will be able to see and choose what garments they need. She will also go again to buy merchandise. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz inició el negocio porque le gusta mucho las ventas, ya que le permiten conoce mucha gente y además tener un ingreso. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 8 años inicio vendiendo novedades como diademas, collares, lentes, cintos, bolsas de dama y después la invito una cuñada a ir a los viajes a Moroleón, Villa Hidalgo y León, Guanajuato, donde pueden conseguir mercancía a mejores precios, y fue con eso que su negocio fue creciendo por que los precios eran accesibles y la mercancía que traía era la mayoría por pedidos y en pagos eso hacia que tuviera mayor clientela

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para construir un cuarto y poder ampliar el negocio, tener más comodidad para los clientes, así como ofrecer un mejor servio ya que podrán ver y elegir las prendas que ellos necesiten mas cómodamente. Además de ir de nuevo a comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo esto será posible.

loans.use: Construction of a room for the business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy comes from a humble, but hard-working family. Since forming her own home, she works various jobs in order to prevent her beloved children from suffering hardships. In reality, she works with her husband as housekeeping for an important and well-known hotel in Juliaca, allowing them to provide peace of mind and well-being to their family.

Additionally, in her free time Nancy, with ability and creativity, designs and makes beautiful chains, necklaces, and bracelets for women and children by hand, that are sold in the Juliaca markets. Nancy would like to purchase raw materials to continue working on her beautiful art. That is why she is requesting this loan that she promises to return quickly.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Nancy proviene de una familia humilde pero muy trabajadora, desde que formó su hogar se dedicó a diferentes oficios para mantener sin privaciones económicas a sus queridos hijos. Actualmente, junto a su esposo viene trabajando como personal de limpieza de un importante y reconocido hotel de la ciudad de Juliaca, con este trabajo puede ofrecer tranquilidad y bienestar a su familia. Adicionalmente ha esta labor, en sus horas libres con mucha creatividad y habilidad elabora artesanalmente hermosas cadenas, collares y pulseras para damas y niñas que son vendidos al por mayor a los comerciantes de dicha ciudad.Nancy tiene pensado adquirir materia prima para seguir dedicándose a su bello arte, para ello es que solicita este préstamo que promete devolver puntualmente.

loans.use: To acquire raw materials for design of handmade jewelry and keep up with client orders.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda used to practice agriculture in the provinces, but she decided to move to Lima and start a new business. It was thus that she put a bodega in her house ten years ago. Hilda offers a large variety of products to her neighbors, who know her. She will use the loan she is requesting to stock her store with products. She would like to convert her bodega into a mini-market.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda se dedicaba a la agricultura en provincia, pero decidió mudarse a Lima y empezar un nuevo negocio. Fue así que ella puso una bodega en su casa hace 10 años. Hilda ofrece toda variedad de productos a sus vecinos, quienes ya la conocen. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado en surtir su tienda con productos. A ella le gustaría poder convertir su bodega en un minimarket.

loans.use: To stock her store with products

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
10 years ago, Fanny began to sell gas tanks in her home. A relative proposed that she sell wholesale; that's how she came to be a sub-distributor of gas tanks. She is in charge of distributing to all the retail stores in her area. She has grown her business bit by bit. Now she counts on her own transportation and has a staff. She used to work as a secretary but has since left that job in order to fully concentrate on her new business. She has used her loans to pay for the gas tanks she has ordered. She would like to cease being a sub-distributor and become a direct distributor for the factory that produces the gas.

Translated by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 10 años, Fanny empezó vendiendo balones de gas por menor en su casa. Un familiar le propuso vender por mayor, fue así que Fanny ahora es sub-distribuidora de balones de gas. Ella se encarga de repartir a las tiendas minoristas de todo su distrito. Ella ha ido creciendo su negocio poco a poco. Ahora cuenta con movilidad propia y con un personal que le ayuda en las labores de reparto. Fanny antes trabajaba como secretaria, pero tuvo que abandonarlo, para dedicarse por completo al nuevo negocio. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para pagar los balones de gas que ha pedido. A ella le gustaría dejar de ser sub-distribuidora y convertirse en distribuidora directa de la empresa que produce gas.

loans.use: To pay for the gas tanks she sells

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Dona Doris, as her friends and clients lovingly refer to her, is a very dedicated and hard-working mother who is determined to give the best of herself to provide peace of mind, security, and overall, higher education to her two dear children. Her children give her the necessary strength to move forward, persevering in her business of soft drink sales.

Doris started her business more than 20 years ago, at first selling soft drinks on foot, but thanks to her dedication and diligence her business has grown and she is actually one of the most important distributors of soft-drinks in her city, Juliaca. The desire of this enterprising woman is to expand her location and carry more merchandise for distribution. To do so, she has placed her hope in the loan that you can offer her.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Doris, como cariñosamente la suelen llamas sus amigos y clientes es una madre muy dedicada y laboriosa que está dispuesta a poner lo mejor de sí para ofrecerle tranquilidad, seguridad y sobre todo, estudios superiores, a sus dos amados hijos, quienes le dan la fuerza suficiente para seguir adelante perseverando en su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas.Doris inició su negocio hace más de 20 años, en un principio vendía de forma ambulatoria, pero gracias a su dedicación y diligencia su negocio fue creciendo y actualmente es una de las más importantes distribuidoras de bebidas gaseosas de su ciudad, Juliaca. El deseo de esta emprendedora mujer es ampliar su local y contar con mayor mercadería de distribución, para ello tiene depositada su esperanza en el préstamo que ustedes puedan brindarle.

loans.use: Expand her business and increase the quantity of good for distribution in her Soft Drink sales business.

loans.name: Janett

texts.es:
Janett has been selling wine for five years. She travels once a month to bring the wine from Chincha. Then she offers it to her neighbors, who know her. She also sells the wine in a market close to her home. Additionally, for the past two years, Janett has been selling clothing every afternoon. She sells her merchandise in the market, where she has a small table. She advertises this to the public. She also sells clothing by request to her neighbors. She will use the loan to purchase the merchandise needed for her business. She would like to have her own stand in the market, where she could sell her clothing.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Janett se dedica a la venta de vinos desde hace 5 años. Ella viaja una vez al mes a traer los vinos desde Chincha. Luego los ofrece a sus vecinos, quienes ya la conocen. También reparte los vinos en el mercado cerca de su casa. Además, desde hace 2 años Janett vende ropa todas las tardes. Ella ofrece su mercadería en el mercado, donde saca una pequeña mesa y lo promociona al público. También vende la ropa a pedido de sus vecinos. Los préstamos los ha utilizado para comprar la mercadería que necesita para sus negocios. A Janett le gustaría tener un propio puesto en el mercado, donde ofrecer su ropa. Además, quisiera poner un gimnasio en su casa.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise with which to stock her businesses

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth has been dedicated to selling clothing for 3 years. A friend encouraged her to start this business. She receives a larger quantity of orders during the holidays and the start of the school year. The loans that she has requested have helped her purchase clothing that she offers to her friends and acquaintances. Elizbeth would like to have a store where she can sell her clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos desde hace 3 años. Una amiga la animó a incursionar en este negocio. Ella recibe mayor cantidad de pedidos en temporadas de fiestas navideñas y campaña escolar. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han ayudado para comprar la ropa que ofrece a sus amigos y conocidos. A Elizabeth le gustaría tener una tienda y vender ropa.

loans.use: To purchase the clothing that she sells to her friends and acquaintances

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
We found Soledad carrying out her daily labor of making sweaters, vests and gloves which she undertakes everyday with creativity and skillfulness. She feels very satisfied with the good results that she obtains which allow her to hire two talented young people to help her with the work. Thanks to the thirteen years that she has been in business, Soledad was able to offer peace of mind and comfort for her two loved children. She was also able to set up her workshop so that she can fill the large number of orders from her demanding clients who she satisfies with beautiful and novel garments that Soledad and her young workers offer. Currently, Soledad aims to acquire a variety of prime material (wool) to increase the volume of production of her garments with the goal of exporting them to other countries and allowing her to obtain better income. Lets support this diligent mother who, with determination and dedication, aims to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a Soledad realizando su labor cotidiana de confección de chompas, chalecos y guantes, actividad que con creatividad y habilidad emprende día a día y con la que se siente muy satisfecha por los buenos resultados que obtiene, permitiéndole dar trabajo a dos jóvenes talentosos que la apoyan en su labor. Gracias a los 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad, Soledad logró ofrecer tranquilidad y bienestar a sus dos amados hijos e implementar su taller para cumplir con la gran cantidad de solicitudes de sus exigentes clientes, clientes que se sienten satisfechos por las hermosas y novedosas prendas que Soledad y sus jóvenes trabajadores les ofrecen. Actualmente Soledad pretende adquirir variedad de materia prima (lana) para aumentar el volumen de producción de sus prendas con el fin de exportarlas a otros países y así obtener mejores ingresos. Apoyemos a esta diligente madre que con empeño y dedicación pretende salir adelante.

loans.use: Acquire a variety of prime material (wool) to increase the volume of production.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
20 years ago, Rosa started selling thread for embroidery. Her husband suggested that she do so since he works in a thread factory. Because of competition, however, her sales dropped and she decided to switch businesses. This is how she decided to sell elastics. Rosa buys the elastics by kilogram in the factory at which they are made. Then she converts them into smaller pieces with her own brand name. She has also rented a car to be used as a taxi for the past 6 years. Additionally, she sells cosmetics through a catalogue. The loans for which she has asked have helped her buy elastics and maintain her car. Rosa would like to start a clothing store, but also stay in the elastic sales business.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 20 años, Rosa empezó a trabajar vendiendo hilo de bordar. Fue su esposo quien le dio la idea de dedicarse a esta actividad, ya que él trabajaba en una fábrica de hilos. Sin embargo, luego apareció la competencia extranjera, lo que le motivó a cambiarse de rubro, ya que las ventas bajaron. Fue así que decidió vender elásticos mercerizados. Rosa compra el elástico por kilos en la fábrica que lo produce. Luego, ella los convierte a piezas por metraje, donde le coloca su propia marca. Asimismo, Rosa tiene un auto que lo alquila como taxi desde hace 6 años. También vende cosméticos por catálogo. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para la compra de elásticos y para el mantenimiento del auto. A Rosa le gustaría poner una tienda de ropa, pero seguir en el negocio de la venta de elásticos.

loans.use: To purchase the elastics she sells and maintain her vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a digital camera, a camera flash, 14 film rolls and 10 pairs of batteries/Comprar una camara digital, 1 flash para camara, 14 rollos de pelicula y 10 pares de bateria.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
For 3 years, Maria has sold gas retail from her home. At the same time, she works for the gas distributor owned by her brother, for which reason she leaves the running of the business to her mother in the mornings. It was her brother's idea to start this business in their home. The loans she has requested have helped her purchase gas tanks and sell them to her neighbors.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 3 años, María vende gas por menor en su casa. Paralelamente, ella trabaja en la distribuidora de gas que tiene su hermano, por lo que le deja encargado el negocio a su mamá en las mañanas. Fue su hermano quien le dio la idea de poner este negocio en su casa. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los balones de gas y ofrecerlos a sus vecinos.

loans.use: To purchase gas tanks and sell them to her neighbors

loans.name: José Héctor

texts.es:
José Héctor started his business by investing the salary that he earned when he would go to the ranch to work all day and opened a small store for his wife so that she could manage it with the help of their children. Besides having the store, back then he had a small ranch with some cattle but, because of his debt, he decided to sell it. Since he couldn’t find a buyer, he kept the store and made it bigger to offer more. The store was small and didn’t provide sufficient income so he decided to ask for a loan to expand it and sold cheese, milk and cream. Little by little things started going well for him to the point where he didn’t have to sell his ranch. Now the store is well stocked and they sell everything. His wife died and so now one of his children manages it in the mornings and afternoons.

He needs a loan for US$600, which he plans to repay in six months, to buy merchandise and stock his store. With your help, José Héctor will continue to grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

José Héctor inició el negocio debido a que el se iba al rancho a trabajar todo el día, entonces decidió invertir su sueldo, poniéndole una tiendita a su esposa para que ella se encargara de la tienda con ayuda de sus hijos, además de tener la tiendita en aquel entonces tenia un pequeño rancho y unas cuantas vacas pero como tenia una deuda decidió venderlo y quedarse con la tiendita para ampliarla y surtir mas como no encontró quien lo comprara, y la tienda era pequeña y no daba los ingresos suficientes decidió pedir préstamo para ampliar e ir surtiendo además de la venta de los quesos, leche y jocoque poco a poco le fue bien al grado que no tuvo que vender su rancho, ahora su tienda esta muy surtida y vende de todo, su esposa falleció, y ahora uno de sus hijo es quien se encarga de cuidarla en las mañanas y el en las tardes.

El necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir su tienda. Con tu ayuda Héctor seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a general store

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Melania is 44 years old and lives in the neighbourhood Memorial Sandino. She is married and has 2 kids who are 14 and 15. Her husband is a mechanic and helps with the household costs.

Melania is a cleaner and has been for 4 years. With this loan they hope to build a room in the house to make the family more comfortable. In the future they hope to finish building their house and to give their kids an education.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Melania tiene 44 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 15 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como mecánico y aporta a los gastos del hogar. La Sra. Melania trabaja como domestica y tiene cuatro años de estar laborando, con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para construcción de un cuarto para estar más cómoda. A futuro s terminar de construir su vivienda y educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To build a room to make her family more comfortable/Construcción de un cuarto para darle comodidad a su familia

loans.name: Leodegario

texts.es:
Leodegario started his business when he retired in order to stay busy doing something and to not squander money. He decided to put a business in his own home and established a general store to have extra income to cover household expenses. He started approximately seven years ago. Little by little he has been investing in his business and this has resulted in good profits.

He needs a loan for US$500, which he plans to repay in six months, to buy merchandise and offer a better selection in his small store. With your support, Leogegario will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Leodegario inició el negocio cuando se pensiono y para estar ocupado en algo le y no malgastar ese dinero decidió poner en su mismo domicilio un negocio, estableció una tienda de abarrotes para tener otro ingreso extra para solventar los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 7 años y poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo en su negocio, y este le ha generado buenas ganancias.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de mercancía y tener mejor surtida su tiendita. Con tu apoyo Leodegario seguirá prosperando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a general store

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #56358

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Geoconda lives in the Hialeah neighborhood, is married and has two children ages 19 and 12. Her husband works as a cabinetmaker and helps with the family expenses, although in the winter he earns less because it is more difficult to work with wood. Geoconda supports her husband in the maintenance of the household by working as a maid in a private home, and in her spare time she also sells cosmetics to help him a little with the expenses. Both parents are thinking of their children’s comfort and are requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build a small room for their children, so their children can have more independence and at the same time improve their family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Geoconda habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como ebanista y le ayuda con los gastos familiares, aunque en el invierno obtiene menos ingresos ya que es más difícil trabajar cono la madera. Geoconda apoya a su marido en la manutención del hogar trabajando como doméstica en una casa particular, aunque también en sus tiempos libres vende cosméticos para ayudarse con poco con los gastos. Ambos padres están pensando en la comodidad de sus hijos, y solicitan el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y hacerles una pequeña habitación a sus hijos para que estos puedan tener independencia y al mismo tiempo mejore la calidad de vida de la familia.

loans.use: Build a room for her children

loans.name: Ana Delia

texts.es:
Ana is married and started her business when her husband, who is working in the United States, was unemployed for a period of time and he didn’t send her enough money. She began the business two years ago and decided to sell footwear. Up until now, the business has gone very well.

She is requesting a loan of $200, which she will repay over 4 months, in order to fill an order for the teachers at a school. With your support, Ana will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Ana es casada, inició el negocio cuando su esposo tuvo una temporada muy mala, en la que no había trabajo y no le mandaba suficiente dinero, el se encuentra trabajando en Estados Unidos, entonces ella inicio hace aproximadamente 2 años su negocio, decidió vender calzado y hasta la fecha le va muy bien

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir un pedido para las maestras de una escuela, con tu apoyo Ana saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Silvia has worked selling staple grains and cleaning products for the past four years from a room in her home. When she started the business her inventory was minimal, but with time the business grew and now she needs a larger space where she can store her products.

For this reason she is requesting a loan, in order to remodel a bedroom to make it larger for storage of her products. With the income from this business and support from her husband, who works as a bricklayer, she is able to educate her two children ages 8 and 19 years old. She hopes to be able to have steady work so she can finish educating them and they can become people who will be useful to society, and above all, responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Silvia se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de granos básicos y productos de limpieza, este pequeño negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Cuando empezó sus cantidades de inventario eran mínimias pero con el tiempo ha ido creciendo el negocio, y se hace necesario un lugar más amplio donde tener sus productos.

Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para la remodelación de la sala de habitación para así darle más espacio al lugar donde tiene su mercadería. Con los ingresos de este negocio y con el apoyo de su esposo que se desempeña como albañil es como han podido darle educación a sus 2 hijos de 8 y 19 años, y esperan poder contar siempre con trabajo para terminar de educarlos y hacerlos personas útiles a la sociedad y sobre todo responsables.

loans.use: Remodel a room in her home to have more space for her business

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
María started the business as she always liked trade. She had the desire to open a kiosk because she lives in a very populated neighborhood where there are a lot of children. Besides, this would allow her to help her husband with expenses because he was retired and needed another income to pay both household expenses and for their children’s education. She began approximately eight years ago by selling candy, pork rinds, fritters, tostadas and soft drinks. Later her earnings increased and little by little she began offering certain grocery items. Today she has a little bit of everything and even has video games and a soccer game that attracts children to the store and they are the ones that buy every day.

She needs a loan for US$200, which she plans to repay in four months, to offer more groceries. With your help, María will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria inició el negocio ya que siempre le gusto el comercio y tuvo la inquietud de poner un estanquillo por que vive en una colonia muy poblada donde hay muchos niños además esto le permitiría ayudar con los gastos a su esposo por que era pensionado y necesitaba otro ingreso extra para solventar los gastos, tanto de la casa como de los estudios de sus hijos. comenzó hace aproximadamente 8 años en la cual vendía solo dulces, chicharrones, frituras, tostadas y refrescos después fue incrementando las ganancias y poco a poco fue surtiendo algo de abarrotes hoy en día ya tiene un poco de todo y además tienen juegos de video y un futbolito el cual le genera que los niños vayan a su negocio y son los que le consumen diariamente

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir mas abarrotes. Con tu ayuda Maria seguirá prosperando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in a general store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is 31 years old. She has been living in her aunt’s house for the past 5 years. She is a single mother and has two school-aged children. She sews sports clothing for both men and women and distributes it in the main markets of the cities of Oruro, La Paz, and El Alto. Elizabeth has been working in this business for six years. The clothing she makes is sports clothing and the markets where she distributes it are good markets. There is competition in the markets, but she also has her own clientele because is very good with her customers and, because of her punctuality, she is one of the most sought after. There is not a fixed price for the clothing since it varies depending on the quality of the fabric, size, whether it is for men or women, model, and type of clothing. The money from the current loan request is destined for the purchase of an industrial OVER sewing machine, which she will be able to use to give her products a higher-quality finish. Elizabeth has an excellent credit history and currently does not have any other debts.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth es una señora de 31 años de edad, vive en el domicilio de su tía desde hace 5 años atrás, tiene dos hijos que están en edad escolar, Elizabeth es mamá soltera. Ella confecciona ropa deprotiva para ambos sexos y distribuye a los puestos de venta de los principales mercados de la ciudad de Oruro, La Paz y El Alto. Elizabeth trabaja en este rubro desde hace seis años atrás, la ropa que confecciona es deportiva y los mercados donde distribuye es un mercado seguro. Si bien la competencia en el mercado, ella tiene su propia clientela ya que por el excelente trato que le da a sus clientes y sobre todo su puntualidad en la entrega de productos es una de las más preferidas. No existe un precio fijo en la ropa ya que varia de acuerdo a la calidad de tela, talla, sexo, modelo y tipo de prenda. Por otra parte el dinero de la presente colicitud está destinado a la compra de maquinaria OVER industrial, con la que podrá tener productos con una terminación de mejor calidad. Elizabeth demuestra un excelente comportamiento en el sistema financiero y actualmente no tiene otras deudas.

loans.use: To buy an industrial OVER sewing machine

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos started the business because it was the first skilled occupation he learned and he needed to be independent, as he had worked for different factories as a welder. He started making doors and windows in his own home for the personnel of the same factories where he had worked. He saw that things were going well and decided to open his own shop.

He began approximately 40 years ago in a small workshop in his own home in the city of Monterrey but because they built a gas station next to his house, he had to sell that property. Since then has lived in Linares where he purchased land and set up his shop and has over time acquired more customers. He has even exported the iron doors that he makes.

He is requesting a loan for US$300, that he plans to repay in five months, to purchase welding and parts for the doors.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos inició el negocio por que fue el primer oficio que aprendió, y ante la necesidad de independizarse ya que laboraba para diferentes fabricas como soldador empezó haciendo puertas y ventanas en su propio domicilio para el personal de las mismas fabricas donde el laboraba vio que le iba bien y decidió salirse y poner su propio taller. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 40 años en un pequeño taller en su propio domicilio en la ciudad de Monterrey pero como construyeron una gasolinera al lado de su casa tuvo que vender esa propiedad y desde entonces se cambio a Linares donde adquirió un terreno y puso su taller cada vez fue adquiriendo mas clientes incluso ha llegado a exportar las puertas de forja que realiza.

El solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para la compra de soldadura y unos accesorios para unas puertas.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to manufacture doors

loans.name: Luis Beltran

texts.es:
Luis is 37 years old and lives in his own house, which he owns, with his four children. Luis makes furniture. He has been working in this business for more than five years, so he has a lot of experience in it. The amount of competition Luis has depends on the demand in the market—there can be high and low periods. He also has another source of income, which is from a vehicle that he uses for transportation. With this current loan request, he will increase his operating capital. Luis has experience with other financial institutions and has demonstrated he handles credit well.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis es un señor que tiene 37 años de edad, vive en su casa que es propia junto a sus cuatro hijos. Luis se dedica a la fabricación de muebles en general, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace más de cinco años atrás, por lo que tiene bastante experiencia en el rubro. La competencia de Luis depende de la demanda del mercado, es decir pueen haber temporadas altas y bajas. también tiene otra fuente de ingreso que proviene de una movilidad con la cuál se dedica al transporte. con la presente solicitud aumentará su capital de operación. Luis tiene experiencia con otras instituciones financieras, demostrando un buen comportamiento crediticio.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.es:
Bertha is a widow and has 4 children aged 32, 27, 26 years old and all are married. She also has a 13-year old that is in high school. She started her busines sto support her children so that they would attend school and not have to fight their way through life like her. She wished to have a better income to provide her children with the necessities of life and to send them to school. She washed and ironed people's laundry and she provided house cleaning services and she didn't want the same fate for her children.

About 17 years ago she started working at a business selling accessories. Her boss was not from the same region and so offered her the stand with the little bit of merchandise. Slowly and with good management skills she generated positive sales and her busines started growing.

She requests a loan in the amount of $350 that will be repaid in a term of 6 months to purchase clay item such as pots, decanters, vases etc.. With your help Bertha will continue making her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Bertha es viuda y tiene 4 hijos de: 32 años, 27 años, 26 años casados y una de 13 años que estudia secundaria. Inició el negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos para que estudiaran y no batallaran en la vida como ella. Ella deseaba tener un ingreso mayor para poder darle a sus hijos lo indispensable para subsistir también su preparación académica ya que ella se dedicaba a lavar, planchar y recoger casas ajenas y no quería lo mismo para sus hijos comenzó hace aproximadamente 17 años le compro el negocio de venta de novedades y accesorios, al que en ese entonces era su patrón ya que ella trabajaba atendiéndolo como no era de ahi le ofreció quedarse con el local con un poco de mercancía poco a poco con su buena administración y sus buenas ventas fue haciendo crecer su negocio.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de artículos de decoración hechos de barro como son cazuelas, jarros, floreros, vasos etc. Con tu ayuda Bertha seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is married with 2 children, a boy and a girl. She started her business to have an income. On the weekends she makes tamales and she sells thems on weekdays. Depending on the number of orders she receives she can then get an idea of how many she will be selling. She also sells her tamales in the companies where they already know her and know that her tamales are delicious. She started about 6 years ago selling tamales but it was only 2 years ago that her daughter Yesica styarted helping her make and sell them. Today they sell more on Saturdays for kids' parties and sweet sixteen celebrations. The business is quite a success.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 that will be repaid in a term of 8 months. She will use the funds to purchase ingredients for an order she has been given for a social event.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es casada y tiene 2 hijos, un hombre y una mujer. Inició el negocio para tener un ingreso ya que ella los elabora los fines de semana tamales, primero entre semana sale ofrecerlos y dependiendo de la cantidad de encargos que tenga se da una idea de cuantos se van a vender además de la venta de los tamales en las fabricas donde ya la conocen y saben que sus tamales son ricos. Comenzó hace aproximadamente hace 6 años en la venta de tamales apenas hace 2 años su hija Yesica le empezó a ayudar en la elaboración y venta, ahora venden además de los sábados para fiestas infantiles y despedidas de soltera, actualmente les va muy bien.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para poder elaborar un pedido para un evento social.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor’s family is comprised of his wife and five children. Victor has a sound system he rents out and his business name is “Shaw Tropical” (Tropical Show). He also has a business with the name of “El Platanal” (The Banana Grove) where he sells beers on the weekend. He takes his sound system to customer’s houses. He has 3 years of experience in both businesses and he doesn’t have much competition. Victor is in high demand because his sound system is one of the best (most sophisticated) in the area. With this loan request he will buy an audio amplifier and two professional speakers. The total cost is approximately $800.00—which means that Victor will finance a part of the cost. He has good financial habits and does not currently have debts with any other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia de Victor está compuesta por su esposa y sus cinco hijos. Victor ofrece servicios de amplificación y su nombre comercial es "Shaw Tropical" y paralelamente tiene un local denominado "El Platanal" donde vende cerveza los fines de semana, con la amplificación trabaja a domicilio, en ambos negocios tiene 3 años de experiencia. Su competencia es baj, Victor es muy demandado debido a que su equipo es uno de los mejores y de los más completos (sofisticados) del sector. Con la presente solicitud comprará un elevador y dos parlantes profesionales, el costo total de los tres es aproximadamente de $us. 800.-, es decir que Victor se financiará una parte del costo. Presenta un buen comportamiento financiero y actualmente no tiene deudas con terceras instituciones.

loans.use: To buy an audio amplifier and professional speakers for his sound system

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime is an exemplary father and husband. Since he was young, he has proven to be hard working, enterprising and diligent. This is why after long years of effort and dedication he was finally able to open his carbonated drinks factory which he baptized with the name “Piranita.” Initially, this business did not seem to be very profitable but his perseverance transformed his company into an indispensable source of income for his family and for the four enterprising young people who he employs in his small factory. By employing these four people, he contributes to lowering number of unemployed people in his country. Jaime, his family, and his young employees have great plans for this business and are sure that with your help they can solidify the majority of their projects. Jaime presents himself before you to ask for a loan in the amount of $1075.00, which he will invest in expanding his factory. He commits himself to repaying the loan in no more than six months. Lets be an important part of the growth of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Don Jaime es un ejemplar padre y esposo, desde pequeño demostró ser muy trabajador, emprendedor y diligente, es por ello que tras largos años de esfuerzo y dedicación pudo finalmente abrir su pequeña fabrica de bebidas gaseosas, bautizada con el nombre de “Pirañita”. Este negocio, en un principio no parecía ser muy rentable, pero su constancia hizo que convirtiera su empresa en un indispensable ingreso económico para su familia y la de cuatro emprendedores jóvenes a quienes brinda trabajo en su pequeña fabrica. De esta manera colabora en disminuir la tasa de desempleados en su país. Don Jaime, su familia y sus jóvenes empleados tienen grandes planes en su negocio y están seguros que con tu apoyo podrán cristalizar gran parte de sus proyectos. En esta oportunidad, Jaime se presenta ante vosotros para solicitarles un préstamo por el monto de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertirlo en ampliar su fábrica de gaseosas comprometiéndose en devolver el préstamo en un lapso no mayor de los 6 meses. Seamos parte importante del crecimiento de este negocio.

loans.use: Expansion and improvement of carbonated drinks factory.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente’s family consists of his two children, who are 2 and 11 years old. The three of them live in their house, which they own. The family’s primary source of income is passenger transport on the Chane Ind. Minero y Montero route. His wife works as a primary teacher in the town of Puerto Fernandez. There is a lot of competition in the public transportation sector, but he is widely preferred because he is popular in the neighborhood. With this current loan request he will buy a computer system, which costs approximately Bs. 8,000.00. Vicente has good credit references.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia de Vicente está conformada por sus dos hijos de 2 y 11 años respectivamente, los tres residen en su domicilio que es propio. La actividad principal de la familia es el servicio de transporte con ruta Chane Ind. Minero y Montero, su conyugue trabaja como docente en la comunidad de Puerto Fernandez en el nivel primario. Dentro de lo que se refiere a transporte público hay bastante competencia pero tiene bastante preferecia por ser popular en la zona. Con la presente solicitud adquirirá un equipo de computación que tiene un costo aproximado de Bs. 8,000.-. Vicente tiene muy buenas referencias crediticias en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: To buy a computer system

loans.name: Teodomiro

texts.es:
Teodomiro is 40 years old and has three children, who are 15, 11, and 3 years old. His wife takes care of the children while he works as a policeman in the Identification department. Teo also has had a passenger transport business for a long time, for which he hires drivers with good references. He has a good work history in the police department. He has competition in the transportation business due to the growing number of automobiles working in passenger transport. He has, however, been able to carry on with his small business. He is also a very well known police officer. With this loan request, Teo will buy construction materials, such as bricks and cement, to build walls to surround his house, which is located in a neighborhood that is distant from the city. With this loan, he will enjoy greater security in his house. This is Teo’s third loan with our institution. He has demonstrated good repayment habits.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodomiro es un señor de 40 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de 15, 11 y 3 años respectivamente, su esposa es quien cuida de los niños mientras Teodomiro trabaja en la policia en el departamento de Identificadiones.Paralelamente Teo trabaja desde hace bastante tiempo en el transporte de pasajeros para lo cual contrata choferes con buenas referencias. Dentro el cuerpo policial cuenta con un buen historial. Cuenta con competencia debido al creciente número de automóviles que trabajan en el transporte de pasajeros. Sin embargo el ha sabido llevar a delante su pequeño negocio, además que es una persona bastante conocida en la policia. Teo con la presente solicitud adquirirá materiales de construcción como ser ladrillos y cemento para edifica los muros perimetrales de su vivienda que se encuentra ubicada en un barrio alejado de la ciudad, gracias a esto gozará de mayor seguridad en su casa. Esta solicitud es la tercera frecuencia de Teo con nuestra institución, tiempo en el que demostró tener un buen cumplimiento en el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: To construct a wall around his house

loans.name: Luasefulutasi

texts.en:
Luasefulutasi F., 26, is single with no children.

She has three years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the public three days per week.

She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~$125 USD).

SPBD loans are Luasefulutasi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used for the business and for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase a canoe, fishing net and more things needed for fishing.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana started her business after her husband sustained a car accident while driving his cab and he had to pay for the damages to the other party involved in the accident. That's when he started to work as a labourer to pay off the debt but he often didn't have enough work. So they decided to set up a little stand to at least earn a minimum amoun of money every day. They started 3 hyears ago selling only the basics, milk, pop, bread, tortillas, cooking oil. But now they have set up some appliances where they can make snacks: deep fried foods, rinds, nachos with cheese, etc. It is a great success.

She needs a loan in the amount of $200 US that will be repaid in a term of 4 months to purchase a supply of groceries to keep their store well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Juana inicio el negocio cuando su esposo tuvo un choque con el carro de sitio que manejaba y tuvo que pagara los daños a la persona afectada quien le dio suficiente plazo para que le arreglara el coche, en ese entonces se metió a trabajar en la obra para pagar la deuda pero en ocasiones no tenia trabajo y fue cuando decidieron poner una tiendita para asi sacar mínimo algún ingreso diario. Inicio hace 3 años vendiendo solo lo indispensable leche, refresco, pan, tortillas, aceite, ahora puso algunas maquinitas y otras cosas como tipo snack: donde vende frituras, chicharrones preparados, nachos con queso, etc. y le va muy bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 4 meses para la compra de abarrotes, y así mantener surtido su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Emiliana De

texts.es:
Emiliana is a woman with four children, of whom only one is a girl. The eldest is approximately 17 years old, and the youngest is 6 years old. She has a nuclear family that is very stable and close. They have rented for several years in the same neighborhood. Emiliana and her husband have a sound system. Her husband also works in a factory sewing pants. They have a lot of experience in both of these businesses—they have been working in sewing for approximately 12 years. The competition in the business is moderate. They have been offered the opportunity to buy a moderately-used television for Bs. 1,200.00. The client has a good history with the institution. Her average is zero after 5 repaid loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Emiliana es una señora que tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales solo una es mujer (la mayor) aproximadamente de 17 años y el pequeño tiene unos 6 años. Tiene un nucleo familiar muy estable y una familia muy unida. Viven en alquiler ya muchos años en la misma zona. Emiliana junto con su esposo tienen una amplificacion, además su esposo trabaja en una fabrica de pantalones como costurero. Tienen bastante experiencia en sus 2 actividades, la costura es donde son mas antiguos con aproximadamente 12 años. La competencia en el medio es relativa y moderada. Le ofrecieron de oportunidad un televisor a medio uso en Bs. 1,200.-. Cliente de la institución con muy buen comportamiento, su promedio es de cero tras 5 creditos cancelados.

loans.use: To buy a television   CONSUMO, COMPRA DE TELEVISOR

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita emigated with her entire family to this border due to the danger of her home land. On arriving at the border, her husband began looking for work, which he found, but the income was low and was not enough to meet their basic needs. So, Margarita decided to start up a business which would bring in a bit more money to cover costs. She started the grocery business in her home, where she paid the rent, and built up her stock bit by bit. As profits generated by the business grew, the business itself grew bit by bit, as did the number of customers visiting her. This led to a higher income which helped her family economically. With time, and the money generated by this business, she bought a premises where she now is, and a piece of land at the back, where she is now building a premises for her business.

She is requesting a loan of $975 which she will pay in 6 months, to redesign the premises and buy stock, in order to increase sales. With your help, Margarita will be able to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Margarita emigro con toda su familia a esta frontera por la necesidad precaria de su tierra natal. Al llegar a la frontera su esposo empezó a buscar trabajo, el cual encontró, pero su ingreso era poco, y no alcanzaba para solventar las necesidades económicas. Entonces la Sra. Margarita decidió iniciar un negocio que le dejara un poco mas de ingresos para poder cubrir todos los gastos. Inicio el negocio de abarrotes donde ella vivía, el cual pagaba renta, fue surtiendo mercancía poco a poco, en la medida que con la utilidad que le generaba el negocio, ella fue creciendo poco a poco y haciéndose de más clientes y por lo tanto tenia mas ingresos para poder satisfacer todas las necesidades económicas. Con el transcurso del tiempo y con los ingresos que este negocio generaba compro el local en el que estaba y un solar en la parte de atrás en el cual hoy en día construyo un local para su negocio.

Ella esta solicitando de un crédito por $975 que pagara en 6 meses, para la remodelación del local y compra de surtido de mercancía, para incrementar sus ventas. Con tu poyo Margarita hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To redesign her premises

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en:
Talosaga B., 53, is widowed with five children.

She has three years of experience in the Flea Market/fishing business. She sells to the public and people of the village five days per week.

She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD).

SPBD loans are Talosaga’s only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used for the business. Her husband is helping operate the business.

loans.use: Purchase what is needed for the flea market and for fishing.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo is 25 years old and lives at family member's house that is located in the first ring. Rodolfo has more than two years of experience en the business of selling fragrance oils and incense. He has a fixed client base owing to the age of his and, above all, the quality of service that he provides to his clients. Rodolfo will use the loan as operating capital and thus increase his stock of fragrance oils, since he has various orders pending. Rodolfo is always increasing his product line which is why he takes out loans to be able to rotate his merchandise. He has demonstrated good prior credit payment.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Rodolfo tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el domicilio de un familiar que se encuentra ubicado por el primer anillo. Rodolfo tiene más de dos años de experiencia en el negocio de la comercialización de escencias y sahomerios. Ya cuenta con clientes fijos debido a la antiguedad de su actividad y sobre todo a la calidad de atención que brinda a sus clientes, cueta con clientes fijos a los cuales les deja la mercadería. rodolfo destinará el crédito para capital de operación y así aumentará su stock de escencias, esto debido a que tiene varios pedidos. Rodolfo siempre está incrementando sus productos por lo que saca sus préstamos para el continuo rotamiento de su mercadería. Tiene un buen comportamiento crediticio.

loans.use: Increase in operating capital

loans.name: Faasu

texts.en:
Faasu V., 38, is married with five children.

She has two years of experience in the Taro plantation business. She sells to the village people and public three days per week.

She has two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD).

SPBD loans are Faasu’s only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to maintain her business. Her husband works as a taxi driver to lend financial support.

loans.use: Purchase a fence, weedkiller and chemicals

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy is 32 years old, is single and has no dependents. He works as a driver of a microbus in public transport with a bus given to him by his father. He has more than 6 years of experience in the transportation field, since his father is an owner of various microbuses. Although there is quite a bit of competition in this field, there is also similar demand for the service. In addition, the family belongs to a transportation line that has an established route. The current loan is to increase his operating capital. This is his fourth loan and has demonstrated excellent punctuality in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Freddy tiene 32 años de edad es soltero y no tiene dependientes. Trabaja como chofer de micros en el transporte público con un micro que su padre le dio, tiene más de 6 años de experiencia en el rubro del transporte, ya que su papá es propietario de micros. Si bien existe bastante competencia en este rubro, paralelamente también existe demanda por este servicio. Además la familia pertenece a una línea de transporte con ruta establecida. La presente solicitud es para incrementar su capital de operaciones. esta es su cuarta operación y demostró tener excelentes referencias de puntualidad en sus pagos.

loans.use: Increase his operating capital

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis originally started selling natural medecines to help a friend and share the profits with him. Later he decided to set up his own business or work directly with the company, and receive training, as the profits would be for him alone. Once he was qualified to sell the products, he dedicated his time to this entirely, and has been doing well until now.

He is requesting a loan of US $500 which he will pay back within 6 months, to buy products, material to set up a club, and also train his customers. He hopes that with your help, his business will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Jorge Luis inicio vendiendo productos naturistas como promotor ayudándole a un amigo y compartiendo las ganancias con el. Posteriormente el decidió poner su propio negocio o sea estar trabajando directamente con la empresa, y recibir su capacitación respectiva, ya que así las ganancias solo serian para el. Después que fue capacitado para la venta de los productos, se dedico de lleno a esto, y hasta hoy le ha ido bien.

El solicita un crédito de US $500 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de productos, compra de material para poner un club, y al igual dar capacitación a sus clientes. El tiene la esperanza que con que con tu apoyo el hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy stock

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #56380

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana’s family always dedicated themselves to making carbonated drinks and fruit juices. Liliana did not wish to alienate herself from the family business which is why with effort and determination she slowly began to establish her small fruit juice factory. Currently, she is very happy with what she has accomplished through these years. In addition, like every other mother that wants the best for her children, she dedicated herself to making beautiful hand made works because, since she was a child, she showed a great ability for this art. Thanks to her ability, she has obtained good economic results which allowe her to provide for the welfare and education of her three children who are what drive her to continue ahead. Nevertheless, it is necessary for her to expand her factory because there is a great demand for her delicious fruit juices. So that her business will burgeon as Liliana hopes it will, she wishes to tap into your generous hearts with the hope of obtaining a favorable response to the loan that she is seeking.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La familia de Liliana se dedicó siempre a la elaboración de bebidas gaseosas y néctar, doña Liliana no deseaba ser ajena a esta actividad familiar, por ello que con esfuerzo y empeño, poco a poco fue implementando su pequeña fabrica de néctares. Actualmente se siente muy feliz con lo que ha conseguido a lo largo de estos años de esfuerzo, adicionalmente a esta labor como toda madre que desea lo mejor para los suyos se dedicó a realizar hermosos trabajos manuales, ya que desde niña demostró gran habilidad para ese arte, gracias a ello, obtuvo buenos beneficios económicos, que le permitieron brindar bienestar y educación a sus tres hijos, quienes son el motor que la impulsa a seguir adelante. Sin embargo, le es menester implementar y ampliar su fábrica, porque tiene una gran acogida y demanda sus deliciosos néctares. A fin de que su negocio surja como doña Liliana espera, ella desea tocar vuestros generosos corazones con la esperanza de obtener pronta respuesta favorable al préstamo que solicita.

loans.use: Expand her fruit juice factory.

loans.name: Antonio Luis

texts.es:
Luis Antonia has three children, two sons and a daughter whose ages are 22, 18 and 15, respectively. The house where they currently live is rented from another person. Luis works painting houses, apartments, etc. He also works in brick masonry, plumbing and electrical work, as well as a waiter with his wife who runs a catering service for various occasions. There is competition in his different fields of work; nonetheless, his advantage is that he has a firm client base and well as working with a friend of his who is an architect that requires his services. Luis is characterized by the quality of his work as well as his punctuality. With his current loan he will buy paint, paint thinner, and paint brushes to paint an entire two-story house. Luis responsibly makes his loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis Antonio tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son varones y una mujer, sus edades son de 22, 18 y 15 años respectivamente. La vivienda donde actualmente viven la alquilan de una tercera persona. Luis se dedica al pintado de casas, departamentos, etc. También ofrece sus servicios de albañilería, plomería, electricidad, también trabaja como garzón junto a su esposa que ofrece servicios de Bufett de comidas para diferentes ocasiones. Existe competencia en sus rubros, sin embargo su ventaja consiste en que tienen clientela consolidada, además que trabaja con un arquitecto (amigo) que requiere de sus servicios. Luis se caracteriza por la calidad y puntualidad en la oferta de sus servicios. Con la presente solicitud comprará pintura, thiner, brochas, etc., para pintar toda una casa de dos pisos. Luis cumple responsablemente con el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Tomaza

texts.es:
Fifteen years ago, Tomaza lived in her native town of Calapuja. Upon seeing that her children needed a better education, she decided to relocate to the city of Juliaca. She invested money she saved during her years of marriage in acquiring sewing machines. Thus, with great effort and dedication she began to make sweaters, gloves and scarves which she sells wholesale in San Jose’s market. Tamaza and her husband are very happy and proud of their seven children because all of them help to make their workshop a success. This affectionate mother’s wish for which she is asking this loan is to convert her workshop into one of the largest and most successful in the city. She is certain that with the support of all of her family and your collaboration, she will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Tomaza hasta hace 15 años vivía en su pueblo natal Calapuja, al ver que sus hijos requerían una mejor educación decidió radicar en la ciudad D. Juliaca, el dinero que le costó reunir durante sus años D. matrimonio lo invirtió en adquirir máquinas D. tejer, así que con esfuerzo y dedicación fue confeccionando hermosas chompas, guantes y chalinas que venD. al por mayor en el mercado San José D. la ciudad. Tomaza y su esposo se sienten muy contentos y orgullosos D. sus 7 hijos, porque todos ponen la mano para sacar adelante su taller. El deseo D. esta cariñosa madre y para lo cual solicita el préstamo, es convertir su taller en uno D. los más grandes y exitosos D. la ciudad y está segura que con el apoyo D. toda su familia y vuestra colaboración lo conseguirá.

loans.use: Expand her garment workshop with infrastructure and new machinery.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca started her business to help her husband with the family income and improve their financial situation in order to give their children a good education and a better way of life. She startedin January 2006 in front of a school which was half a block from her house. Initially she sold 'gorditas' (typically beef wraps, pittas etc) as she has spent three years working for a company where she learned to make them. With the help of her husband she set up a "stash" of money and when they had enough savings, she used this to buy a dessert trolley, in order to sell her 'gorditas' in the mornings and then, Friday to Sunday she would sell cakes in the evenings, which has been going very well and now she is thinking about a bigger premises.

She is requesting a loan of US $300, which she will pay back within 3 months, in order to buy raw material to make her 'gorditas' and cakses and have reserves to meet her customers' needs. With your help, Blanca will be able to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Blanca inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos familiares y mejorar económicamente para darles a sus hijas una buena educación y un mejor nivel de vida. Comenzó en Enero de 2006 enfrente de una escuela que queda a media cuadra de su casa, primero se dedicó a vender gorditas ya que había trabajado durante tres años como empleada de un negocio y ahí fue donde aprendió a elaborarlas. Con la ayuda de su esposo se metió a una “tanda” de dinero y cuando les toco recibir el ahorro con eso compraron un carrito de tortas, de manera que ahora vende gorditas en las mañanas y de viernes a domingo vende tortas en la noche con lo cual les ha ido muy bien y esta pensando en poner un local mas grande.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de las gorditas y las tortas y tener siempre una reserva para poder atender las necesidades de sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Blanca seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a married man, his wife is the co-borrower. This couple has two children, an 18 year old son Gustavo and a 16 year old daughter Veronica. The family has three sources of income: One is Juan's service as a contractor in brick masonry, another is his wife's work making bread and other baked goods and finally they rent a car that offers service as a taxi. Due to an insufficient workforce and the increase in construction work in the city in which Juan lives, he always has work, and his wife is well known for her baked goods and has quite a few clients. The current loan will be destined to the purchase of construction material necessary for the repair of Juan's property such as bricks, cement, work, etc. This is the third loan that Juan has requested from this institution which is why it is known that he has a good record in making the loan payments. It should be noted that at the time the photo was taken Juan wasn't present so the photo was taken of his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan es un señor casado, su esposa es la codeudora y esta pareja cuenta con dos hijos de 18 años (Gustavo) y 16 años (Veronica). La familia tiena tres fuentes de ingreso: Una es que Juan presta sus servicios como contratista albañil, su esposa por otra parte se dedica a la elaboración de pan y otros productos horneados, y por último rentan una movilidad que ofrece sus servcicios como taxi. Debido a la falta de mano de obra y el incremento en las construcciones en la ciudad de residencia de Juan, siempre cuenta con trabajo, por otra parte su esposa es muy conocida por los horneados que realiza y cuenta con bastante clientela. La presente solicitud será destinada a la compra de material de construcción necesaria para la refacción del inmueble de Juan como son ladrillos, cemento, madera y otros. Esta es la tercera solicitud que solicita Juan en nuestra institución por lo que sabemos que tiene un buen cumplimiento en el pago de sus cuotas. Se hace notar que en el momento de la foto no estaba Juan por lo que la misma se tomó a su esposa.

loans.use: Materials for home repairs

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia was born in the Moquegua section but, for work reasons, she decided to relocate to the city of Juliaca with her cherished children and her laborious husband. Currently, they rent a small apartment in the city. Lidia and her husband wish to offer their children peace of mind, comfort and above all a better quality of life. Everyday, after performing her duties as a mother, she leaves her home and sets about walking long hours to offer cosmetics to her friends and neighbors. Her warm treatment of her customers and her experience in the business, assure the sales of her products. Lidia’s desire is for capital to invest in acquiring products on sale so that she can have them in stock to be able to offer at a moments notice to her clients and not just through catalog orders. Lidia has deposited her hopes in your generous hearts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia nació en el departamento de Moquegua, por cuestiones de trabajo decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca junto a sus queridos hijos y laborioso esposo. Actualmente, tienen un pequeño departamento alquilado en dicha ciudad, Lidia y su esposo desean ofrecer a sus hijos tranquilidad, comodidad y sobre todo una mejor calidad de vida. Cada día, luego de realizar su labor de madre abandona su hogar para emprender largas horas de caminata ofreciendo cosméticos a sus amistades y vecinos, que gracias a la calidez en su trato y experiencia en el negocio aseguran las ventas de sus productos. El deseo de Lidia es contar con mayor capital de inversión, dinero que le permitirá adquirir productos en oferta que tendría en stock para ofrecerlos en el momento a sus clientes y no sólo a pedido con los catálogos que utiliza. Lidia tiene depositada su esperanza en vuestros generosos corazones.

loans.use: Capital to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael started his business after having been employed with various companies and was never able to accumulate tenure to count towards his retirement. He felt a need to find another way to support himself.

He started his business in May of 2002 when he acquired a license for a Taxi cab. He had previously worked as a bus driver in his spare time but when his bus route was cancelled the government supported them by providing the workers with Taxi licenses. He got himself a car and it has all gone very well, so much so that he is looking into buying a mini-bus to increase his business.

He requires a loan in the amount of $300 US that will be repaid in a term of 3 months to invest in the repair of his car door and the trunk of the car, to present a better image and better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Ismael inició el negocio ya que trabajó como empleado en muchas empresas y nunca pudo lograr una antigüedad para pensionarse por lo que fue necesario buscar otro medio de vida para sostenerse.
