Comenzó su negocio en Mayo de 2002 cuando le dieron una concesión para Taxi ya que anteriormente en sus tiempos libres trabajaba en un transporte de ruta fija, pero como esta ruta desapareció el gobierno los apoyó dándonos concesiones de Taxi pero el tenia que adquirir el Taxi, con el cual le ha ido muy bien y ya esta pensando inclusive en comprar un microbús usado un poquito mas adelante para seguir creciendo.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para invertir en la reparación de una puerta y el cofre de su Taxi y dar una mejor imagen y servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To invest in the repair of the car.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa lives in her house, which she has owned for 22 years, along with her 25 year old daughter that helps her selling liquors in the family business that they run together. Rosa is a single mother. Her business is placed in a strategic location frequented by wealthy persons and has been selling beverages at the wholesale and retail level for five years. She has quite a bit of demand because there are no other stores in the area that offer the same service, in addition to the attention that both women pay to their clients and the great store hours. This loan will be destined for the purchase of sodas, juices, cans of beer and other liquor which total 4,000 Bolivian Soles. They have a good credit history. It's worth noting that Rosa didn't want to appear in the photo which is why the picture is only of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa vive en su domicilio que es propio desde hace 22 años atrás, tiene una hija de 25 años quien también le ayuda en la venta de licores en el negocio familiar que administran. Rosa es una mamá soltera. Su negocio esta ubicada en un lugar estratégico debido a la afluencia de gente por este lugar donde ya ofrece el servicio de venta al por mayor y menor de bebidad desde hace 5 años atrás. tiene bastante demanda porque por el lugar no hay otra tiendas que ofrezcan el mismo servicio, además que la atención que ambas brindan a su clientela es muy buena y los horarios bastante comodos para los demandantes. Este préstamo será destinado a la compra de refrescos, jugos, cerveza en latas y otros licores que en su totalidad asciende a un costo de Bs. 4,000.-. Tienen buenos antecedentes crediticios. Se hace notar QUE ROSA NO QUIZO SALIR EN LA FOTO POR LO QUE SÓLO SE TOMO DEL NEGOCIO.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks, juices, sodas for grocery store

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina is a diligent young woman who, through time, has learned the true value of work and how dignifying it is. Unfortunately, Delfina suffered the painful loss of her parents which caused and still causes her much pain. After she and her older sister were orphaned, they both dedicated themselves to different businesses to find better opportunities in their lives. This is why Delfina, with her sister’s support, dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetics through which she generates income to cover her university expenses. The desire that this enterprising young woman has is for greater capital to invest. This money will allow her to solidify her projects, this is why she is coming to you with the hope of finding a favorable response.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Delfina es una diligente joven que con el transcurso del tiempo fue conociendo el verdadero valor del trabajo y cuan dignificante es él. Lamentablemente, Dora sufrió la penosa pérdida de sus padres, hecho que le causó y le causa mucho dolor hasta hoy, desde entonces quedaron huérfanas ella y su hermana mayor, ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades para buscar día a día mejores oportunidades de vida. Por ello, Delfina con apoyo de su hermana viene dedicándose al negocio de venta de cosméticos, actividad mediante la cual genera ingresos económicos para cubrir con satisfacción los gastos de la universidad. El deseo de esta emprendedora jovencita es contar con mayor capital de inversión, dinero que le permitirá concretar sus proyectos, por ello recurre a tu generoso corazón con la esperanza de encontrar pronta respuesta favorable.

loans.use: Capital to invest in improving the sale of cosmetics.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana M. is a person with focus, she is enterprising and active. She is married with two children: Amayrany is 9 years old and is currently attending primary school; and Brandon is 2 years old. She started her business to have a second income from her husband's, so that she can provide her children a better life and become a success. She started in April 2002 sellnig sweets outside her house located in front of two schools, where many students pass by. She wanted to take advantage of that fact and it was going very well, so well that her husband decided to join her and set up a larger stand. Today they can depend on their stand, and always continue to work hard to make it through.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 US that will be repaid in a term of 3 months to purchase more merchandise that is in great demand and to have a better selection to offer her clients. With your help all of this can be made possible.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Juana Martínez es una persona seria, emprendedora y activa. S casada y tiene 2 hijos: Amayrany de 9 años, estudiante de primaria y Brandon de 2 años. Inició el negocio para tener otro ingreso aparte de lo que percibe su esposo y poder darles a sus hijos una vida mejor y salir adelante. Comenzó en Abril de 2002 vendiendo dulces afuera de su casa ya que tiene casi enfrente dos escuelas y pasan muchos estudiantes, por lo cual quiso aprovechar, y como me empezó a ir muy bien con la venta de dulces su esposo se animó a poner un negocio un poco mas grande lo cual hicieron. En la actualidad ya cuentan con su miscelánea y les va muy bien, están esforzándonos por salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder comprar mercancía que tiene mayor demanda y tener un mejor surtido para atender a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina has her own house that has all of the basic amenities and has two children that are 15 and 8 years old, respectively, whom study at a public school. Her grocery store has a wide selection of products and it is located in her house. Due to her five years of experience in this business she now has a steady clientele. There is competition in the grocery store business; nonetheless, the success of her sales is due to the store's location and her relationships with her clients and above all, maintaining her store well stocked with merchandise. Marina buys products via wholesale in order to sell them at retail prices, which allows her to have a good profit margin. Marina has an excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina cuenta con una casa propia que tiene todos los servicios básicos, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 8 años respectivamente, ambas estudian en una escuela fiscal. Su negocio de abarrotes se encuentra mu bien surtido y se encuentra ubicado en el mismo domicilio, debido a su experiencia en este rubro de más de 5 años cuenta con clientela fija. Existe competencia en el rubro de venta de abarrotes, sin embargo el éxito de sus venta radica en su ubicación y su buen relacionamiento con su clientela y sobre todo al mantener frecuentemente un amplio surtido de mercadería. Marina compra productos al por mayor para revenderlos al raleo, lo que le permite tener un buen margen de ganancia. Marina tiene un excelente antecedente crediticio.

loans.use: Capital to invest in the purchase of groceries for store

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
With a strong desire to improve constantly motivating her, Margot earns most of her income from selling cosmetics. She began selling these products 5 years ago, thanks to the advice of one of her relatives. Currently her talent for sales, gift of persuasion, and personal warmth have made Margot one of the most successful beauty products sales people in the city. She has a large number of orders, which she often cannot fill because of lack of investment capital. For this reason Margot is hoping to receive your support in the form of the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Los deseos de progresar motivan constantemente a Margot, quien encontró en el negocio de venta de cosméticos su principal ingreso económico, empezó con esta labor hace 5 años, gracias al consejo de uno de sus familiares. Actualmente su habilidad para las ventas, don de persuasión y la calidez en su trato, la convirtieron en una de las vendedoras más exitosas de cosméticos de belleza de su ciudad. Ella cuenta con gran cantidad de solicitudes, solicitudes que en muchos casos no puede complacer por falta de capital de inversión, con ese fin Margot desea recibir vuestra ayuda, con el préstamo que solicita.

loans.use: Purchase additional cosmetics to be able to fulfill client orders

loans.name: Alcira De

texts.es:
Alcira is 38 years old. She owns her own house which is located in the west part of Warnes, close to the new market. She and her 39 year-old husband have two children aged 18 and 14. Alcira receives a daily rental income from two motorbike taxis and an Orient Association vehicle which services an interprovincial route. Her husband is a permanent and long-time employee at a food company where he works in the yeast plant. There is moderate amount of competition in the transportation business for this service. Her husband, on the other hand, is on a fixed contract, receives a monthly salary, and does not need to worry about competition. With the current loan Alcira bought chickens to sell in the new market near her house—she used all the loan for this purpose. She has a very good credit rating.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Alcira tiene 38 años de edad y vive en su casa que es propia y se encuentra ubicada en la zona oeste de Warnes cerca del mercado nuevo junto a su esposo Isaac que tiene 39 años de edad y sus dos hijos de 18 y 14 años de edad respectivamente. Alcira recibe una renta diaria de dos moto taxis y de un vehículo con línes en la asociación del Oriente con ruta inter provincial, por otra parte su esposo es trabajador fijo y antiguo de una empresa de ALIMENTOS donde trabaja como obrero en la planta de levaduras. La competencia es mediana en las actividades del transporte por la demanda de este servicio, por otra parte su esposo no tiene competencia por que tiene contrato fijo y percibe sueldo mensual. Con el presente crédito Marina colocó una venta de pollos en el mercado nuevo de la ciudad y que esta cerca de su casa, para este efecto invirtió todo el préstamo. Tiene muy buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell for meat.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emmas is married and has four children: Heriberto is 33 years odl and lives in the US; Olga is 36 years old and she is employed; Deyanira is 27 years old and she is a married homemaker; and, Manuel is 24 years old and works as a mechanic's assistant.

She started her business because she wasn't meeting all her household expenditures. Her husband works as a labourer and his income is not steady. She started 10 years ago after she was recommended to start a grocery store and she is seeing good profits.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 US that will be repaid in a term of 4 months, to purchase merchandise. With your help Emma will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Emma es casada y tiene 4 hijos: Heriberto 33 esta en E.U. Olga 36 años emplead, Deyanira de 27 años se dedica al hogar es casada y Manuel de 24 años trabaja de ayudante de un taller Inicio el negocio ya que no completaba con los gastos de la casa, ya que su esposo trabaja como albañil y no tiene un ingreso fijo. Comenzó hace 10 años su negocio, por recomendaciones empezó con sus tienda de abarrotes, obteniendo buenas ganancias.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Emma saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Aldolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo lives in the neighbourhood Villa Reconciliacion. He is 45, married and has 4 kids that are all studying. His wife sells tamales and helps around the home. Adolfo is a taxi driver and has been for 7 years. He started off as a lorry driver but he sold the lorry and bought a taxi. With the loan that he is asking for he will build a better kitchen in their home. He also plans to buy another taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Adolfo habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y le tienen cuatro hijos que están estudiando, su esposa vende nacatamales y ayuda en su hogar. Don Adolfo es taxista tiene siete años de experiencia, e inició en una camioneta de acarreo, la vendió y compró un taxi. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para infraestructura en la construcción de la cocina de su vivienda para estar más cómodo. Sus planes son comprar otra unidad de taxi.

loans.use: To build a kitchen in his home/Construcción de cocina en su casa de habitación

loans.name: Martha Amalia

texts.es:
Martha is always thinking about the well-being of her family. She has 3 kids but only one still lives with her, the other two are independent. Her husband is a salesman and they both are in charge of supporting their family. Martha has been working hard in a small grocery store that she has in her home for 3 years.

The credit she asked for is to build a wall for her house so that it will be more secure as in the neighbourhood Villa Reconciliacion where she lives there are a lot of delinquents.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Martha está siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia. Tiene tres hijos, pero sólo a uno de ellos tiene a su cargo, sus otros dos hijos ya son independientes a ellas. Su esposo es comerciante y ambos se encargan de aportar para mantener a su familia. Doña Martha lleva tres años de duro trabajo en una pequeña pulpería que tiene en su hogar. El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro lateral en su casa de habitación para así poder darle mayor seguridad a su casa, ya que el barrio de Villa Reconciliación donde habita tiene altos índices delincuenciales.

loans.use: To build a wall for their house/Construcción de un muro lateral en su casa de habitación

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina’s love and dedication to her family were sufficient motivation for her to work diligently and take charge of her beloved family’s development. A young mother, Josefina is originally from Cuzco. But since her marriage she has lived in Juliaca city with her husband and two young children. Lacking employment opportunities, Josefina decided to earn her own income. With the advice and support of a friend, she has begun making bracelets and necklaces for women by hand. She sells this merchandise in bulk in Juliaca. In addition to this work, when she has free time, Josefina diligently and tirelessly goes door to door to offer laundry services – work she has performed since she was little. The income Josefina earns from these jobs, combined with her husband's income, is enough to cover their children’s food and education expenses. Josefina is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles (about $375) to invest in the purchase of materials so she can continue practicing her art.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El amor y dedicación por su familia motivan lo suficiente a Josefina para desempeñar con diligencia su trabajo y ser protagonista del desarrollo de su amada familia. Esta joven madre es natural del departamento de Cuzco pero desde que contrajo matrimonio viene radicando en la ciudad de Juliaca al lado de su esposo y sus dos menores hijos. Por la falta de oportunidad de trabajo Josefina decidió generar sus propios ingresos económicos, es así que por el consejo y apoyo de una amiga viene elaborando artesanalmente pulseras y collares para damas, mercadería que vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Juliaca. Adicionalmente a esta labor, esta diligente e incansable madre, cuando tiene disponibilidad de tiempo, no desestima en tocar puerta por puerta para desempeñar el oficio que desde pequeña la caracterizaba, lavar ropa, con esta noble labor, Josefina viene cubriendo junto a su esposo los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Josefina pide un préstamo por el monto de 1000 soles para invertir en la adquisición de materia prima y seguir realizando su arte.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making bracelets and necklaces

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
After completing high school, Cristina has achieved financial independence. This has turned her into a self-assured, diligent and hard-working woman who is prepared to succeed in life. At the young age of 22, Cristina currently earns most of her income from making fabrics. She began this work with the help of her aunt Inés, whom Cristina adores and thinks of as a second mother for the immense support Inés has provided at every opportunity.

Cristina is an intelligent woman with a strong will and dedication. By making the best use of her time spent between fabrics and books, she is pursuing her university education. She keeps in mind that the detail in her fabrics can become very complex and require hours of work. Critina is requesting a loan to have more working capital, which she will use to purchase a greater variety of wool. She also will continue realizing her talents with great skill and creativity in the form of her dress fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Su independencia económica desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios han convertido en una mujer segura de sí misma y de lo que está dispuesta a alcanzar en la vida a Cristina, joven diligente y trabajadora que a sus 22 años encontró en la arte de tejidos, su principal ingreso económico. Emprendió esta labor gracias al apoyo de su tía Inés, a quien quiere y considera como una segunda madre por el inmenso apoyo que en todo momento le brindó.

Cristina es una mujer inteligente que con voluntad y dedicación viene siguiendo estudios superiores aprovechando su tiempo al máximo y equilibrándolo entre los libros y el tejido, teniendo en cuenta que el detalle de estas prendas puede resultar muy complejo y demandar largar horas de trabajo. El préstamo que Cristina requiere le permitirá contar con mayor capital, dinero que lo invertirá en adquirir gran variedad de lana y seguir plasmando sus conocimientos con gran destreza y creatividad en sus prendas de vestir.

loans.use: Investment capital for purchase of selection of wool to continue weaving dress fabrics for sale

loans.name: Daría

texts.es:
Daría is a loving and enterprising mother originally from the Nuñoa district. Since she moved to Juliaca she has worked various jobs in an effort to find better opportunities and make sure her children receive an education. At first life was difficult for Daría because she had arrived in Juliaca with little money. But her perseverance and strong will to overcome proved to be stronger than her financial limitations.

That’s how Daría decided to adapt a space in her house and open a small grocery store. At first she had little merchandise. But after a while and in response to her clients’ demands, she began to expand and increase the variety of products in her store. Currently her small store is the busiest in her neighborhood because Daría manages to fulfill all of her regular clients’ requests. Daría would like to purchase gas and a selection of drinks to complete her store. It’s with this project in mind that she hopes to receive your support.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Daría es una madre amorosa y emprendedora natural del distrito D. Nuñoa, desD. que radica en la ciudad D. Juliaca se dedicó a diferentes actividades con el fin D. buscar mejores oportunidades y ofrecerles educación a sus queridos hijos. En un principio, las cosas para Daría resultaban difíciles porque llegó a esta ciudad con poco capital, pero su constancia y voluntad D. superación pudieron más que sus posibilidades económicas.

Es así, que decidió adecuar un ambiente D. su vivienda e implementar una tienda D. abarrotes, inició ofreciendo poca mercadería, pero con el transcurso del tiempo y las exigencias D. sus clientes fue ampliando y aumentando la variedad D. sus productos, actualmente su tiendita es la más concurrida D. su localidad porque logra satisfacer cada una D. las solicitudes D. sus parroquianos. Doña Daría tiene pensado comprar combustible (gas) y variedad D. bebidas para terminar D. implementar su tienda, con ese proyecto en mente espera recibir vuestra colaboración.

loans.use: Establish her store by purchasing drinks and gas to increase type of merchandise she offers

loans.name: Silia

texts.en:
Silia F., 56, is married with seven children.

She has many years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the villagers and public six days per week.

She has three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD).

SPBD loans are Silia’s only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer, sacks of sugar, rice and salt, lamp chops and chicken thighs.

loans.name: Letasia

texts.en:
Letasia T., 35, is married with three children.

She has two years of experience in the barbecue business. She sells to the villagers and public three days per week.

She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD).

SPBD loans are Letasia’s only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to improve her business. Her husband will help her operate the business.

loans.use: Purchase of mutton flaps, chicken franks, sausage, soya, onions, salt, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama O. sells smoked fish.

She is married, but her and her husband's combined income is not sufficient for Ama and their four children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba Y. sells both fresh and smoked fish.

She is married, but her and her husband's combined incomes is not sufficient for Aba and their two children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: Capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama E. sells fish that she buys from canoes near the sea shore. She is married, and her husband has a single income, but even together it is insufficient for Ama and her two children.

Demand for Ama's goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Capital to expand her fish-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es:
Ileana started her business three years ago at the invitations and with the help of one of her neighbors who was doing very well selling cosmetics. Ileana's business took off when her husband lost his job, and Ileana organized cosmetics parties while her husband looked after their young children. With clients from these parties she began establishing her network, which continues to grow every month.

Ileana needs a loan for $600 to be paid back in 6 months, to purchase more merchandise and continue with the growth of her business. This will be possible with your help!

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva translator

Ileana inicio su negocio cuando la invito una vecina, que se estaba beneficiando mucho con la venta de productos cosméticos, así comenzó ayudada por su vecina, su negocio se activo debido a que su esposo quedo desempleado, entonces el cuidaba a los hijos mas pequeños para que ella pudiera hacer demostraciones por las tardes, y así empezó a formar su red de ventas, actualmente ya tiene su cartera de clientes mas los que crece mensualmente, hace tres años que inicio el negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores has 4 grown children. She started her business 12 years ago to cover her children's (middle- and high-) school expenses. Back then, while she was going through a financial crisis, a friend invited her to a cosmetics party, and she began selling them. Now she has a large network of customers and sellers.

Dolores is requesting a loan of $600 to be paid back in 6 months, to purchase merchandise to fill pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Dolores tiene 4 hijos ya todos grandes, inicio el negocio para poder solventar los gastos de escuela primaria y secundaria de sus hijos. Inicio su negocio hace 12 años, cuando pasaba por una crisis económica familiar, la invitaron a una demostración de productos cosméticos y de ahí empezó a vender, actualmente tiene una red extensa de vendedoras y una cartera grande de clientas.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder surtir pedidos que tiene pendientes.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia has four children. She started her business four years ago to cover the additional expenses of her growing children. At that time she began by selling cosmetics to family and neighbors, and now she has an established network of customers. She is contributing even more to her family's income.

Silvia requests a loan for $600 to be paid back in 6 months to purchase merchandise and fill pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Silvia tiene cuatro hijos, inicio su negocio hace 4 años, porque necesitaba aumentar los ingresos familiares cuando sus hijos empezaron a crecer, y aumentaron sus gastos. Inicio vendiendo cosméticos con su familia y vecinos y de ahí se animo a seguir vendiendo y ahora ya tiene su cartera de clientes, obteniendo mejores ingresos para su familia.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir algunos pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Irma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Irma started her business because she had to support herself and her family after her husband's death. Even now she is always looking for ways to earn money for her home expenses. Eighteen years ago she began selling snacks, candy and crafts that she made, and little by little she has added more items to sell. Now she lives by herself, and her expenses are minimal; she only worries about earning enough to eat and to pay the house bills.

Irma requests a $600 loan to be paid back in 6 months to purchase more materials to make crafts and to buy more toys and gifts to sell. She needs a variety of products to maintain a good cash flow.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Irma inició el negocio porque a raíz de que murió su esposo tuvo que buscar la manera de salir adelante y se tuvo que emplear a si misma vendiendo cosas además de que también hace manualidades y busca por todas las formas sacar dinero para los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace 18 años vendiendo frituras, dulces y haciendo manualidades; y poco a poco fue metiéndole más cosas para sacar más dinero y así de esa manera le iba dando vuelta al dinero. Ahora ya no tiene tantos problemas porque esta sola y sus gastos son mínimos, solo se preocupo por sacar dinero para comer y pagar los gastos de la casa.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más material para hacer manualidades y abastecerse de mas juguetes y regalos, porque si se queda sin nada después batalla para darle movimiento rápido al dinero.

loans.use: purchasing materials for crafts

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia began her business when her husband's hot-dog cart did not bring in enough income. She decided to help him with another cart so that they could earn a little more money. She began more than five years ago. Her husband has many years experience working his own cart, and this business has done well since people in their area go out at night and buy their food. Also, weekends are generally when they earn good money.

Lidia needs a loan of US $600, which she will repay in six months, so that she can purchase ingredients to make the hot dogs. She would like to keep her cart well-stocked. With your help, she can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia inició el negocio ya que su esposo tiene un carrito de hot-dogs y con el que el manejaba no le alcanzaba así que decidió ayudarle con otro carrito afuera de su casa para poder sacar un poco mas de dinero. Comenzó hace mas de 5 años cuando puso su propio carrito, su esposo lleva muchísimos años trabajando el suyo y les ha ido muy bien ya que la gente de la colonia va por las noches a comprarles y hay ocasiones por lo general el fin de semana es cuando sacan buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para hacer los hot-dogs y le gusta tener bien surtido su carrito. Son tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is married with three children: Juan Antonio, Cristian Alberto and Estefania, who are students. She began her business in order to assist her husband with the family expenses. A year ago, she began selling used clothing to her friends. Now she purchases and sells merchandise, which generates more earnings.

Maribel needs a loan of US $300, which she will repay in four months, so that she can provide more products for resale and earn more money. With your help, Maribel will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Maribel es casada y tiene 3 hijos: Juan Antonio, Cristian Alberto y Estefanía, quienes son estudiantes. Ella inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Comenzó hace 1 año, le pasaban ropa y ella la revendía entre sus conocidos, ahora ella compra independiente y vende la mercancía, lo que le genera mejores ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir mas mercancía para la reventa y tener mejores ganancias. Con tu ayuda Maribel saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mateo Martin

texts.es:
Martin is married with six children: Gabriel (37), Hilda Nelly (31), Alejandro (29), Julian (28), Araceli (26) and Ana Luisa who is 24 years old. He began his business when he found himself unable to work and he opted for selling used clothing that his children sent him from the U.S. He began three years ago and gradually he has grown his business, which supports his wife and him.

Martin is requesting a loan of US $300, which he will repay in 4 months and use to purchase merchandise for resale allowing him to reduce his reliance on his children sending clothes. With your help, he will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Martín es casado y tiene 6 hijos: Gabriel 37, Hilda Nelly 31, Alejandro 29, Julián 28, Araceli 26 y Ana Luisa de 24 años. Inició el negocio porque quedo incapacitado para trabajar y opto por vender ropa usada que sus hijos le enviaban desde E.U. Comenzó hace 3 años y poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio, ya que de esto viven el y su esposa.

El solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía para la reventa y no tener que esperar a que sus hijos le envíen la ropa. Con tu ayuda el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa began her business so that she could have income of our her own and help with family, health, and personal bills. Four years ago, she began selling shoes from a friend's catalog. Later, she bought her own and began selling to her friends and family. Gradually, she was able to develop a list of customers that has generated good income.

Teresa needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in three months, so that she can purchase some orders that she has yet to deliver.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa inicio el negocio para tener un ingreso propio para solventar gastos familiares, de salud y personales. Comenzó hace 4 años ofreciendo zapatos de un catalogo de una amiga, después compro el suyo y empezó a ofrecerlo entre amigos y familiares, poco a poco logro tener una cartera de clientes que le ha generado buenos ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes de entregar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is married and has two children, one who is two years old and a baby of seven months. In order to help her children get ahead, she began her business since she didn't have a job, her husband did not earn a good wage, and she had to purchase medication for her mother who has cancer of the throat and lung and does not have health insurance.

Maria Luisa needs a loan of US $300, which she will repay in four months, so that she may purchase more merchandise for resale, as well as a structure that will allow her to establish herself well in markets and protect her from the sun. With your help, she may grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Luisa es casada y tiene 2 hijos uno de 2 años y una bebe de 7 meses. Inicio su negocio ya que no tenia trabajo y con su liquidación puso el negocio, para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que su esposo no tenia un buen sueldo además tenia que comprar medicamento para su mama ya que tiene cáncer de garganta y pulmón y no cuenta con seguro médico. Comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo ropa entre sus vecinos y conocidos y poco a poco fue generando clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mas mercancía para la reventa y una estructura para poder instalar bien su puesto en los mercados y protegerse del sol. Con tu ayuda Luisa hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria de la Luz began her business so that she could assist her husband with bills since his wage was not consistent as he works as a bricklayer. One year ago, she began selling clothing on the recommendation of some friends who were doing well selling in markets and villages. She opted to do the same, earning a good income.

Maria needs a loan of US $300, which she will repay in four months, so that she can purchase more merchandise for resale, and, as a result, be of great use. With your help, she can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de la Luz, inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos ya que su sueldo no es seguro, debido a que trabaja como albañil. Comenzó con la venta de ropa hace 1 año, por recomendación de unas amigas que vendían y les iba bien vendiendo en mercados y en rancherías entonces ella opto por hacer lo mismo, obteniendo buenos ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar más mercancía para la reventa y así tener mejor utilidad. Con tu ayuda ella podrá hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa has 7 children: Veronica, 34, sells clothing; Claudia, 32, is a housewife; Carlos, 30, is a bill collector; Guadalupe, 29, is a laborer ; Rosa Isela, 26, is a housewife; Jessica, 24, is a waitress; and Miguel, who is an employee. Rosa started her business to help her husband support their family. Two yers ago she began selling candy, tostadas, pork rinds and sodas, and little by little she has made her business grow to a small grocery store.

Rosa requests a $300 loan to be paid back in 4 months to purchase more merchandise to stock up her store. With your help, Rosa will continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Rosa tiene 7 hijos: Verónica de años 34 venta de ropa, Claudia de 32 hogar, Carlos de 30 años cobrador, Guadalupe de 29 años obrero, Rosa Isela de 26 años hogar, Jessica de 24 años mesera y Miguel empleado. Inicio el negocio ya que no completaba con los gastos de la casa, y vio la manera de apoyar a su esposo de esta manera. Comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo dulces, tostadas, chicharrones y refrescos, poco a poco fue invirtiendo en el negocio hasta establecer su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y así tener bien surtida su tienda. Con tu ayuda Rosa saldrá adelante.

loans.use: purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa has a small cafe where she sells coffee, soft drinks and enchiladas. She started selling these products 8 years ago with the money that she had been saving and had at the time. As the years have gone on she has been able to improve her business and change the products that she offers. Maria Teresa is married and has 8 kids, and as she has prepared them for life well they are now all independent. She would like to invest in another source of income and would like to buy construction materials to build a room to rent. She has been an excellent client and has repaid all credits on time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Teresa tiene un cafetín en el que vende café, refrescos, enchiladas. Hace 8 años empezó con estas ventas, los fondos los adquirió gracias a unos ahorros que en su momento tenía. Con el pasar de los años ha podido mejorar su negocio y diversificar los productos que ofrece. Maria Teresa es casada, tiene 8 hijos, que ya pudo preparlos para la vida, ya ellos son independientes a ella. Quiere invertir en otra fuente de ingreso como lo es la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer una habitación para alquiler, ha sido una exelente clienta, ha pagado todos sus créditos en tiempo y forma.

loans.use: To build a room to rent/Construcción de un cuarto para alquiler

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
My home is very small, and I have initiated construction on a project to enlarge one of the bathrooms. As you can see, I have rods already in place as well as the plumbing. I am requesting a loan in order to complete the construction already in progress. I work in a maquiladora (factory), and my salary is the minimum wage. For this reason, I am requesting a loan in the amount of $600.00 to complete the construction of my bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuento con una casa pequeña, tengo un pequeño avance en la elaboración de agrandar un baño, como pueden ver, tengo varilla puesta y lo de la tubería, solicito el préstamo para poder llevar a cabo la construcción que se esta haciendo, trabajo en una maquiladora, el sueldo que recibo es el mínimo, es por eso que solicito la cantidad de $600.00 dll. Y asi terminar la construcción de mi baño.

loans.use: Finish construction of a bathroom.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis L. lives in the neighbourhood La Fuente in the city of Managua. He has worked as a business administrator for 9 years, and this job has allowed him to support his family and raise his kids, one of which now lives away from home.

Luis' wife is in sales, and helps him with the household costs. Luis wants to improve the living conditions of their home, and he would like a loan to buy construction materials to build a wall for their house as this will give them more security and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Don Luis L. habita en el barrio La Fuente, de la ciudad de Managua. Don Luis L. trabaja como administrador de empresas, desde hace 9 años, trabajo que le ha permitido sustentar a su familia y poder formar a uno de sus hijos que ya es independiente a él. La esposa de Luis trabaja como comerciante y lo apoya en los gastos del hogar. Don Luis desea mejorar su casa de habitación, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en su vivienda y así poder darles mejor condición de vida y también seguridad a su familia.

loans.use: To build a wall for family security/Construcción de muro para asegurar a su familia

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
I own a small grocery store where I sell all type of things people need for their home such as vegetables, fruits, bread, tortillas, water, milk, etc. The income I earn comes solely from what I sell in the store, and that income is sometimes very little. For that reason, I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 to stock the store with items that people might need in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuento con un negocio de abarrotes pequeño, donde vendo de todo tipo de cosas que la gente necesita para su hogar, como verduras, frutas, pan, tortillas, agua, leche, etc... Los ingresos que obtengo son solo de lo que vendo en la tienda, y a veces es poco lo que saco de ingresos, por ello solicito el préstamo de $1,200.00 dll. Para surtir la tienda con más cosas que la gente pudiese necesitar para su hogar.

loans.use: Stock his small grocery store.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
In the house where I live, we have started to construct an additional room.  Given that these houses are very small, and as you can tell, I only need to lay concrete and install doors and windows, I am requesting a loan of $700.  I will then be able to finish constructing this additional room.Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer
En la casa donde vivo ya habíamos empezado a construir un cuarto más; dado que estas casas son muy pequeñas y como podrán notar, solo le falta la colocación de losa, puertas y ventanas, solicito préstamo de $700.00 dll. Y así poder terminar de construir este cuarto más.

loans.use: To lay concrete and install doors and windows

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi H., 46 years old, currently lived with her daughter who is 25 years old. Before joining TYM, tH. family income was unstable as her husband passed away relatively young. In 1998, sH. joined TYM and used her first loan to collect and buy wasted materials and then resell them. With hard work and determination, after 10 years of joining TYM her family economy has been much more stable. SH. opened up a small store to sell miscellaneous goods. Now, sH. continues to buy and sell scrap while her daughter takes care of tH. store. Her family income is about 3 million VND. SH. would like to borrow 6 million VND this cycle to expand her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Hệ năm nay 46 tuối. Chị hiện có 1 con gái đã 25 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị gặp mnhiều khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớm, con còn nhỏ. Năm 1998 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn , qua 10 năm tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị hiện tại đã ổn định hơn. Chị đã tiết kiệm để nuôi con khôn lớn. Hiện nay gia đình chị đã có 1 cửa hàng tạp hoá nhỏ kinh doanh tại chợ. Hàng ngày chị đi thu mua phế liệu về bán còn con giá chị quản lý cửa hàng.Thu nhập của gia đình hiện tại khoảng 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Để đầu tư vốn cho cửa hàng tạp hoá chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ.

loans.use: Invest in grocery

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. P., 45 years old, has been a member of TYM since 1998. Before, even though her husband was highly skilled in carpeting, because they were low in capital, their income wasn’t very high. After joining TYM, she used her loans to buy woods and new equipment for her husband’s business. With his experience and skill, most of his products are well liked and sold out quickly. Aside from helping her husband, she also plant vegetable and raise duck for extra income. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10 million VND to invest in breeding pigs and ducks. Her family income is about 3 million VND monthly.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phương năm nay 45 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Trước đây chồng chị làm nghề mộc, tuy có tay nghề cao nhưng vì không có vốn nên chồng chị chỉ đi làm thuê cho thu nhập không cao. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu mua gỗ cho chồng chị làm nghề mộc. Nhờ có kinh nghiệm và khéo tay nên đồ gỗ nhà chị được nhân dân trong vùng rất ưa chuộng vì thế thu nhập của gia đình đã ngày càng được tăng lên, cuộc sống ngày càng được cải thiện. Ngoài thời gian phụ giúp chồng làm mộc để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình, tận dụng ruộng vườn rộng chị Phương đã mua thêm vịt về nuôi. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi P., 56 years old, joined TYM in 2007. With her first loan, she bought foodstuff to breed pigs and chicken. Her daily income from selling chicken eggs is about 40 thousands NVD. Her husband passed away so she had to work harder to raise her child. He has found a job with income of about 1.5 million VND monthly, and is helping her with breeding pigs and raising chicken. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 9 million VND to improve her pig-pen and to buy more chickens. Her family income is about 2 million VND monthly.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Phấn năm nay 56 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2007. Vòng vốn đầu chị sử dụng để chăn nuôi lợn, gà đẻ. Hàng ngày chị đều có nguồn thu ổn định 40.000 từ việc bán trứng gà Chồng chị không may mất sớm chị đã phải cố gắng nhiều hơn trong công việc để nuôi con khôn lớn. Đến nay con của chị đã trưởng thành có công việc ổn định thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng . Hàng tháng con của chị đều hỗ trợ thêm cho chị để chị có thêm vốn làm ăn và chi tiêu trong gia đình Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu đồng để sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn, gà về nuôi Thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi U., 54 years old, has joined TYM since 2005. Before joining TYM, her family worked as fishermen in the nearby river. After joining, she took some loans to buy better equipment. Her family monthly income is around 3 million VND. Currently, her fishing boat is broken so she would like to borrow 7 million VND to buy a new one.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. NgU., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Uyên năm nay 54 tuổi. Chị bắt đầu tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã có nghề đánh bắt cá ven sông. Do điều kiện gia đình chị sống ở vùng ven sông nên công việc cũng rất thuận lợi.Tham gia vào Quỹ chị vay vốn để đầu tư mua sắm dụng cụ đánh bắt cá. Hàng tháng công việc đánh bắt cá của gia đình cho thu nhập 2.500.000. Gia đình chị có 2 con đều đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay thuyền đánh bắt cá của gia đình chị đã hư hỏng vì thế chị mong muốn được vay 7 triệu để thêm vốn mua thuyền đánh cá mới phục vụ cho công việc làm ăn tăng thu nhập của gia đình Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy new board

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L., 26 years old, joined TYM in 2005 to borrow money for her breeding-fish project. Before joining TYM, her family worked as fishermen in the nearby river. With this loan she was able to buy more breeding-fish as well as foodstuff. Through her first two loans, her family business has achieved measurable success. Her family monthly income is now at around 3 million VND. In this new cycle, she would like to borrow 10 million VND to expand her business and buy more fish.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lương năm nay 26 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có 1 con còn nhỏ. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị đã có dự án đào ao thả cá. Năm 2005 để có thêm vốn đầu tư vào dự án nuôi cá chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương. Có thêm vốn vay từ Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua cá giống về nuôi và mua thêm thức ăn dự trữ cho cá. Qua 2 vòng vốn thu nhập của gia đình chị đã tăng lên đáng kể hiện tại thu nhập của gia đình đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho dự án nuôi cá .

loans.use: Raising fish

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 30 years old, joined TYM in 2001. Before joining, her main source of income was from growing rice. After making the first loan, she invested the money into raising ducks. Now, her family has around 200 ducks and has been earning 2,500 thousands VND monthly. With this loan, she would like to borrow 8 million VND to buy extra foodstuff for her ducks in the next season.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 30 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn do thu nhập chủ yếu dựa vào làm ruộng. Năm 2001 để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình gia đình chị đã quyết định tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào nuôi vịt. Đến nay qua 7 năm tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã dần ổn định. Hiện nay gia đình chị có một đàn vịt 200 con. Với dự án chăn nuôi vịt thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới gia đình chị muốn được vay 8.000.000đ để mua thức ăn dự trữ phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi vịt trong vụ mùa tới.

loans.use: Raising ducks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products for her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for HELP Africa - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Ma Gul

texts.en:
Ma Gul is married and she is responsible for her family. She works in animal husbandry and her husband helps her. She has some cows and sheep. She has good experience in her business. During the reign of the Taliban, the family was in Iran and when they came back she started her business in Kabul.

Now she has requested an individual loan to buy more animals for her business so that she can open a farm. She wants to become a success in animal husbandry and expand the business.

She is happy with this loan and her dream is to make a better business and make a good future for her family. She appreciates this loan process in Afghanistan and she would like to thank Kiva lenders around the world who help poor people.

loans.use: To buy more animals to open a farm

loans.name: Ram Kumari

texts.en:
Ram Kumari S. lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur, with her husband and three sons. Her husband is a taxi driver and owns his own taxi. Her older son passed his SLC (School Leaving Certificate) this year and now he is studying in grade 11. Her other two sons are in secondary school.

Mrs. S. is a cosmetic shopkeeper in the town of Bholdhoka. She also sells different varieties of sandals in her shop. She used her first Kiva loan to buy various types of cosmetic goods. She became the first lady from BPW Patan to clear her first loan from Kiva. Now she is requesting a loan of 20,000 NPR to further expand her business to earn more. Her aim is to upgrade the living standard of her family and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Shilpa

texts.en:
Mrs. Shilpa M. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho. She opened her shop a few years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods like rice, bitten rice, maize, and snacks in her shop. Due to the economical condition of her family she cannot invest funds, so she is unable to fulfill the demands of her customers So Mrs. M. is requesting a Rs 20,000 ($300) loan to buy different varieties of grocery items for her shop.
Mrs. M. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband's name is Mr. Sum Nath M. and he makes handicraft goods.  Both of her sons are studying in boarding school.
Mrs. M. would like to use her income to provide a better education for her children and help her husband in fulfilling household expenses.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Gan Devi

texts.en:
Gan Devi M. lives in Thecho Village. She has four members in her family, including herself . Her husband's name is Mr. Pancha Lal M. and he makes different types of handicraft goods. Mr. and Mrs. M. have two sons; both of them are now studying in primary school.
Mrs. M. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as rice, maize, noodles, snacks and cold drinks. Her husband also helps her and her son in the morning and in the evening. 
Now Mrs. M. is requesting a Rs 10,000 (US$150) loan to expand her business by purchasing different varieties of grocery items for her shop.
Mrs. M. wants to utilizes her income to provide a better education for her son. She also wants to upgrade the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Sarmila K. has one son, who is studying in primary school. Her husband Mr. Santosh K. works in his own grocery store. 
Sarmila K. already owns one cow and she has been selling milk in her area. In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition.
Sarmila K. lives in a growing neighborhood, and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing.
She carries her milk containers and sells door to door daily in the morning and in the evening.  Because of the rising demand for milk, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production.  Sarmila K. plans to purchase a jersey cow, which produces more milk than normal cows. So she is asking for a Rs25,000 (US$375) loan to buy a young, milk-giving cow.

loans.use: To buy another milk-giving cow

loans.name: Premku

texts.en:
Premku D. lives in Chappagaun Village. She lives with her husband and a daughter. Her husband's name is Mr. Shyam D. and he is a farmer. Most of the people in this region are dependent on agriculture and farming. 
Mrs. Premku D. is engaged in handicraft work. She makes different types of traditional sandals, which are made of thick cloth. Most of the people in Nepal use these types of sandals in kitchens. These types of sandals are also used in wedding ceremonies. She has three years of experience in this job. Mostly people use these sandals in the winter season. She supplies her products in Asan Market. Asan is one of the very busy bazaars of Kathmandu. Now Mrs. D. is requesting a Rs 15,000 (US$225) loan to buy raw material for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Ram Maiya

texts.en:
Ram Maiya S. is a tailor in the town of Bholdhoka, lalitpur. She has four members including herself in her family. Her husband's name is Chabi Lal S., and he is a laborer who does house construction work. She has one son and one daughter. Her son and daughter are studying in secondary school.

Mrs. Ram Maiya S. works in a tailoring shop. The condition of her family is not good because her husband's work is not permanent. So to upgrade the living standard of her family, she wants to utilize her morning and evening time to sell fresh green vegetables in a local market. So to start her new business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 NPR to buy various types of green vegetables and furniture for her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh vegetables for her new business

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sita T. lives with her husband and four children in the town of Kuleshwor. Her husband's name is Shyam T. and he works in a private office. Mrs. T. has three daughters, and they are studying in grade 6, 3 and 2 respectively. And her son is in primary school.  She has four children, and in Nepal the cost of education is very high. So they have to spend a huge amount for their children's education, and the economy of her family is not so good. So to overcome this problem, Mrs. T. opened her vegetable shop five years ago. She sells different types of vegetables in her shop. She buys vegetables from Kalimati Market. 
Now Mrs. T. is requesting a Rs 15,000 (US$225) loan to buy various types of vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, etc. for her shop. She also wants to purchase new furniture for her shop. Sometimes her husband also helps her in her shop

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Binu

texts.en:
Binu G. lives with her husband and three children in the town of Kuleshwor. She has two daughters and one son; all of them are studying in lower secondary school.
Mrs. G. and her husband Mr. Krishna G. opened their shop six years ago. They just sell mineral water in their shop. Especially they sell 20-liter jars of mineral water. They also serve mineral water to the customers’ homes according to the order. Nowadays in Kathmandu Valley the demand for mineral water is increasing rapidly due to the scarcity of water. So to meet the demands of customers they need to invest funds to fulfill the demands of customers. So Mrs. G. is requesting for Rs 15,000 (US$225) loan to increase the numbers of mineral water jars for her shop.
Mrs. G. utilizes her income in providing good education for her children. She also wants to uplift the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy mineral water jars

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sabina T. is a 35-year-old woman and a resident of Bijeswori. Bijeswori is located within the Kathmandu valley. Most of the people in this location are involved in business professions. She has five members of her family including herself. She has three daughters who are studying in grades 10, 9 and 7 respectively. And her son is studying in grade 2.
Mrs. T. has been in the handicraft profession for 2 years. She sells different types of bangles and key rings in her shop. The additional things like thread, stone, beads of chandan, key rings of mobile sets etc. are needed, and she requires many other things to display in her shop, so she is requesting her first loan of Rs 15,000 (US$225). She spends her income in fulfilling the household requirements of her family.

loans.use: To buy things for her shop

loans.name: Jina

texts.en:
Jina S. is a resident of Kulashwor and lives with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Anil S., works in a private office, and her son is in pre-primary school. 
Mrs. S. opened her small restaurant three years ago to help her husband to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells typical Nepali food in her shop such as dal-bhat. She also serves tea and coffee to the customers. Her husband also helps her in her work.  
Now she is requesting a Rs 15,000 (US$225) loan to buy food material for her business, because in that area the demand for Nepali food is increasing constantly.

loans.use: To buy food material for her work

loans.name: Samjana

texts.en:
Mrs. Samjana B., 28 years old, is a tailor in the town of Kulashwor in Kathmandu.  She opened her tailoring shop three years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies long dresses, Makhshi, and others. 
Before starting her own business, Mrs. B. took a 6-month training course in tailoring.
Mrs. B. seeks a Rs 15,000 (US$225) loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education.
Her husband's name is Sanu B., and he works in his own cosmetic shop. She has one son who is studying in class 1.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita M. is a married woman who lives in Thecho with her husband and one son. Both her husband and Ramita are engaged in making wax statues. They have five years of experience in this work . They learned this work from their suppliers. They sell their statues in Patan. The Patan area is a well-known place for idol-making work in Nepal. 
In order to sustain in their business they have to invest continuously in their business. So Mrs. M. is requesting her third loan of Rs 20,000 (US$30) to buy various types of raw material like wax and equipment for their work.
They have a 4-year-old son who is studying in boarding school. Mrs. M. and her husband are planning to save their income for their son’s education.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita S. lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in businesses like grocery shops, utensil shops, etc. Mrs. S. lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is a laborer in house construction work. She has two daughters and one son. Her older daughter and son took SLC (school-leaving certificates) recently, and her younger daughter is in grade 9.
Mrs. S. opened her grocery shop five years ago. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop like rice, maize, noodles, biscuits and others. Nowadays they are facing financial problems because competition is very high, so in order to stay in their business they need to add different varieties of goods for their shop. But due to lack of funds she cannot buy goods for her shop. So Mrs. S. is requesting for her second loan of Rs 15,000 US$225) to buy different varieties of grocery goods for their shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Pranita

texts.en:
Miss Pranita T. is a single woman who lives in Thikedewol. Thikedewal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses.
Miss T. has four members, including herself, in her family. Her father's name is Mr. Pratap T., and he is a retired principal. Her older sister is a teacher and younger sister works in a beauty parlor.
Miss T. opened her tailoring shop one year ago. She took six months of training for tailoring work. She prefers to makes Nepali dresses in her shop. Due to the rising competition in this business she needs funds to invest in her business. But due to the economic condition of her family she is unable to invest in her shop. So she is requesting a Rs 10,000 (US$150) loan to buy raw material for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Til Kumari

texts.en: Til Kumari G. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Thikedewal.She opened her grocery shop one year ago to improve the living standard of her family.  She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, biscuits, noodles, in her shop. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in that area, so she is requesting a Rs 10,000 (US$150) loan to buy grocery items to meet the demand.  Mrs. G. lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is Chock Bahadur G. and he is a driver. Her son is studying in primary school and her daughter is in grade 5.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nita L. lives in Nakhipot, Lalitpur. Nita L. lives with her husband, brother-in-law and sister-in-law. Both her brother-in-law and sister-in-law are studying in secondary school.
Mrs. L. and Mr. L. opened their gas shop 3 years ago. They sell gas and gas stoves in their shop. In Nepal the cost of one gas cylinder has increased by Rs 200. So to add some gas cylinders to their shop Mrs. L. is requesting a Rs 10,000 (US$150) loan to meet the increasing demand of their customers.
She wants to upgrade the living standard of her family with her increased income by using this loan.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
I have the need to expand my house, since it is very small and we would like to live more comfortably. I would like to construct an additional room and expand the bathroom in the back part of my house. We have a certain quantity of construction material that was purchased with part of my wages. Because I earn little, I am requesting a loan of $500 from you to construct the room and bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Tengo la necesidad de ampliar mi casa, ya que esta muy pequeña y para mayor comodidad deseo realizar un cuarto mas y agrandar un baño en la parte de atrás de mi casa, contamos con cierta cantidad de material para la construcción, que se compro con una parte de mi sueldo pues es poco lo que gano, es por ello que solicito de ustedes la cantidad de $500.00 dlls. Para poder elaborar dicho cuarto y baño.

loans.use: To construct a room and a bathroom

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
The house where I live doesn't have protection on the windows. This is why I would like to make them more secure so my family and I will be more protected. The area where we live is a little risky, since there have been robberies in some of the homes. I am requesting a loan of $500 so I can have more security for my home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En la casa donde vivo no cuento con protecciones en sus ventanas, es por ello que quiero ponerlas ya que de esta manera tendría más protegida tanto a mi familia como a mí, pues en la colonia que nos encontramos es un poco arriesgada, pues ha habido robos en las casas. El préstamo que solicito es de $500.00 dlls. Y así tener más seguridad en mi hogar.

loans.use: To make her windows more secure

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
I need to install a more secure gate in front of my house since the one I have is made of wood and mesh, and it's very easy to open. I would like to give my family more security, and I need to make this change since we have had various mishaps. We have lived in this house for some time, and I would like to make this change so it looks better and so my family will be safer. This is a priority for me so my family will be ok while I am out working. I am requesting a loan of $600 so I can install the gate. Thank you in advance.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Tengo la necesidad de colocar un portón mas firme en mi casa ya que con el que cuento es de maya y madera, es muy fácil de abrir y para dar mayor seguridad a mi familia requiero este cambio pues hemos tenido varios percances, tenemos ya tiempo viviendo en esta casa y me gustaría darle este cambio para dar mejor vista y mas seguridad a mi hogar como ya lo mencione, pues para mi es prioridad que mi familia se encuentre bien mientras yo este trabajando fuera. Solicito la cantidad de $600.00 dlls. Para poder colocar el portón, de ante mano gracias.

loans.use: To install a gate in front of his house.

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma Delia is married and has three children, ages 22, 18 and 16. Due to their financial need, being that her husband was unemployed and she had to help with the household expenses, she started selling chips and other fried snacks from her home. Since all her sisters-in-law do the same, they recommended this activity to her, and little by little, she has grown her business. She now has a bigger and better stocked snack bar.

She needs a loan of US $975, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise and add the sale of several items that her customers have requested. With your help, Alma will continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma Delia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 18 y 16 años. Ante la falta de dinero, ya que su esposo no tenia trabajo y tenia que ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, en su casa empezó a vender tostaditas y fritos ya que todas sus cuñadas se dedican a la venta de eso, y ella se lo recomendaron, poco a poco ha crecido su negocio ahora tiene un snack mas grande y surtido.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y agregar la venta de algunos productos que sus clientes le están solicitando. Con tu ayuda Alma seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and add the sale of several items that her customers have requested.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica started her business one year ago. First, she sold clothing she no longer used and later, since she did well, she started selling in the markets. Due to the financial need in her home, she had to work to help her husband.

She needs a loan in the amount of US $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase a structure and canvas to set up a stand. This way, she will be able to keep the business open for longer hours in the markets, and open earlier as well since she will not be directly under the sun.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Angélica inicio su negocio hace 1 año primero vendiendo ropa que ya no ocupaba y después como le fue bien empezó a vender en los mercados, ante la necesidad económica en su casa ella tenia que trabajar para ayudar a su esposo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una estructura y la lona para instalar un puesto y así va a poder quedarse mas tarde en los mercados e iniciar más temprano porque ya no estará directamente bajo el sol.

loans.use: Purchase a structure and canvas to set up a stand in the markets to sell her clothing.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #56452

loans.name: Patricia Maricela

texts.es:
Patricia is married and has two children, one six-year-old son and one 2-year-old daughter. She started her business due to financial need, since her husband does not make enough money working as a bricklayer. She started helping a friend selling cosmetics by commission, then decided to start selling on her own and has been doing so for 5 years, which generates a higher income.

She needs a loan of US $300, which she will repay in 6 months, to stock her business and sell more products since she wishes to continue expanding it. She hopes that in the future she can also open a haberdashery in her home. With your help, Paty will accomplish her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia es casada y tiene 2 hijos un niño de 6 años y una niña de 2 años, inició el negocio por la falta de dinero, porque su esposo no gana lo suficiente trabajando como albañil, así que ella empezó ayudándole a una amiga a vender productos de cosméticos por comisión, después decidió vender por su cuenta y ya tiene 5 años en el negocio, lo que le genera mejores ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir una factura extra y vender mas productos ya que desea seguir creciendo, ella quiere en un futuro tener en su casa una mercería, con tu ayuda Paty lograra su meta.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to continue with the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is married and has two children, ages 19 and 10. She started her business when her son entered high school, and they had no money to cover his expenses. It was then, 4 years ago, that she decided to open a small store in her home with the help of her sisters but was not selling much. Little by little, she started purchasing merchandise and her sales began increasing. Her store is now bigger, and she generates a higher income.

She needs a loan for US $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase more merchandise and maintain her store stocked. With your help, Rosa will continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Maria es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 10 años. Inició el negocio porque su hijo entro a la preparatoria y no tenían dinero para solventar los gastos por lo que haced 4 años decidió poner una pequeña tienda en su casa ya que inicio con ayuda de sus hermanas pero vendía muy poquito, poco a poco fue comprando mercancía y sus ventas se empezaron a incrementar, ahora su tienda es mas grande y le genera buenos ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más mercancía y tener surtida su tienda. Con tu ayuda rosa seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and maintain her store stocked.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #56454

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón started his business out of financial necessity because at that time, he was not employed and he was studying. This caused him not to be able to pay for his studies nor help with the family expenses. Then he decided to start his own business 5 years ago when he was able to buy ovens. With his previous experience, he opened a pizza business, which allowed him to finish his studies. Little by little, he has been able to make his business grow.

He is requesting a loan of $1,175 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, so that he can remodel his business space and give it a better look. With your help, Ramón will strengthen his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramón inició su negocio por necesidad económica ya que en ese momento no tenia trabajo y el estaba estudiando por lo que esto provoco que no pudiera pagar sus estudios y ayudar en los gastos familiares, fue entonces que decidió emprender su negocio hace 5 años cuando pudo comprar hornos y con la experiencia que tiene inicio su negocio de elaboración y venta de pizzas, lo que le permitió terminar sus estudios, y poco a poco a logrado hacer crecer su negocio.

El solicita un préstamo por US $1175 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su negocio y así tener una mejor imagen. Con tu ayuda Ramón consolidara su negocio.

loans.use: Remodel business space

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara started her business because her husband worked as a bricklayer at that time, and they did not have enough money to cover their 3 young daughters’ expenses. Furthermore, they were in debt, so they needed the extra income. Sara's husband was not able to bear their situation, so he left them, which is why she felt the need to help her daughters get ahead in life.

She started her business 7 years ago when she requested a loan in order to purchase jewelry and sell it. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she has managed to establish a client-base that has been increasing, and she now sells shoes as well.

She is requesting a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase glass cases to display her merchandise because her business is prospering and she wants it to succeed even more.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara inició el negocio dado que su esposo trabajaba como albañil y no les alcanzaba el dinero para los gastos de sus 3 pequeñas hijas además que tenían una deuda y necesitaban de ingresos extras ante esta situación su esposo no soporto la deuda y las dejo, motivo por el cual ella se vio en la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijas.

Comenzó hace 7 años pidió un crédito para poder comprar un portafolio de joyería y empezar a vender su producto, gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo, ella ha logrado crear una cartera de clientes la cual se ha ido incrementando y ahora tambien vende zapatos.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar vitrinas para exhibir su mercancía ya que le empieza a ir bien en su negocio y quiere que le vaya mucho mejor.

loans.use: Purchase glass display cases

loans.name: Martin Ricardo

texts.es:
Martín is divorced and has 2 daughters. He started his business out of financial necessity because he did not have a job at that time. His not having money to pay for his daughters’ studies nor cover the household expenses were the main reasons for his starting his own business. He started 4 years ago after completing a course. He then decided to take out a loan in order to purchase used tools, which is how he started providing carpentry services.

He is requesting a loan of $1,175.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase new machinery for his workshop. With your support, Martín will make his business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Martín es divorciado y tiene 2 hijas, inició el negocio por necesidad económica ya que no tenia trabajo, el no tener dinero para pagar los estudio de sus hijas y solventar los gastos familiares, fueron sus principales necesidades para emprender su negocio, comenzó hace 4 años después de terminar un curso decidió conseguir un crédito para poder comprar herramienta usada y así empezó a prestar sus servicios de carpintería.

El solicita un préstamo por US $1,175 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar maquinaria nueva para su taller. Con tu apoyo Martín hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase new machinery

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
San Juana is married and has 2 children, ages 5 and 1. She started the business because they needed the extra income to support their children and because it is a trade in which her husband has experience. She started selling fodder, veterinary medication, and farm animals 2 years ago, when they sold a plot of land they had and started investing in the business little by little until making it grow.

She is requesting a loan of $700.00, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to remodel her business space. With your help, she will be able to strengthen her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

San Juana es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 1 años. Inició el negocio porque es un negocio en el cual su esposo tiene experiencia y para obtener más ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos. Comenzó el negocio de venta de forrajes, medicamentos veterinarios y animales de granja, empezaron en forma hace aproximadamente 2 años, con la venta de un terreno que tenían empezaron con poca inversión pero poco a poco lograron hacer crecer su negocio.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $700 que pagara en 6 meses para la remodelación del local. Con tu ayuda ella podrá consolidar su negocio.

loans.use: Remodel business space

loans.name: Maria Yolanda Del Ca

texts.es:
Yolanda started the business when her father passed away and she was the only support for the family. At that time she was separated from her husband and had two small children. She began approximately 12 years ago, with the money that she obtained from her mother. They invested it in a business and began to sell clothes, subsequently making trips to Villa-Hidalgo, Moroleón, Mexico, and Aguascalientes where they could obtain clothes at better prices. They began to supply linens also, selling in installments with system of advance payment to assure the recovery of the sale. They also began to sell through a system of shows and have achieved growth in their business little by little.

She needs a loan of $975 US, that will be repaid in 6 months, to fix the room where she has her inventory, since the rains and excess humidity have damaged the wall and the ceiling. With the support of this credit she is going to be able to fix it.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda inició el negocio cuando falleció su padre y era el sostén de la familia, en ese tiempo ella estaba separada de su esposo y tenia a sus dos hijos pequeños.
