Comenzó hace aproximadamente 12 años, con el dinero que le entregaron a su madre, lo invirtieron en un negocio empezó a vender ropa, posteriormente a hacer viajes a Villa-Hidalgo, Moroleón, México, Aguascalientes donde podía conseguir ropa a mejore precios y empezó a surtir blancos también, vendiendo en pagos con sistema de anticipo para asegurar la recuperación de la venta, y también empezó vender por sistema de tandas y ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio poco a poco.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para arreglar el cuarto en donde tiene su inventario, ya que por las lluvias y el exceso de humedad se le daño la pared y el techo y con el apoyo de este crédito lo va a poder arreglar.

loans.use: To repair and remodel her stock room.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
Avelina started the business from economic need, to help her three children get ahead who were at that time 13,12 and 11 years. She started the business upon not having the income to pay for food and studies for her three children. When she was left a widow she saw the need to go to work, since she was also presented with health problems and one of her daughters is deaf-mute. Since they did not have medical coverage, the expenses increased and her husband did not leave her any pension or anything. She began 10 years ago going to work with her sister-in-law, investing some savings that she had in the making of piñatas. Little by little she began selling more and more, until she had significant sales that have permitted her family to advance.

She needs a loan of $500 US, that will be repaid in 6 months, to increase her inventory and thus to have better sales. With your aid Avelina will continue growing her business

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Avelina inició el negocio por necesidad económica, para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que en ese entonces tenían 13,12 y 11 años. Inició el negocio al no tener un ingreso para la alimentación y estudios a sus tres hijos, al quedar viuda se vio en la necesidad de ponerse a trabajar, ya que también se presentaban problemas de salud y una de sus hijas es sordo-muda y como no tienen servicio medico los gastos se incrementaban y su esposo no le dejo pensión alguna ni nada parecido. Comenzó hace 10 años viendo trabajar a su cuñada, invirtió unos ahorros que tenía; en la elaboración de piñatas y poco a poco fue vendiendo más y más, hasta tener ventas importantes, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para tener más inventario y así tener mejores ventas. Con tu ayuda Avelina seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio

loans.use: To buy materials to make piñatas

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #56460

loans.name: Belem

texts.es:
Belem is a 24-year-old single mother, who has no support from anyone, with two children, ages 2 and 3. She has a part-time job and sells quesadillas at night. For her, it is very important to give her children a better life, so she needs to be able to have enough time to give to them. For this reason, she decided to start her business in her patio a year ago. Thanks to the flavor that she puts in her dishes, she has a large clientele, who have been recommending her meals to other patrons, allowing her to increase her earnings.

She needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can buy a griddle, tables, and chairs. With your help, Belem will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Belem es madre soltera de 24 años quien no tiene apoyo de nadie, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 3 años. Ella tiene un trabajo de medio tiempo y por las noches vende quesadillas, para ella es muy importante el poder darle una mejor vida a sus hijos, así mismo requiere tener tiempo para atender a sus hijos por lo que decidió iniciar su negocio hace un año en el patio de su casa y gracias a su sazón tiene una amplia clientela, quienes la han ido recomendando y esto le ha permitido incrementar sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar comal, mesas y sillas. Con tu ayuda Belem saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase furnishings

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #56461

loans.name: Maria Ericka

texts.es:
Ericka is a single mother. She began her business when she needed to help her son get ahead. At the recommendation of a friend she began 2 years and 7 months ago to sell natural products and, little by little, she has managed to add clients and to increase her profits.

She needs a loan of $800 US, that will be repaid in 6 months, to invest and to buy display shelves for the exhibition of her products.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Ericka Es madre soltera empezó su negocio ya que necesitaba sacar adelante a su hijo, por lo que por recomendación de un amiga empezó hace 2 años y 7 meses a vender productos naturistas y poco a poco ha logrado hacerse de clientes e incrementar sus ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir y comprar anaqueles para la exhibición de sus productos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (natural products) and display shelves.

loans.name: Patricia Amalia

texts.es:
Patricia has been divorced from her husband for some time. She receives a pension, but, like many mothers in this country, she wants to give a better life to her 4 small ones. She believes that, if she is a strong and hard-working woman, her children will follow her example.

She started her business 2 years ago. First she helped another woman work, but, since a year ago, she has had her own business selling clothing and novelties.

She needs a loan of $500 US, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy a rack to hang the clothes on and in this way to display them better and sell more. In addition she will put lighting in the place in her house where she sells the clothes; different lights from the rest of the house to give it more of the aspect of a store. With your help Patty will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia se divorcio hace ya algún tiempo de sus esposo, el le pasa una pensión pero ella ha tenido como muchas madres de este país, desea darle una mejor vida a sus 4 pequeños, ella cree que si ella es una mujer esforzada y trabajadora sus hijos lo tomaran como ejemplo.

Comenzó su negocio hace 2 años, primero le ayudaba a una señora a trabajar y desde hace un año ya tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa y novedades.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar unos estantes para colgar la ropa de esta forma y poder exhibirla mejor así venderá mas, además Pondrá luz en el espacio de su casa donde vende sus ropa, la iluminara de forma diferente al resto de la casa para darle mas, aspecto de tienda. Con tu ayuda Paty saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To buy racks and lighting to better display the clothing that she sells.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #56463

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana is a woman who has had to confront difficult situations in her life. Two years ago she left the father of her children. Faced with the necessity to help her children move forward, she started her business one year ago. Her grandmother, who is the one who raised her, loaned her money to start her business of selling pastries. Thanks to this she has been able to help her children get ahead and to give them a better quality of life.

She needs a loan of $500 US, which will be repaid in 6 months, to remodel her business. In this rainy season, the water has inundated her business. With this she will give it a better appearance and her things will not be wet. With your support Susana will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Susana es una mujer que ha tenido que enfrentar situaciones difíciles en su vida, hace 2 años la dejo el papa de sus 2 hijos, ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos ella comenzó su negocio hace 1 años, su abuelita que es quien la crió, le presto dinero para que ella iniciara su negocio de venta de tortas, gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante a su hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su negocio ya que en esta temporada de lluvias se le mete el agua a su negocio. Con esto dará mejor imagen y sus cosas no se le mojaran. Con tu apoyo Susana saldrá adelante

loans.use: To repair and remodel her business

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #56464

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Fernanda started her business for reasons of economic necessity when she was left a widow and alone. Now her 4 children are married and have left to live in other parts of the city. She needs to move ahead as a person and is faced with the necessity of obtaining income for her personal needs.

She began about 10 years ago to rent rooms, since her house is very big. In this way she has income and companionship.

She needs a loan of $400 US, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy furniture for the rooms, since there are some that cannot now be used and she wants to better prepare them for renting. With your help doña Fernanda will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Fernanda inició el negocio por necesidades económicas ya que se quedo viuda y sola, ya que sus 4 hijos ya estaban casados y se fueron a vivir a otras partes de la cuidad. Ella necesitaba salir adelante como persona y ante la necesidad de obtener ingresos para sus necesidades personales.

Comenzó hace aproximadamente 10 años como es muy grande su casa decidió rentar los cuartos y así tendría ingresos y compañía.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar muebles para los cuartos ya que hay unos que ya no sirven y desea acondicionarlos mejor. Con tu ayuda doña Fernanda saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To buy furniture for rooms so they can be rented.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde started her business from the necessity to contribute to the expenses of the house and of her children. In this way her family could get ahead, now that her husband was not working and she had to cover her own needs and those of her children. For this reason she decided to start her business. She began a few years ago when she decided to do something to generate income and she dedicated herself to the sale of cosmetics.

She needs a loan of $200 US, which will be repaid in 6 months, to re-stock her merchandise and articles for the summer season and to take advantage of the vacation season to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde inició el negocio por la necesidad de contribuir con los gastos de la casa y los de sus hijos así como salir adelante con su familia ya que su esposo no estaba trabajando y ella tenia sus propias necesidades y las de sus hijos por eso decidió iniciar el negocio. Comenzó hace unos años cuando ella decidió hacer actividades para generar ingresos entonces se dedico a la venta de cosméticos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 6 meses para resurtir mercancía y artículos de temporada de verano y aprovechar las vacaciones para aumentar las ventas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (cosmetics) and summer items for resale.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos started his business from the necessity of having reliable income for the welfare of his family since he could no longer work because some time ago he lost an eye in an accident. He wanted to move forward as a person and to earn income to support his family.

He began selling products in high demand and, little by little he added more merchandise until today he has a well supplied little store selling everything.

He needs a loan of $400 US, which will be repaid in 6 months, to invest in more merchandise and new products, since he needs to have the store well supplied for the season.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con ingresos para el bienestar de su familia debido a que el ya no pudo trabajar por que hace tiempo se lastimo un ojo en un accidente. El deseaba salir adelante como persona y la obtener ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Comenzó vendiendo los productos más consumidos y poco a poco fue metiendo más mercancía que al día de hoy ya tiene una tiendita bastante surtida vendiendo de todo.

El necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para la inversión de más mercancía y productos nuevos ya que necesita tener bien surtida la tienda para la temporada.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his store, to meet the demands of the peak summer season.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Mrs. Soung S., 52, raises pigs. Her husband is sells oxen. They both live in Sthany Village, Pursat Province, Cambodia. S. earns about $10 per day and her husband earns about $5 per day.

To meet the increased costs of living, S. needs to expand her business, so she is asking for a loan to purchase more pigs to raise. The loan allows her to increase her family’s income and she hope to support her family sufficiently. (Mrs. S.’s husband appears in the photo.)

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uch S., 53, is a widowed wedding decorator. She also sells Cambodian noodles. She has been operating her business for eighteen years and earns about $3.50 per day. She has four children, all of whom are young. Two of her children work in Phnom Penh; one is studying at the university and one other is studying to be decorator.

To expand her business, S. is asking a loan to purchase more decorative materials to upgrade her existing materials.

loans.use: To purchase more decorative materials for her business

loans.name: At

texts.en:
Mr. At S. is a carpenter. He buys wood and makes tables, chairs, doors, and windows to sell. He has been in this business for ten years and makes about $5 per day. He lives with two children in Pealnhek Village, Pursat Province, Cambodia. All of his children are in school.

To expand his business and increase his family’s income, he now asks for a loan to purchase more wood.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to expand his business

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen baji and M. I. have been married for the last 18 years. (Baji is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) She has five children: one daughter and four sons. Her husband is a driver and has been in this profession for the last 15 years. Shaheen baji sells bags of spices that she buys wholesale and repackages. She chose this profession because there is a strong demand for spices in her neighborhood, and she collects good earnings from this business. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to expand her spice business.

Shaheen baji is joined in her loan group by four more members. Sakina baji is applying for a loan for her husband’s shuttering business. Hanifan baji wants a loan for her rented motorbike business. Shamshad baji requests a loan for her barber saloon business, and Parveen baji asks for a loan for her fruit business.

Loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans, meaning that if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the businesses

loans.name: Shabnam's Group

texts.en:
Shabnam baji is the wife of A. S. and lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. (Baji is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) They have been married for the last 25 years and she is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son works in a rice factory. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school near her neighborhood. Shabnam’s husband has a livestock business and Shabnam baji sews clothes on order from her neighborhood. Now she wants a loan for her husband’s livestock business. He wants to buy another animal and resell it for profit.

The loan group has three additional members. Hanifan baji wants a loan for her scrap work. Jannat baji requests a loan for her embroidery business, and Yasmeen baji wants a loan for her garment business.

Loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Married for the last 10 years to M. A., Kalsoom baji lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. (Baji is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her first son works in a motor workshop and her husband sells rice. Kalsoom baji earns a good profit from selling wooden sticks (to burn in stoves since gas is not available in her community). She has been in this profession for the last two years. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan for her wood business.

There are four other members in her loan group. Samian baji requests a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw and Shamim baji wants a loan for her welding business. Zubaida baji would like a loan for her shuttering business (rental of wooden beams used to support a roof on a temporary basis). Noor baji wants a loan for her grocery shop.

The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Members mutually guarantee one another's loans; if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz is the father of two children and he has a big family. He has a small retail shop that he has been involved in for more than 10 years. He imports all his goods from Pakistan. Now Aziz wants to complete his lease purchase and add to his stock, for which he needs money, so he wants to take out an individual loan. He wants to become stronger in his business and help his family and his wife and two small sons. He is sure that he can continue his business with more success and he hopes that he can enter his two sons in a better private school in Kabul. He is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his lease purchase

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji and her husband, M. L., live in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan; they have been married for the last 40 years. (Baji is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) She is the mother of five children: three daughters and two sons. Her first son and daughter are married. The next eldest son completed his 10th standard and the next eldest daughter completed her 7th standard. Razia baji has run her own vegetable shop for the last 10 years and earns a good profit; her husband runs his own tea stall. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she wants a loan to buy more materials to expand her vegetable business.

Razia baji's loan group includes four more members. Safia baji wants a loan to buy buffalo and Sardaran baji seeks a loan for her decorative embroidery business. Zubaidan baji would like a loan for her barber saloon. Najma baji wants a loan for her husband’s business; he is an electrician and wants to buy some electric tools.

The funds from this group loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans; if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Bakhan's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Arifwala, Pakistan, Bakhan baji has been married to A. M. for the last 25 years. She has no children. Her husband has been in the livestock business for the last 10 years. Bakhan baji successfully completed two loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she would like a loan for her husband’s business so that he is able to sell more milk and earn greater profits.

Her loan group includes two more members. Parveen baji wants a loan for her embroidery business, and Sakina baji wants a loan for her spice business.

The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans so that if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Top

texts.en:
Mr. Top Y., 57, sells oxen that he buys from villagers and resells for profit. He makes about $4 per day. His wife sells beef and makes about $3 per day. They have seven children, one of whom is married. They all live in Preksdey Village, Pursat Province, Cambodia.

Because of the increasing cost of living, his wife has to work hard every day to increase their income so Mr. Y. is applying for a loan to buy an ox to sell. He hope the loan allows him to expand his business and increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Sharifan's Group

texts.en:
Sharifan baji ("'Baji" is the Urdu term of respect for "elder sister") has been married to S. M. for 24 years and is the mother of eight children: four daughters and four sons. Two of the daughters are married. She has a two-room brick house. S. has been in the livestock business for the last 10 years, buying and reselling animals for profit. Sharifan baji successfully completed two loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan for her elder son, who sells food (snacks, chips etc).

Her loan group has a total of five members. Khalida baji wants to expand her meat business. Pervez baji wants a loan for her plastic utensils business. Waziran baji would like to buy a cart (to load luggage into buses). Razia baji requests a loan to expand her fridge repairing business.

In this group loan, the funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans; if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi N., 47 years old, has joined TYM for 9 years now. Most of her previous loans had been invested in breeding cattle but the profit was not as high as she expected. Therefore, recently she has borrowed more money to open a small store selling salt. Every morning, her husband would purchase salt from the seaside and she would resell it to other stores and customers in the area, earning roughly 3 million VND monthly. Apart from this business, her family is still raising cattle and work on the field (but less than before). Due to a stable source of income, she has been able to repay all the loans on time and still able to pay for her children education and living expenses. Currently, the price of salt is low so she would like to borrow money to buy more and put in reserve to sell later. This cycle she would like to borrow 6 million VND. Her family income monthly is about 3.5 million VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị N. năm nay 47 tuổi. Gia . Chị đã tham gia Quỹ tình thương được 9 năm. Trước đây gia đình chị vay ốn đầu tư chủ yếu vào dự án chăn nuôi song nhân thấy hiệu quả của dự án chăn nuôi không cao vì vậy những vòng vốn gần đây gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi lấy muối từ vùng biển về cho chị bán buôn và bán lê tại địa phương, công việc kinh doanh đang phát triển rất thuận lợi cho thu nhập ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài thu nhập từ công việc kinh doanh gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ công việc chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Nhờ có thu nhập ổn định kinh tế gia đình chị N. đã phát triển hơn các con của chị đều được ăn học đầy đủ. Hiện nay muối đang vào vụ nên giá thành rẻ hơn nên anh chị mong muốn được vay vốn để đầu tư mua muối trong vụ mùa về dự trữ để bán dần. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000 đ, thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Gulshan's Group

texts.en:
Gulshan baji, a housewife, has been married for 16 years to A., and she is the mother of seven children, four daughters and three sons. She has a two-room brick house. Her husband has been in the scrap work business for the last 10 years. Gulshan baji successfully completed her two loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. ('Baji' is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) Now she is applying for a loan for her husband’s scrap business.

Gulshan baji's loan group has three more members. Nasreen baji wants a loan for her garment business. Nasreen baji would like a loan for her grocery shop. Nazia baji requests a loan for her business making decoration pieces.

The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans; if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi Y. is 42 years old. She is now living with her husband and their two children in Y Y. district, Nam Dinh province, Vietnam. Before joining TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), Mrs. Y.'s job was to make tofu. In order to have more fund to make tofu, and to breed animals, Mrs. Y. applied to become a member in 2004. Upon participation, Mrs. Y. has always used her loan to buy materials to make tofu. Since there is always demand for this product in her village, Mrs. Y. has a very consistent income. She also uses the byproducts from making tofu, as well as other food in her garden, to raise pigs, order to increase her family income. Besides profit from tofu making, Mrs. Y. earns an extra 8,000,000 VND (equivalent to 500 USD) from animals breeding. For this coming loan cycle, Mrs. Y. would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND (around 600 USD) to buy more materials to make tofu, and to buy 2 more piglets.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong NguY., Kiva's Volunteer.

Chị Đào Thi Yến năm nay 42 tuổi. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại huyện Ý Yên tỉnh Nam Định. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị đã có nghề làm đậu phụ. Để có thêm vốn đầu tư vào việc sản xuất đậu phụ, chăn nuôi năm 2004 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ đến nay các vòng vốn chị đều đầu tư mua thực phẩm phục vụ cho sản xuất đậu phụ tại gia đình. Do nhu cầu tiêu dùng của người dân địa phương đối với loại thực phẩm này rất nhiều nên thu nhập của chị cũng rất ổn định. Nhờ việc tận dụng bã đậu và các thức ăn chăn nuôi sẵn có tại vườn nhà để chăn nuôi thêm lợn nên hàng năm ngoài thu nhập từ việc bán đậu phụ gia đình chị còn có thêm khoảng 8.000.000đ từ chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn đươc vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thực phẩm về làm đậu phụ, ngoài ra chị sẽ sử dụng một phần vốn vay để mua thêm 2 con lợn về nuôi.

loans.use: Business anh raising

loans.name: Khieu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. P. is 61 years old. When she joined the Fund in 1998, her family’s financial conditions encountered many difficulties. Her husband had died early, when all children were still young and there was not enough capital to make a living. After joining the Fund, she borrowed money to buy and resell scrap. Over her 10 years of participation to the Fund, she managed to raise all the children thanks to her assiduous work and thriftiness. The 3 eldest children are now grown up and her family’s economy has improved significantly. The children currently work in the family’s carpentry business. For the next round, she would like to borrow 10.000.000 đ for the children to purchase a new sawing machine, and use the remainder of the loan to buy scrap. The average income is 3.000.000đ per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

Chị P. năm nay 61 tuổi.Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớn, các con còn nhỏ, thiếu vốn làm ăn. Sau khi tham gia vào quỹ tình thương được vay vốn chị đã sử dụng vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu. Đến nay qua 10 năm sửd dụng vốn, nhờ chăm chỉ và tiết kiệm chị đã nuôi được các con khôn lớn, cả 3 người con của chị đến nay đều đã trưởng thành, kinh tế gia đình chị đã dần ổn định hơn. Các con của chị hiện đang làm nghề thợ mộc tại gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000 đ để đầu tư cho các con mua một chiếc máy cưa mới phục vụ cho nghề mộc, số tiền còn lại chị sẽ sử dụng để đi thu mua phế liệu. Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Purchase a new sawing machine

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Married for nine years, Sajida baji is the second wife of G. M.. (Baji is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) She owns a two-room brick house and has two children. G. M. also has five children from his first wife. But Sajida baji takes care of all seven children, and they are all getting educations. For example, her eldest daughter is in nursing school and the next elder daughter is in 10th standard. G. M. first sold garments on a bicycle. Sajida baji successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and from those loans her husband has been able to buy and run his own garment shop. Now his wife is applying for a loan to expand the same business.

She is joined in her loan group by four members. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. Sajida baji would like to expand her food business. Bashiran baji wants to buy and resell wood. Mumtaz baji's aim is to buy a cart for fruit selling.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Cúc is 47 years old. She joined the Fund in 2003, asking for a loan to invest into her fruit shop at the market. Every day, she buys fruit from large retailers and resells them to the locals. Over 5 years, the funds for her fruit shop allowed her to expand the business. As of today, her family’s income from the fruit business amount to around 2.500.000đ per month. In order to improve further the family’s income, her husband regularly works as a general labourer for a regular income of 1.500.000đ per month. Thus her family’s conditions are very stable and they were able to raise 2 kids. She also managed to build a spacious storey house and buy a set of valuable appliances. For the next loan, she would like to borrow 9.000.000 đ in order to invest further in the fruit business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

Chị Phạm Thị Cúc năm nay 47 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị xin vay vốn để đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng hoa quả ở chợ. Hàng ngày chị đi mua hoa quả từ các đại lý về bán cho bà con địa phương. Qua 5 năm sử dụng vốn cửa hàng hoa quả của chị đã ngày càng được đầu tư, mở rộng. Đến nay thu nhập của gia đình từ công việc kinh doanh hoa quả đạt khoảng 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình chồng chị thường đi làm thuê cho thu nhập ổn định 1.500.000đ/ tháng, do vậy kinh tế gia đình chị hiện tại rất ổn định, anh chị đã nuôi được 2 con khôn lớn. Ngoài ra gia đình chị đã xây được căn nhà khang trang và mua sắm thêm một số đồ dùng có giá trị.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ để đầu tư thêm vốn kinh doanh hoa quả.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
Mr. Cheam B. is a farmer in Thmey Tumlop Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. In addition, he sells pigs door-to-door. His wife, Mrs. Pho Suy, helps with farming and sews palm leaves to use as thatch roofing material. Mr. Cheam B. is 35 and the father of four children, three of whom attend school; the youngest is still too young.

Even though Mr. Cheam B. and his wife have several business activities, they still cannot support their family. Thus, Mr. Cheam B. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mr. Cheam B. and his wife are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar baji is the wife of M. A. and they have been married for the last 16 years. (Baji is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) They have lived in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan for the last 10 years. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her eldest son works in a clinic. Her husband has a business in which people bring wood to him for chopping. Now she is applying for a loan to buy another wood-chopping machine to expand his business.

Kishwar baji is joined in her loan group by several others. Shagufta baji wants to buy material (seeds, equipments etc) to harvest on her land. Kosar baji would like to expand her utensil sales business. Rukhsana baji will buy more material (switch boards, switches and lights, etc.) for her electric shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans, meaning that if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Liễu is 32 years old and she joined the Fund in 2002. Initially, she borrowed money to rear livestock, but came to understand that the long-term prospects were not high. Hence, her husband and she feel now confident enough to ask for a loan to buy a vehicle to set up a goods transport service. This a very common means of transportation in the country side, which should allow her family’s income to improve significantly. Throughout the six years of participation to the Fund, the income of the family has been very stable. As the transport of goods is a more profitable occupation, her family is considering the purchase of a vehicle to serve customers. Considering the available seed capital from the rest of the family, she hopes to be able to borrow the remaining 15.000.000đ required to invest into a new lorry. Their average income is 4.000.000đ per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

Chị Phạm Thị Liễu năm nay 32 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002.Trước đây chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng nhận thấy hiêu quả từ dự án không cao nên anh chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn mua xe công nông để chở hàng thuê. Đây là phương tiện vận chuyển rất phổ biến ở vùng nông thôn vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng được cải thiện rất nhiều. Đến nay qua 6 năm tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương kinh tế của gia đình anh chị đã rất ổn định. Để công việc vận chuyển hàng hoá được thuận lợi hơn gia đình chị đang dự định mua một chiếc xe chở hàng mới để phục vụ khách hàng. Cùng với nguồn vốn hiện có của gia đình, chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua xe chở hàng mới. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy new lorry

loans.name: Rak

texts.en:
Mr. Rak S. is a farmer and he sells firewood and coal in Au Krosa Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. His wife, Mrs. Sara Vom, helps him with the farming. They have a child who is too young to work or attend school.

Mr. Rak S. does not have equipment to plow his rice field. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy an "electric cow" to plow his own field as well as plowing other people’s fields in exchange for money. In addition, this motorized item can be used to transport wood and coal, enabling Mr. Rak S. to improve his other business.

Previously, Mr. Rak S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. Mr. Rak S. and his wife are both presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an "electric cow" to plow his own field other people’s fields

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dương Thị Cúc is 50 years old. Before joining the Fund, the family’s income came from agricultural activities which were not without difficulties. In 2003, she borrowed funds to develop the family’s economy. She used her first loan to buy scrap and recyclable materials from small vendors and resell it to retailers. This business easily generated an income of 1.500.000đ per month. In order to increase the family’s income, her husband works as a daily worker for a revenue of 2.000.000đ per month, thanks to which the financial condition of her family continues to improve. The family has one grown-up child. For the next loan, she wants to borrow 15.000.000đ in order to invest into the purchase of additional scrap.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

Chị Dương Thị Cúc năm nay 50 tuổi,. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào nông nghiệp do đó gặp không ít khó khăn. Năm 2003 chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Từ vòng vốn đầu chị đã sử dụng để thu mua phế liệu của những người bán lẻ về bán cho các đại lý. Công việc rất ổn định cho thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình chồng chị hàng ngày cũng đi làm thuê, thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng nhờ đó kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng phát triển. Gia đình chị hiện có một con đã trưởng thành. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư thu mua phế liệu.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon Y. is a villager in Snam Pok Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is 54 years old and has an adult child who runs a grocery store in the local village. Mrs. Phon Y. is a farmer and, with her husband, Mr. Heng Khul, she cultivates twice a year. During the rainy season, Mrs. Phon Y. cultivates rice. She grows vegetables in the dry season.

Mrs. Phon Y. now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy an extra cow to use with her existing cow as a draft animal. Therefore, Mrs. Phon Y. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow. Mrs. Phon Y. has previously obtained a loan to buy palm juice collector equipment for her husband. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to use as a draft animal

loans.name: Ha

texts.vi:
Mrs B. Thi Ha is 51 years old. Her husband is a retired military personnel. After retirement, she and her husband saved up a small amount of money and opened a shop selling spare engine parts and repairing engines. At the beginning of 2008, TYM fund opened in her area. She had discussed with her husband that they really should take out a loan to invest in the shop. Her husband is a talented mechanic so they have a lot of customers. In addition to repairing, they also buy old engines to repair and resell which is also a good source of income. She has 2 children who are grown and have stable jobs. Because of the military retirement pension, her family income is very stable. She is asking to borrow 300 USD to invest in spare parts. Their average income is 180 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Hà 51 tuổi, chồng chị là cán bộ về hưu sau khi nghỉ hưu vợ chồng chị tích lũy được một số vốn mở ốt bán phụ tùng máy và sửa chữa máy, đầu năm 2008 Quỹ triển khai trên địa bàn chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng mạnh giạn tham gia Quỹ vay vốn, để có vốn đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng. Chồng chị là người có tay nghề cao nên khách đến sửa chữa rất đông, ngoài sửa chữa ra khách hàng có nhu cầu bán máy cũ gia đình chị cũng mua và tu sửa lại rồi bán đấy cũng là nguồn lợi nhuận cao, chị sinh được 2 con hiện tại các con chị đã lớn và có công ăn việc làm ổn định, thuộc gia đình cán bộ về hưu nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 5.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng phụ tùng máy. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Van

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Van is 56 years old. She has 2 children who are grown and already employed. She and her husband are both retired military personnel with retirement pension of 120USD/month. After retiring, in order to supplement their income, she sells fertilizer for a private company in Nam Dan. With the business being stable, her income is 60 USD/month. At the beginning of 2008 when TYM fund started business in her town, she discussed with her family to join the fund to borrow money to improve their economic condition. She hopes to be able to borrow 300USD, combined with her family's savings, to open a shop selling fertilizer. They would bring in average income of 180.00 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese bu Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Võ Thị Vân 56 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có hai con đều đã trưởng thành và đã đi làm. Hai vợ chồng chị đều là cán bộ hưu trí thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Sau khi về hưu, để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình chị đã xin bán lân đạm cho công ty cổ phần vật tư huyện Nam Đàn. Công việc ổn định cho thu nhập 1.000.000đ/ tháng. Đầu năm 2008 khi Quỹ tình thương về hoạt động tại địa bàn huyện Nam đàn tỉnh Nghệ An chị đã bàn với gia đình tham gia Quỹ để vay vốn đầu tư phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ kết hợp với nguồn vốn của gia đình để mở cửa hàng kinh doanh phân đạm Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nho

texts.vi:
Ms. L. Thi Nho is 52 years old. She has 4 children, 2 are grown and married. She lives with her husband and 2 children in Nam Dan district in Nghe An. Her husband is retired from the military, so the family's income is dependent on his pension and pig farming. In 2008 she joined TYM fund to borrow money to invest in the pig farming business. She hopes to borrow 300USD to buy feed and additional pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Nhỏ năm nay 52 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 4 người con trong đó có 2 con đã trưởng thành và lập gia đình riêng. Hiện chị đang sống cùng với chồng và 2 con tại huyện Nam Đàn- Nghệ An. Chồng chị cũng là cán bộ hưu trí vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị hiện nay chủ yếu dựa vào lương hưu và chăn nuôi. Năm 2008 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ để mua thêm thức ăn chăn nuôi và mua thêm lợn về nuôi.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mr. Phon P. is a farmer in Thlea Chas Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. His wife, Mrs. Sokhom Son, is a subsistence farmer and cake seller. Mr. Phon P. has six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

Mr. Phon P. now makes a small profit from his farm every year. Thus, Mr. Phon P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to expand his rice plantation. Previously, Mr. Phon P. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to expand his rice plantation.

loans.name: Dung

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Thi Dung is 42 years old. She has 4 children, and 3 are of school age. Her family sells bamboo for a living. She and her husband usually buy the bamboo wholesale and resell them to the local community. Because they live near the river, the family business has done very well. In 2008 she joined TYM fund to borrow money for additional investment in the business to increase their income. She is asking for a loan of 300USD. Her average income is approximately 180USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Dung năm nay 42 tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 người con trong đó có 3 người con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Gia đình chị làm nghề buôn bán nứa. Anh chị thường đi mua nứa từ các đại lý về bán lẻ cho người dân địa phương Do sống ở gần sông nên công việc của gia đình gặp rất nhiều thuận lợi. Năm 2008 chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay thêm vốn đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh tăng thu nhập của gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 5.000.000đ. Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Lam

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Tung Lam is 53 years old. She has 2 grown children who are employed, and 1 is married with family. Not as lucky as many other women, she is divorced and had to work very hard to raise her children. Presently, in addition to farming work, she does retail sale of gasoline to the general public after buying them from large gas companies. This business brings her an income of about 120USD a month. She joined TYM fund at the beginning of 2008, and wishes to borrow 300USD for additional investment to continue her gasoline sale business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Tùng Lâm năm nay 53 tuổi. Chị có 2 người con đã trưởng thành, có công việc làm ổn định trong đó 1 người đã xây dựng gia đình. Không gặp may mắn như những người phụ nữ khác hai vợ chồng chị đã ly hôn vì thế chị đã phải làm việc rất vất vả để nuôi các con khôn lớn. Hiện nay ngoài làm nông nghiệp, hàng ngày chị đi lấy xăng từ các cửa hàng xăng lớn về bán lẻ cho người dân. Công việc kinh doanh này cho thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ đầu năm 2008 chị mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh xăng.USD

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Thi Nga

texts.vi:
Mrs.N. Thi Nga, 33 years old, lives with her husband and her 2 small children in Hung N. town, Nghe An province. She joined the TYM Fund in 2005. Her first loan was used in doing small retail business. After that, she was more confident to borrow more loans and invest in a blacksmith shop producing working tools at home. As she and her husband are skillful in making working tools, their products are the favorite among the local people. Beside producing and selling directly to the local people, Mrs. Nga also sells her products to retail shops. Her business is expanding over time. This time round, she would like to borrow 15,000,000VND (900USD) to purchase raw materials to make more tools and expand the production. Her family's average monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 258USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Nga 33 tuổi, hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Hưng Nguyên Nghệ An. Năm 2005 chị bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương. Vòng vốn đầu chị sử dụng vào công việc buôn bán nhỏ, sau đó chị đã mạnh dạn vay thêm vốn để đầu tư vào mở lò rèn sản xuất công cụ lao động tại gia đình. Với tay nghề khéo léo các sản phẩm do gia đình chị làm ra được người đân địa phương rất ưu chuộng. Ngoài việc sản xuất và bán cho người dân gia đình chị còn bán buôn cho các đại lý. Công việc sản xuất của gia đình chị ngày càng được mở rộng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để mua nguyên liệu sản xuất công cụ lao động, mở rộng sản xuất. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in production

loans.name: Thi Vinh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Vinh, 45 years old, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2000. She lives with her husband and her 2 grown up children. Her family's income comes mainly from farming and breeding pigs. Her first loan of 2,000,000VND was used to invest in breeding pigs. After that, she was more confident to borrow and expand this model of rearing pigs. Currently, she is also raising chickens and ducks. Besides raising livestocks, her husband also carries out transportation service so their family's income is stable. Her 2 grown-up children also have stable jobs. This time round, she would like to borrow 10,000,000VND (600USD) to purchase more animal feeds to raise livestocks. She will also purchase more pigs. Her family's monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 258USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Vinh năm nay 45 tuổi. Chị là thành viên Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Hiện tại chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành. Thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị vay vốn vòng đầu là 2.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vào chăn nuôi lợn.Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi. Hiện nay N.ài chăn nuôi lợn gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi thêm gà, vịt. N.ài thời gian giúp vợ chăn nuôi tại gia đình, chồng chị còn làm thêm nghề chở hàng thuê vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị luôn ổn định. Hai con của chị đã trưởng thành và đã có việc làm ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua thức ăn dự trữ phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi của gia đình. Chị cũng sẽ sử dụng vốn để mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Breeding pigs

loans.name: Thi Thuan

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Thuan, 45 years old, has 2 school-going children. In 1998, she joined TYM Fund to improve her family's economy. She borrowed 500,000VND in the first loan to invest in raising cattle. After 10 years, her family's economy has improved significantly and she is able to send her children to school. Currently, she is raising cattle extensively, thus in the next loan she would like to borrow 6,000,000VND (375USD) to purchase more cows. Her average monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 188USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuận năm nay 45 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 2 con đang đi học. Năm 1998 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay 500.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, đến nay qua 10 năm sử dụng vốn kinh tế gia đình chị đã có sự phát triển rõ rệt. Các con của chị đều được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi theo mô hình trang trại. . Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ để đầu tư vào mua bò về nuôi. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising cows

loans.name: Thi Minh

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Minh, 55 years old, has 3 children, 2 are grown up while 1 is still schooling. Before joining the Fund, her family faced many obstacle due to the lack of capital. In 1998, Mrs. Minh joined the Fund to borrow money and invest in breeding pigs. After 10 years, now her family's income has been more stable and her 2 grown up children have already had stable jobs. This time round, she would like to borrow 6,000,000VND (375USD) to purchase buffalos, assisting farming. Her family's average monthly income is 2,000,000VND (129USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Minh năm nay 55 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 2 con đã trưởng thành 1 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi thma gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị gặp nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn. Năm 1998 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã ổn định. Hai con lớn của gia đình đã trưởng thành và đã có việc làm. Vòng vốn tới gia đình chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ để mua trâu phục vụ cho sản xuất nông nghiệp. Thu nhập bình quân: 2.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising buffalo

loans.name: Thi Phuong

texts.vi:
Mrs. Luu Thi Phuong, 48 years old, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2000. After 7 years of borrowing to invest in breeding chickens and pigs, her family's economy has improved. She has 4 children, 2 are working overseas as factory workers, while the other 2 also have stable jobs. Beside the profits from breeding chickens and pigs, there is also her husband's monthly income of about 1,5000,000VND as he works as a construction worker. This time round, she would like to borrow 6,000,000VND (375USD) to purchase cattle to raise. Her average monthly income is 2,500,000VND (about 101USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lưu Thị Phượng năm nay 48 tuổi. Chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000.Qua 7 năm sử dụng vốn chủ yếu vào dự án chăn nuôi lợn, gà có hiệu quả, hiện nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã ổn định hơn. Gia đình chị có 4 người con trong đó có 2 con đã đi lao động xuất khẩu, hai con hiện đang sống cùng anh chị cũng đã có công việc làm ổn định. Ngoài thu nhập từ dự án chăn nuôi, hiện nay gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu khoảng 1.500.000đ /tháng từ công việc thợ xây của chồng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000 đ để mua trâu về nuôi phục vụ sản xuất.Thu nhập bình quân 2.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising cows

loans.name: Thi Phi

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Phi is 50 years old. Before joining the TYM Fund, her family faced a lot of obstacles as her husband passed away early and she had to raise her two school-going children single-handedly. In 2000, she joined the TYM Fund to borrow money to invest in breeding pigs. All the loans were used in raising cattle. As she was hardworking and always tried to save, she overcame all the difficulties to raise her children as well as to stabilise the family's economy. Now, one of her two children has already got married while the other one has got a stable job. This time round, she wound like to borrow 6,000,000VND (375USD) to invest in raising cows. Her average monthly income is 2,000,000VND (129USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Phi năm nay 50 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp không ít khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớm, chị lại phải nuôi hai con nhỏ đang tuổi ăn học. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi. Qua các vòng vốn vay chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi tại gia đình. Nhờ làm ăn chăm chỉ và luôn có ý thức tiết kiệm đến nay chị đã vượt qua được khó khăn và nuôi được các con trưởng thành, kinh tế của gia đình đã dần ổn định. Hiện nay 1 người con của chị đã lập gia đình, 1 người đã có công việc ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ để đầu tư mua bò về nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân: 2.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising cows

loans.name: Thi Hoa

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Hoa, 37 years old, has 2 small children. She joined the TYM Fund in 1997. She requested for the first loan to invest in breeding pigs, but afterwards, she realised that the demand for clothes in her hometown increased over time. Therefore, she borrowed more to learn tailoring and invest in her tailoring business. As she is skillful and charges reasonable prices, her store attracts many customers. Her husband is an experienced construction worker. Her family's monthly income is 2,500,000VND. The next round, she wants to request for 7,000,000VND (425USD) to purchase more fabrics to make more clothes and increase her family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoa năm nay 37 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 2 con còn nhỏ. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn mua lợn về chăn nuôi sau đó chị nhận thấy nhu cầu về may mặc của người dân địa phương ngày càng tăng cao vì thế chị đã vay vốn để đi học may và đầu tư vào nghề may mặc. Nhờ khéo tay và giá cả hợp lý hiện nay cửa hàng của chị rất đông khách. Chồng chị cũng là thợ xây lành nghề vì thế thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình chị đạt 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 7.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm vải về may quần áo phục vụ khách hàng nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.

loans.use: Invest in tailoring

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., aged 40, is the owner of a wedding-dress and makeup service shop in Hung Yen Town, Nghe An Province. She has two children, both of whom are still in school. Mrs. T. joined TYM Fund in 1997 and has been investing all the loans since the first round in her shop. For ten years, due to Mrs. T.’s effective investment, her shop has become very well-known in the area. Besides the wedding service, Mrs T. and her husband also provide photocopy and photo services. As a result, their average income has increased and become much more stable than ever. In the next round of loan, Mrs. T. hopes for a loan of 10.000.000 VND ($600) to purchase more wedding dresses and cosmetic products for her shop to meet customers’ demand. Her family’s monthly income is 4.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Tuyến năm nay 40 tuổi, chị hiện là chủ của hàng cho thuê váy cưới và dịch vụ trang điểm cô dâu tại huyện Hưng Nguyên Tỉnh Nghệ an. Gia đình chị hiện có 2 con đang tuổi đi học.Chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Từ vòng vốn đầu tiên đến nay gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào cửa hàng. Qua 10 năm sử dụng vốn vay có hiệu quả gia đình chị hiện có 1 cửa hàng phục vụ các dịch vụ cưới hỏi rất quy mô tại địa phương. Ngoài thời gian làm dịch vụ cưới hỏi anh chị còn làm thêm nghề phôtcoppy và chụp ảnh vì thế thu nhập của gia đình luôn ổn định và ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 10.000.000đ để mua thêm váy cưới mới và các dụng cụ phục vụ cho công việc đáp ứng tốt hơn nhu cầu của khách hàng trong mùa cưới năm nay.

Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in beauty salon

loans.name: Thai Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thai Thi V., aged 35, has been a member of TYM Fund since 2000. She has two children, who are still in school. Mrs. V. is a tailor while her husband is a construction worker. For the past seven years, Mrs. V. has been using the loans from TYM to invest into her tailoring business, which has proved to be the right choice. As the demand for clothing of people in her area has been very high recently, Mrs. V. has to spend more on fabrics and materials. Thus, in the next round of loan, Mrs. V. hopes for a loan of 15.000.000 VND ($900) to purchase more materials for her business. Her family’s monthly income is 4.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vân 35 tuổi, là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Hiện nay chị làm thợ may còn chồng chị làm nghề xây dựng. Qua 7 năm tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã vay các vòng vốn và đầu tư vào nghề may mặc rất hiệu quả. Hiện nay nhu cầu của nhân dân địa phương về may mặc ngày càng cao vì thế nhu cầu về vốn để đầu tư mua vải cũng tăng lên. Vì thế vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để mua thêm vải đầu tư vào của hàng may mặc.

Thu nhập của gia đình 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in tailoring

loans.name: Thai Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thai Thi H., 39, has been a member of TYM Fund since 2001. She has two children, both of whom are still in school. Before joining TYM Fund, Mrs. H. has had her own shop selling sand in her neighborhood. In 2001, she decided to join TYM, so she could ask for loans to invest more into her business. With the help of TYM and family’s capitals, Mrs. H. has been able to expand her business and make more profits. As a result, her family’s income is one of the most secure in the area. In the next round of loan, Mrs. H. wishes for a loan of 15.000.000 VND ($ 900) to continue investing into her business. Her family’s income is 5.000.000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thái Thị Huyền 39 tuổi là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Gia đình chị có hai con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị đã có cửa hành kinh doanh cát tại địa phương.Năm 2001 chị tham gia Quỹ để vay thêm vốn đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng thu mua cát. Đến nay qua nhiều năm buôn bán cùng với nguồn vốn vay của Quỹ và nguồn vốn tự có của gia đình mô hình kinh doanh của gia đình chị đã được mở rộng hơn và hiệu quả kinh doanh cũng cao hơn. Gia đình chị hiện là một trong số gia đình có kinh tế ổn định nhất trong thôn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn kinh doanh

Thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., aged 24, is married and has a young child. She and her family are currently living in Hung Nguyen Town, Nghe An Province. In 2007, Mrs. T. joined TYM Fund, who gave her loan to purchase vehicles so her husband could transport goods for customers. Mrs. T. also opens an internet café at home to increase family’s income. And since she has the advantage of living in a populated area, her business has been relatively lucrative so far. In the next round of loan, Mrs. T. hopes for a loan of 9.000.000 VND ($550) to purchase more facilities (computers) for her internet café. Her family’s monthly income is 4.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 24 tuổi. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con đang còn nhỏ tại huyện Hưng Nguyên tỉnh Nghệ An. Năm 2007 chị thma gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn đầu tư mua phương tiện vận chuyển để chồng chị đi chở hàng thuê. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi chở hàng thuê còn chị kinh doanh Internet tại nhà. Nhà chị ở khu đông dân cư, gần đường giao thông nên công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều thuận lợi. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm máy vi tính phục vụ cho việc kinh doanh Internet.

Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., aged 50, has three grown-up children. Her husband is retired with 1.200.000 VND pension per month. Mrs. T. joined TYM Fund in 1999 in order to ask for a loan to invest into breeding poultries. For the past 8 years, her family’s income has become much more stable, and thus Mrs. T. was able to raise her kids better. All of them finished school and are working. In the next round of loan, Mrs. T. hopes for a loan of 10.000.000 VND ($600) so she can expand her business by buying more chickens and food for the poultries. Her family’s income is 3.000.000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 50 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 3 con đã trưởng thành.Chồng chị là cán bộ hưu trí có thu nhập ổn định.1.200.000đ / tháng. Năm 1999 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Đến nay, qua 8 năm tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng ổn định và phát triển. Chị đã nuôi được 3 con trưởng thành. Các con của chị đều được đi học và đều đã có việc làm.Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 10.000.000 đ để mua thêm gà và thức ăn chăn nuôi, mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi tăng thu nhập cho gia đình

Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Nhung

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Nhung is 52 years old. She and her husband are retired military personnel. Her entire family lives in Hung N. district in the province of Nghe An. In 1998, while she was still working, she joined TYM Fund to borrow money to raise pigs in order to supplement her family's income. After retirement, she boldly borrowed larger loans and invested in a restaurant to serve the employees of a rock mine in the area. Her business has been very good and thus her income is stable. She has 4 children; all are grown and working. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 600USD to purchase food to serve her customers. Her income is 210USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhung năm nay 52 tuổi, hai vợ chồng chị là cán bộ hưu trí, hiện cả gia đình chị đang sống tại huyện Hưng Nguyên tỉnh Nghệ an. Năm 1998 khi còn đang công tác chị đã tham gia Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Sau khi về hưu, chị đã mạnh dạn vay các vòng vốn lớn hơn để đầu tư mở cửa hàng ăn phục vụ công nhân làm việc tại mỏ khai thác đá tại địa phương. Công việc kinh doanh của chị đang gặp rất nhiều thuận lợi cho thu nhập ổn định. Gia đình chị có 4 người con đều đã trưởng thành và đã có việc làm. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thực phẩm phục vụ khách hàng. Thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Trang

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Thi Trang is 37 years old. She has 2 school-age children. In 1998, she joined TYM Fund to borrow money to invest in raising pigs in order to increase her family's income. From her initial loan of 30USD and after 10 years of being in TYM Fund, she invested in raising pigs with good success. Everyday she stays home and tends to her pig farm, while her husband has a regular job so their income is very stable. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 720USD to buy feed for the pigs as well as to buy additional pigs to expand her pig farm. Her average income is 180USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Trang năm nay 37 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 2 người con đang tuổi đi học. Năm 1998 chị thma gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Từ vòng vốn ban đầu là 500.000đ đến nay qua 10 năm tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào dự án chăn nuôi rất hiệu quả. Hàng ngày chị ở nhà làm công việc chăn nuôi còn chồng chị làm công nhân do vậy thu nhập của gia đình rất ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để mua thức ăn chăn nuôi và mua thêm lợn mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi tại gia đình. Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Lien

texts.vi:
Ms. Lien is 56 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 1998. Her husband unfortunately died at an early age; therefore, she had to work very hard to raise her children. In 1998 she joined TYM fund and her first loan was 30USD. With this loan, she invested in raising pigs. With the additional loans after that, she always invested in her pig farm and taking care of her children to make sure they were able to go to school. After 10 years, her family's income has become increasingly more stable. Her 3 children were able to finish school, are now grown and have their own family. In addition to her income from raising pigs, she receives assistance from her children. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 900 USD to purchase buffaloes to raise and to help with her agriculture business. Her income is 150 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Liên năm nay 56 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Chồng chị không may mất sớm vì thế chị đã phải làm việc rất vất vả để nuôi các con khôn lớn. Năm 1998 chị tham gia vào Quỹ và vay vốn vòng đầu là 500.000đ. Với mức vốn này chị đã sử dụng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Các vòng vốn sau chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và cho con cái ăn học. Đến nay qua 10 năm cố gắng kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng ổn định, chị đã nuôi được các con khôn lớn, 3 người con của chị đã trưởng thành và lập gia đình. Hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ từ các con. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để mua trâu về nuôi và phục vụ cho sản xuất nông nghiệp Thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Xuan

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Xuan is 50 years old. She has 2 children who are both grown. In 1998 she joined TYM to borrow money to improve her family's income. She used the original loan to buy seeds to grow rice for saL.. Her rice business expanded every day. After seeing the result of her loan, she borrowed a larger amount to buy a machine to grind rice and sell to the peopL. in the area. In addition to her rice business, her family also raises chickens. The rice business and the poultry business bring them good results. Now her family is planning to expand the poultry farm and, therefore, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to fix up the chicken coops and purchase additional chickens. Her income is 180 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Xuân năm nay 50 tuổi. Gia đình chị có hai con đều đã trưởng thành.Năm 1998 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư mua thóc về say sát gạo để bán. Công việc kinh doanh gạo của chị ngày càng phát triển. Sau một thời gian ởt dụng vốn hiệu quả chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn lớn hơn để đầu tư mua máy sát lúa phục vụ nhân dân địa phương. Ngoài công việc say sát lúa gia đình chị còn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà. Tận dụng nguồn thức ăn từ công việc say sát lúa công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình cũng rất hiệu quả. Đến nay gia đình chị đang có dự định mở rộng chăn nuôi gà theo mô hình trang trại vì thế chị mong muốn đươc vay 10.000.000đ để sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm gà về nuôi. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Chau

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Chau is 58 years old. She has been a member with TYM for past 10 years. Both she and her husband are retired military personnel. In 1998, she joined TYM to borrow money to raise poultry and improve their family's income. With the original loan of 30 USD she was able to purchase chickens to raise. This project has changed her family's economic situation. Currently, in her spare time she also babysits children for additional income. In addition to their retirement pensions, she and her husband make an additional 120 USD per month from raising poultry and babysitting. In order to continue her business and increase her income, which would allow her 2 children to go to school, she wishes to borrow 725 USD. Her income is 210 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Châu năm nay 58 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương đã được 10 năm. Hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị đều là cán bộ hưu trí. Năm 1998 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay thêm vôn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Với vòng vốn ban đầu là 500.000đ chị đã sử dụng để mua gà về nuôi. Đây là dự án đã mang lại sự đổi thay về kinh tế đối với gia đình chị. Tận dụng thời gian rảnh rỗi chị còn nhận trông trẻ để tăng thêm thu nhập. Hiện nay ngoài lương hưu anh chị còn có thêm 2.000.000đ/ tháng từ dự án chăn nuôi và công việc trông trẻ. Để mở rộng mô hình kinh doanh tăng thu nhập và có điều kiện đầu tư tốt hơn cho 2 con đi học vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ. Thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Mrs. Om V., 40, is a tailor who works from her house and provides services in her village. She makes about $9 per day. Her husband is on the staff of a non-governmental organization and his income is $5 per day. They have five children, all of whom are young. They all live in Deylo Village, Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia.

Because of increasing expenses, she wants to reduce cost of the family's transportation, so she is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for the family to use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Josiane

texts.fr:
Josiane D. was born on July 9, 1970 in Lokossa, in the Mono province of southwest Benin. Married to Victor Kpanou, a refrigerating engineer by profession, she is the mother of three children. Mindful of her role in the family and being without any sort of occupational training, five years ago she plunged into distribution of various products, in particular, women’s handbags, shoes, soap, and shirts, amongst others. At the outset, she marketed food products, but she discontinued that practice because she found it too cumbersome and instead went into traveling sales. Thanks to the income from that business, she has been able to assist her husband in supporting the family. Initially she purchased her inventory at the Dantokpa international market in Cotonou, but now, she finds it more profitable to head for the Lome city market in the neighboring country of Togo, where merchandise is less expensive. At present she is requesting her seventh loan, and asks for $300 to grow her business.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame D. Josiane est née le 09 Juillet 1970 à Lokossa dans le département du Mono au sud-ouest du Bénin. Mariée à KPANOU Victor, frigoriste de profession, elle est mère de trois enfants. Soucieuse de son rôle de femme dans le foyer et n'ayant reçu aucune formation professionnelle, elle s’est lancé il y a maintenant cinq ans dans la distribution de divers produits à savoir: sacs, chaussures, savons, chemises et autres. Précisons qu'au départ, elle commercialisait les produits vivriers. Elle a abandonner cette activité au profit de la distribution ambulante parce qu'elle la trouvait trop tracassante. Grâce aux revenus de cette activité, elle vient en aide à son mari dans les charges familiales. Au départ,elle s’approvisionnait à Dantokpa le marché international de Cotonou, mais actuellement elle s'est orientée vers le marché de Lomé dans l'État voisin du TOGO (où les marchandises coûtent moins chères) afin de pouvoir réaliser un bénéfice considérable. Actuellement, elle est à son septième crédit et sollicite 120 000F CFA pour le renforcement de son commerce.

loans.use: The purchase of 10 ladies' handbags, two dozen pairs of ladies' shoes, and two cases of Marseille Soap.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem S. is a farmer who lives in Spa Village, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She lives with her husband and has two children. She earns about $1.50 per day. With her growing her farming business, she wants to expand the output of rice crop, so she is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer to use on her rice crop. The loan allows her to increase her rice output and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru:
Mahmud H. is 26 years old. He is single for now and lives with his parents. Mahmud has a higher education and works as an economist at a construction firm. He has a car “Opel,” but the car’s owner is Mahmud’s father. Mahmud has saved up some money and with the help of a loan he would like to purchase a car. He has been dreaming about purchasing the car “Neksia” for a long time and has decided to turn to MicroInvest for a loan for the purchase.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хафизов Махмуд парень в возросте 26 лет пока не семейный, живет вместе с родителями. Махмуд имеет высшее образование , работает экономистом в строительной компании.В данное время у Махмуда есть автомашина марки "Опель", но её хозяином является его отец. Поэтому Махмуд поднакопив денег , хочет с помощью кредита прибавить и купить себе собственную автомашину.Он уже давно мечтает о автомашине марки "Нексия" для ее покупки он решил обратится за займом в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Personal loan to purchase car

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
Born November 17, 1955 in Abomey, a historic village in the Zou province of Benin, Mrs. Abertine H. is married and the mother of two children. Her husband Rémy Dayato is a retired policeman who practices polygamy. Abertine currently lives with her eldest daughter Pélagie. She deals in corn and sewing fabric, delivering these products door to door to her customers. After delivery, she returns to the homes of her clients to collect payments on a daily or weekly basis. In order to expand her business to better meet the needs of her growing clientele, last year Abertine requested and received her first loan from Alidé. She easily repaid it and has already received a second loan, which was also repaid. She now requests her third loan in order to grow her business.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 17 Novembre 1955 à Abomey une ville historique du Bénin dans le département du Zou, dame H. Albertine est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Son époux DAYATO Rémy est un gendarme retraité et polygame. Elle vit actuellement avec sa fille aînée Pélagie. Elle fait la distribution de maïs et de tissus. Elle passe de maison en maison mettre à la disposition de ses clients ses produits. Une fois les produits distribués, elle repasse chez ses clients pour percevoir les remboursements de façon hebdomadaire ou journalière. Pour donner plus d'ampleur à son activité et mieux satisfaire ses clients qui sont devenus nombreux, elle avait sollicité et obtenu l'année dernière son premier prêt à Alidé. Elle a remboursé ce premier crédit sans grande difficulté et a même déjà reçu son deuxième prêt qu'elle a aussi remboursé. Elle vient solliciter son troisième prêt pour renforcer son activité.

loans.use: The purchase of three 25 kg sacks of corn and four bolts of fabric.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sary M., 41, sells used clothes in the market and she can make about $5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Sos Seat, is a motorcycle taxi driver, as well as a bricklayer, and makes about $4 per day. They have six children and live in Balat Village, Battambang Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. M. is asking a loan to add her saved cash to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Gulam Rasol

texts.en:
Gulam Rasol is married. He is an uneducated man who was in Pakistan during the war. He has a firewood shop that he has been running for more than 7 years to support his family. He wants to get ready for winter because people need a lot of firewood during the winter in Afghanistan.

He has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and improve his business to make a good monthly income for his family. Rasol hopes to open another shop and enlarge his business. He loves his business and works hard for his family. He is happy with this small loan process.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina K., who is married with two grown daughters, lives in Ivano-Frankivsk in Western Ukraine where she sells undergarments, socks, and shirts in the central city market. She has been in business for six years and attracts many customers with her low prices and assorted merchandise. Katerina's monthly income is about $1200.

Katerina's previous jobs as a plasterer and as a janitor didn't provide enough money to support her family. This clothing business is now her family's only source of income, and she is thankful that previous Nadiya Ukraine loans have helped her to open two vending facilities in the market. She is requesting a seasonal loan of $550 to purchase 100 pairs of socks, 30 sets of pajamas, and 30 t-shirts in order to open a third facility in the same market. This new loan will help Katerina expand her business and continue to provide stability for her family.

loans.use: To restock her inventory.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila S., who is married with one son, sells household items in the central market of Kherson. Ludmila is a hard worker and has invested $2400 in her business over the six years it has been in operation. She is disciplined and responsible, promptly repaying three previous Nadiya Ukraine loans.

Ludmila dreams of having a stable source of income so that she can become economically independent and live in an apartment. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $675 to help increase her turnover capital. Ludmila has persevered through many challenges with optimism and enthusiasm. She is friendly and organized, both characteristics of an excellent business woman.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana R., married with one daughter, sells women's clothing in the central market in Kherson. She has invested $8000 in her business over the past four years. Tatyana has the unique ability to understand people and build relationships with her customers, a wonderful quality to have since her business is located in a very busy place.

Tatyana dreams of building a career to gain economic independence and is therefore requesting a seasonal loan of $675 to increase her range of merchandise.
