She plans to repay this loan in two months, and has been very prompt with all previous loan payments. Tatyana's discipline and diligence will be helpful as she plans to use additional profits to invest in other ventures in the future.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital.

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Pavel V., married with one son, lives in Kherson where he sells household items in the central city market. After 16 years, he has invested over $10,000 in his business and is now requesting a loan of $675 to purchase additional inventory. He has already repaid three loans to Nadiya Ukraine and is determined to discharge this one in a timely fashion. He is focused on the future, and the loan will help him to expand his business.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase his inventory.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en:
Vadim A. lives with his son Artyomin in Kherson where, for ten years, he has been an entrepreneur selling footwear in the central city market. His business attracts many customers with its wide selection of high quality merchandise. He currently has about $12,000 in inventory.

Vadim has requested a loan of $675, to be repaid in two months, to help him purchase additional inventory. His high level of responsibility is exemplified by his timely repayment of 15 previous loans from Nadiya Ukraine. This loan will enable Vadim to continue to develop his business and have a more stable income.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina I. is single and lives in Melitopol, where she owns a vending kiosk. For the past four years she has sold bijouterie (jewelry, trinkets, etc.), wigs, and other small things for women. She has had wonderful business experiences so far and would now like to open a new vending facility in the train station market. Currently she has a gross monthly income of about $1200 which she uses to support her parents.

Having already invested $3600 in her business, Marina would like to continue to develop her enterprise. To accomplish this goal, Marina is requesting a loan of $550, to be repaid in two months. This loan would allow her to open the new kiosk and have a more stable income to support herself and her parents.

Marina has received financial assistance in the past from Nadiya Ukraine and has repaid all previous loans on time.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility at a train station market.

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr:
Married to Yeyi Théodore Eholou, an official with the National Geographic Institute of Benin in Cotonou, Mrs. Paulette E. was born September 27, 1979 in Cotonou and is the mother of three children:  nine-year-old Martial and seven-year-old Romual, both in elementary school, and four-year-old Espérancia, in nursery school.  For the past two years, Paulette and her husband have lived in the Sènadé district of Cotonou.  She has been a retail merchant of various food products, palm wine and vegetable oil for the past decade. She replenishes her stock with food products from the Dantokpa market in Cotonou, and regularly travels between Cotonou and markets in the interior of the country for other goods. To expand her business, she sought and obtained her first loan of $100 in 2007. Business is booming, and to meet the needs of her customers, she is now seeking her third loan, $250. 

 Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée à EHOLOU Yeyi Théodore agent de l’Institut Géographique National du Bénin (IGN) à Cotonou, dame E. Paulette est née le 27/09/1979 à Cotonou et mère de trois enfants; Martial  9ans et en classe de CE2, Romuald 7ans et en classe de CE1 et Espérancia 4 ans et en classe de maternelle. E. Paulette réside au quartier  Sènadé depuis 2 ans avec son époux. Elle est revendeuse de divers produits vivriers, du vin de palme et d’huile végétale depuis une dizaine d’années. Elle fait ses  approvisionnements en produits vivriers au marché Dantokpa de Cotonou. Pour les autres produits, elle fait la navette entre Cotonou et les autres marché de l'intérieur du pays. Afin de renforcer son activité, elle a sollicité et obtenu en 2007 un premier prêt de 40.000F CFA. Elle a beaucoup évolué dans son activité. Pour faire face à la demande de ses clients, elle sollicite à présent pour son troisième prêt 100.000F CFA.

loans.use: Purchase of a 100 kg sack of corn, a case of tomato paste, three dozen boxes of Omo  and Klin detergent, and a case of BF soap.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji (baji is an Urdu term of respect meaning "elder sister") is the wife of A. M. and they have been living in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 10 years. She is the mother of five children, two sons and three daughters, all of whom are enrolled in a local school.. She owns a two-room brick house. A. M. drives an auto-rickshaw. Kosar baji successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy another auto-rickshaw to expand the business.

She is joined in her loan group by several other members. Kosar baji would like to buy masonry tools. Bushra baji wants a loan for her sweetmeat business. Anwar baji wants to buy a lift machine (similar to a tractor). Shabana baji would like to buy fruit for her fruit sales business.

In this group loan, the funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans, so that if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena G., married with two daughters, is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she sells paintings, watches, and souvenirs in the central market. She is a Christian who regularly attends a Christian church. An experienced vendor who has been in business for eight years, Yelena’s gross monthly income is about $1600, and she has about $2000 in inventory.

With a Kiva loan of $675, Yelena hopes to increase her assortment of paintings and develop her trade. Her business has already enabled her to arrange a wedding for her elder daughter, who has moved to Kiev. This loan would allow her to continue to support her children and grandchildren.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months .

loans.use: To increase her assortment of paintings for sale.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji (baji is the Urdu term of respect meaning "elder sister") is the wife of S. M.; they have been living in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 20 years. She is the mother of eight children: four sons and four daughters. Her eldest son, 20 years old, drives an auto-rickshaw. The remaining children are enrolled in a local school near the family's neighborhood. Her husband is a driver who also drives a rented auto-rickshaw. Sakina baji successfully completed her loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and now is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy fruit for her fruit business. Parveen baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. Rashida baji also wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Married with two sons, Natalya D. lives in Melitopol, where she sells groceries in the city market. Her parents started the business in a good vending location, and Natalya inherited it 14 years ago. A hard worker, her gross income is about $1400, with a net profit of about $600 per month. She has invested $2000 in her business.

Natalya is requesting a loan of $1100 to increase her assortment of merchandise. As an entrepreneur of integrity, she promises to repay the loan in 12 months. Natalya hopes to do some remodeling of the business as she continues to profit from sales.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of merchandise.

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Ramzana is the wife of S. A. and they have been living in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 30 years. She is the mother of three children, two daughters and one son. Her son is a laborer. Her two daughters make special order decorative embroidery. S. A., her husband, has a soft-drink business. Ramzana successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan for her husband’s soft-drink business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Khursheed baji wants a loan for her drink corner shop. Safia baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. Safia baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools. Ayesha baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. Baji is an Urdu term meaning 'elder sister' and signifying respect.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei C. lives in Zaporozhye, Ukraine, where he is a successful businessman who has been selling a variety of perfumes, leather goods, and glass products over the past 10 years. The father of two grown children, he provides the family's only income. Sergei has two vending locations in the market, where he makes a net profit of about $500 per month. He has invested about $2400 in his business.

Sergei is requesting a seasonal loan of $550 with which to re-stock his inventory and purchase seasonal merchandise. This loan will increase his business sales, allowing Sergei to diversify his merchandise and better provide for his family.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji, 53 years old, is the widow of M.R. and has been living in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the last 35 years. (Baji is an Urdu term of respect meaning 'elder sister'.) She is the mother of ten children, five daughters and five sons. Her elder son works in a factory. The next two sons have a fruit cart. Her fourth son has a milk shop and the youngest son works in a factory. Khursheed baji's first daughter is a widow and lives with her. The next two daughters make decorative embroidery. Her youngest daughters are enrolled in a local school near the family's neighborhood. Khursheed baji has a live stock business; she sells milk which she collects from her animals. She successfully completed her loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to expand the milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Syeda Nasira baji wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy fruit for her fruit business. Parveen baji wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya P. has been in business for six years selling clothing and footwear in the "Mercury" market in Zaporozye, where she lives. An experienced business woman who pays particular attention to customer service, she earns a net monthly profit of about $400, and has approximately $2000 worth of inventory. Natalya has one grown son.

Natalya has been working with Nadiya Ukraine for a considerable time, and as a result has seen considerable business growth. Her goal is to continue to develop the business in order to become completely self-sustainable one day. Now she is requesting a seasonal loan of $550 to increase her turnover capital for the summer season. With the profits from this loan, Natalya hopes to hire some vendors to assist her with sales, thereby continuing the cycle of giving by using her Kiva loan to provide job opportunities for other people in need of work.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of N. A. and they have been living in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the last 45 years. She owns a two-room brick house, and she is the mother of three children, one son and two daughters. Both daughters are in 10th standard. Her son is an electrician by profession. Suraiya is not only a housewife, she is also a businesswoman specializing in garment sales. She successfully completed a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan for her garment business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Saira baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. Sadiqan baji wants a loan for her grocery shop. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy a land on contract. Shamim baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. (Baji is an Urdu term of respect meaning 'elder sister'.)

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr:
Mrs. Nathalie H. was born January 26, 1981 in the Atlantic department south of Benin. She is married to Mr. Amoussa Ogoubiyi and is the mother of two children, Irfane (3-years old) and Hanane (6-years old). She markets “basin” fabrics, “pagnes” (dyed cloths used as clothing), hairpieces and men's and women’s shoes. When she borrowed her first loan in 2005, she still sold various food products and hoped to add the sale of ice water. For this first loan she received 75,000F CFA. It was following this increase in capital that she became involved in the sale of fabrics, pagnes, hairpieces and men's and women’s shoes. Her businesses are still undoubtedly growing, and for her fourth loan she is requesting 200,000F CFA.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

Dame H. Nathalie est née le 26 janvier 1981 à Ouidah dans la département de l'Atlantique au sud du Bénin. Elle est mariée à monsieur OGOUBIYI Amoussa et mère de deux enfants; Irfane et Hanane, respectivement âgés de 3 ans et de 6 mois. Elle commercialise les tissus "basin", les pagnes, les mèches et les chaussures homme et dame. A l'époque où elle venait demander son premier prêt en 2005, elle vendait encore divers produits vivriers et envisageait d’y ajouter la vente d'eau glacée. Pour ce premier prêt, elle avait obtenu 75000F CFA. C’est suite à l’amélioration de son capital qu’elle s'est lancée dans la vente de basins, de pagnes, de mèches et de chaussures homme et dame. Ses activités sont toujours en nette progression et pour son quatrième prêt, elle demande un montant de 200000F CFA.

loans.use: Purchase of 4 dozen hairpieces and 5 full "basin" fabrics

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Reine D. is married to Dodji Dansou, who is a diesel mechanic and polygamous. She was born around the year 1972 in Cotonou in the department of Littoral, and has lived in the Ménontin district for 5 years. Trained as a seamstress, she also runs a secondary business in food service and selling of cosmetic products. Selling cosmetic products has taken priority over her other activities and her clientele has grown. Faced with an ever-growing demand for cosmetic products, and not having sufficient financial means, she had to request loans for support. Mrs. Reine D. is requesting her third loan from Alidé in hope of satisfying her numerous customers.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée à DANSOU Dodji polygame et mécanicien diéséliste, dame D. Reine est née vers les années 1972 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral et réside au quartier Ménontin depuis 5 ans. Couturière de formation, elle mène comme activités secondaires la restauration et la vente de produits cosmétiques. La vente de produits cosmétiques a pris le pas sur les autres activités et ses clients sont devenus plus nombreux. Face à la demande sans cesse de croissante de produits cosmétiques et ne disposant pas de moyens financiers assez important elle a dû recourir au prêt. Dame D. Reine sollicite son troisième prêt à Alidé en vue de satisfaire ses nombreux clients.

loans.use: Purchase of three dozen hairpieces, three dozen beauty products and six pieces of pagne (dyed clothing fabrics)

loans.name: Gie Aroka Group

texts.fr:
We are young people from the Mlomp ecovillage, and have already constructed a building in order to turn it into an inn. In our ecovillage there is no place for visitors to stay while passing through. We have invested in the construction of an inn in order to solve this problem. The inn will allow visitors to find a place to eat and sleep, rather than having to go elsewhere in other villages. This will allow us to earn our living and create jobs to fight the illegal immigration that has caused nearly all the village youth to leave. We need this loan in order to buy furniture and to build and supply the bathrooms and restaurant.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

Nous sommes des jeunes de l'écovillage de Mlomp qui avons déjà construit un bâtiment pour en faire une auberge. Dans notre ecovillage, nous n'avons pas de site d'accueil pour loger les visiteurs qui sont de passage chez nous. C'est pour palier à ce problème que nous avons décidé d'investir dans la construction d'une auberge. Ce lieu permettra aux visiteurs de trouver un endroit pour passer la nuit et se restaurer, au lieu d'aller ailleurs dans les autres villages. Cela nous fera gagner notre vie et permet de créer des emplois pour lutter contre l'immigration clandestine qui a fini de faire partir presque tous les jeunes du village. Nous avons besoin de ce prêt pour nous équiper en mobilier et aussi construire et équiper les toilletes et le restaurant.

loans.use: Achat de matériaux pour construction et équipement d'une auberge

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella E. sells smoked fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Stella and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es:
Isaac works with his daughter at his home to sell lunch to drivers of minibuses and cars that work in public transportation. This is his main source of income to cover his family’s expenses. He lives in his own home in the area 16 de Febrero (Rio Seco) in the city of El Alto.

The credit is allocated for the purchase of building materials, which will be used for the renovation of his kitchen, where he prepares the lunches that he sells.

It is his first credit with Impro, and it qualifies for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Isaac trabaja con su hija en su domicilio, vende almuerzo a los conductores y Voceadores de los minibuses que tabajan en transporte publico, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su familia; vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona 16 de febrero (Rio Seco) de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción, que será utilizado en la refacción de su cocina donde elabora los almuerzos que comercializa.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Isaac.

loans.use: To renovate the kitchen where he prepares the food he sells

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba E. sells Banku, a local dish of fermented maize. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Araba and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos is a producer of cow milk at the same company that sells PIL, and he also sells beef in nearby communities. These activities are his main source of income to cover the expenses of his three children and wife.

He lives in the community of Akjerana - Achacachi (three and a half hours from La Paz).

The credit will be allocated for the purchase of a medium-sized cow to increase milk production.

This is his second credit with Impro, and the loan requested by Marcos has been approved due to good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcos, es productor de leche de vaca, la misma que comercializa en la empresa PIL, también comercializa ganados vacunos al por menor en las comunidades cercanas a la de él; estas actividades son su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos y esposa.

Vive en la Comunidad de Akjerana - Achacachi (A tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Marcos.

loans.use: To purchase a medium dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica is a producer of cow milk at the same company that sells PIL, and her husband works in the sewing industry. These two activities are their main sources of income to cover the expenses of their small 8-month-old son. She lives in the community of Akjerana - Achacachi (three and a half hours from La Paz).

The credit will be allocated for the purchase of a medium cow to increase milk production. It is her first credit with Impro, and it qualifies for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Veronica, es productora de leche de vaca la misma que comercializa en la empresa PIL, el esposo trabaja de empleado como costurero; estas dos actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con los cubren la manutención de su pequeño hijo de 8 meses. Vive en la Comunidad de Akjerana - Achacachi (A tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamos solicitado por Veronica.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanesa works at Hotel Sucre as a contracted waitress and is a student at the University Publica El Alto (UPEA) with a career in law. She lives in her parents’ home located in Area 16 of Febrero Rio Seco El Alto.

The credit will be allocated toward purchasing a computer because her parents do not have the resources to support her. The computer will allow her to fulfill her work at the University.

This is her first credit with Impro, and it qualifies because loan approval was requested by Vanesa.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Vanesa trabaja en el Hotel Sucre de mesera a contrato y es estudiante de la Universidad Publica El Alto UPEA en la carrera de Derecho, vive en la casa de sus padre ubicada en la Zona 16 de Febrero Rio Seco El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una computadora ya que sus padres no cuentan con los recursos para poderle apoyar; dicha computadora le ayudará mucho a realizar sus trabajos de la Universidad.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Vanesa.

loans.use: To purchase a computer to facilitate her work at the University

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia E. sells fresh fish as well as groceries. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Emilia and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Click this link to view Maxima's first loan.

Maxima is a member of the Arco Iris Village Bank. She is married and has two children.

Maxima sells cheese and cereal on the streets of the Nery Garcia Market. Also, Maxima sells garlic, from the city of Chuschi, that she hand peels. Furthermore, Maxima raises and sells guinea pigs - a traditional Peruvian protein source - to restaurants and in outdoor areas, a business that is slowly increasing.

Maxima needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($US375) to invest in alfalfa seeds that she will cultivate in order to feed her guinea pigs.

Maxima's dreams are to have more storehouses and a stable, to further extend her business and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To invest in alfalfa seeds that she will cultivate in order to feed her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Dienaba

texts.fr:
Dienaba B. is 52 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is requesting this loan in order to boost her business of buying and selling of vegetables and of “thioup” dyed fabrics. This loan will be repaid all at once in full at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

Dienaba B., agée de 52 ans, est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’activer dans l’achat et la revente de tissu teint « Thioup » et de légumes. Ce prêt sera remboursé au bout de six mois et en une seule échéance .

loans.use: Buying and selling vegetables and “thioup” dyed fabrics.

loans.name: Yago

texts.es:
Yago works at Hotel Sucre as contracted waiter and is a student at the University Publica El Alto (UPEA) with a career in law. He lives in his parents’ home located in Area 16 of Febrero Rio Seco El Alto. Yago is the brother of Vanesa, who has also requested a loan of Kiva.

The credit will be allocated toward purchasing a computer because his parents do not have the resources to support him. The computer will allow him to fulfill his work at the University.

This is his first credit with Impro, and it qualifies because loan approval was requested by Vanesa.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Yago trabaja en el Hotel Sucre de mesero a contrato y es estudiante de la Universidad Publica El Alto UPEA en la carrera de Derecho, vive en la casa de sus padre ubicado en la Zona 16 de Febrero Rio Seco El Alto. Yago es hermano de Vanesa, quien también ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una computadora ya que sus padres no cuentan con los recursos para poderle apoyar; la computadora le facilitará mucho a realizar sus trabajos de la Universidad.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Vanesa.

loans.use: To purchase a computer to facilitate his work at the University

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly studies at the Parvulario Institute and works with her mother to create embroidery labels; this activity is her source of income with which she covers her expenses. Magaly lives in her parents' home located in the city of La Paz.

The credit is allocated for the purchase of a computer, which will help her greatly in order to do her research work at the Institute.

This is her second credit with Impro. The loan requested by Magaly has been approved due to good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Magaly estudia en el Instituto Parvulario y trabaja con su madre realizando bordados de etiquetas; esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre su manutención. Magaly vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona la Portada de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una computadora que le ayudará mucho para realizar su trabajos de investigación del instituto.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Magaly.

loans.use: To purchase a computer to facilitate her studieds at the Institute

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
Click this link to view Simeona's first loan.

Simeona is a member of Arco Iris Village Bank. Simeona is 39 and married with two children. She travels to regional fairs twice a week where she buys cereal, small animals, cheese and other products that she sells in the Grau market. Furthermore, Simeona raises and sells cattle in Lima in order to support her nephews. She buys the livestock in the Ayacucho and then transports them to Lima.

Simeona needs a loan of 1600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($US575) to invest in more cattle and cereal to expand her business.

Simeona dreams to increase her business, to finish the construction of her house, and that her children will obtain professional jobs.

loans.use: To invest in more cattle and cereal to expand her business.

loans.name: Estelista Apolinaria

texts.en:
Click this link to view Estelista's first loan.

Estelista is a member of the Arco Iris Village Bank. She is 47 years, unmarried with one son. Estelista travels to regional fairs to buy cheese, meat, cereal and other products to sell in the Nery Garcia Market. She also delivers goods to the city of Lima. Additionally, she raises cattle and pigs on her pasture and embroiders tablecloths that she sells in the regional fairs.

Estelista needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($US375) to buy more meat, cheese and cereal to expand her business.

Estelista's hopes are for better business and that her son studies hard and has good health.

loans.use: To buy more meat, cheese and cereal to expand her business.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Mr Raúl lives in his own house with his wife and children in the street Manuel Huici in the Alto San Pedro area in the city of La Paz. He works in a laundry shop. The loan he is requesting is to make repairs in his old house. The floor is in bad condition and the bathroom roof is damaged due the frequent rains. Raúl and his wife want to repair everything what is damaged and they would like to provide more comfort to their children and to avoid any accidents. He is an old client and his payment record is excellent, therefore he can gain access on a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Raúl vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle Manuel Huici de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la atención de una tienda de limpieza de ropa. El crédito que solicita es para la refacción de su casa ya que como es casa antigua el piso esta deteriorado y por las frecuentes lluvias el techo del baño también se encuentra en malas condiciones. Raúl y su esposa quieren reparar todo lo que esta deteriorado y así poder dar mayor comodidad a sus hijos y evitar cualquier cualquier accidente. Es cliente antiguo y su historial de pagos es excelente, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Repair the bathroom roof because it's really damaged.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Click this link to view Getrudes' first loan.

Getrudes is a member of the Arco Iris Village Bank. She is 36 years old and is married with five children at home. She travels to the regional fairs where she sells fruit and vegetables and where she buys cereal, cheese, and at times processed cereal that she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Gertrudes works on a farm during crop season.

Gertrudes needs a loan of 1400 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($US525) to buy more pigs, sheep, cheese and cereals in order to expand her business.

Gertrudes' dreams are that her working capital increases, that she will be economically established and that her children will become professionals.

loans.use: To buy more pigs, sheep, cheese and cereals in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi B. sells clothing. She is married, but her husband's income from his job as a repairman is not sufficient for Esi and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Claudia America

texts.en:
Click this link to view Claudia's first loan.

Claudia is a member of the Arco Iris Village Bank. She is 38 years old, married with three children. Claudia sells food at night at the street corner near her house and sells traditional food at the small town square in her neighborhood. Furthermore, Claudia has recently started selling chicken kebabs by cart also at night.

Claudia needs a loan of 1200 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($US450) to invest in rice, noodles, peanuts and potatoes to expand her business.

Claudia's dreams are to improve her home, to move forward, to have a restaurant and to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To invest in rice, noodles, peanuts and potatoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Dina's first loan.

Dina is a member of the Arco Iris Village Bank. She is 35 years old, married with three children. She and her spouse make beautiful tapestries, blankets and walkways, products that they sell in the markets in the city of Ayacucho and other cities through middlemen.

Dina needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($US375) to buy more threads and dyes to expand her business.

Dina's dreams are to sell more products directly to regional fairs, to travel to other cities and to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy more threads and dyes to expand her business.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Araceli is a domestic employee and her husband is a construction bricklayer. They have two children in school age. Her house is located in the area of Irpavi II in the city of La Paz. She lives as a minder and she is requesting a loan to be able to pay the down payment of a lot. This way she will be able to own her own house in the future, since she is a combatant woman. This is the fourth time that she has requested a loan with Impro. Her record qualifies her as client 1 meaning that she pays her loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Araceli es empleada domestica y su esposo es albañil constructor, tienen dos hijos en edad escolar Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz; vive como cuidadora por lo cual solicita el crédito para cancelar una parte del monto total requerido para la compra de un terreno, y así poder contar con una vivienda propia en el futuro ya que es una mujer luchadora. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.

loans.use: Buy a lot so later build her own house.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is divorced and has a 13-year-old son. He runs a small pet store in Melitopol selling aquariums, pet supplies and animal feed in the central city market. His vending facility is attractive, with a nice arrangement of inventory. Moreover, Sergei offers affordable prices and friendly service. He loves this business, which he has been operating for over three years. Today his turnover capital is about $1000, while net profit is approximately $200 each month.

Sergei is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase additional merchandise and increase his sales. He is very optimistic about the future, as he plans to develop his business to achieve maximum entrepreneurial success.

Sergei has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine, and we believe his enterprising spirit and enthusiasm will ensure business success and prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana, a married mother of three boys, is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she owns a business selling women’s knitted wear in the central city market. Tatyana offers unique merchandise that has earned her many loyal customers over the 10 years she has been operating. Presently, her turnover capital is about $800, while her monthly profit is about $300.

Tatyana is requesting a $675 loan to increase her assortment of merchandise and generate additional income with which she will purchase electric appliances for her house and expand her business further.

Tatyana has been using Nadiya Ukraine loans for the past six years, and she hasn’t had a single late payment. We believe this client’s diligence and determination will guarantee current loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase product variety.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa sells chuño (freeze-dried potato), soaked corn and wheat and she commercializes her products walking around the markets in the south area of the City of the Peace. Her house is located in the area of Irpavi Vergel in the city of La Paz. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan with Impro. The loan will be use to increase her working capital and to buy more Chuño, peeled corn and wheat, that are her main products. The loan will help her improve her conditions of life since her income will increase with the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Felipa se dedica a la venta de chuño , maiz y trigo remojado y comercializa su producto ambulando por lo mercados de la zona sur de la Ciudad de la Paz. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi Vergel de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. El crédito será destinado para aumentar su capital de Trabajo y comprar más Chuño, maiz pelado y Trigo, que son sus principales productos. El crédito le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que aumentará sus ingresos en sus ventas.

loans.use: Buy chuño (freeze-dried potato), peeled corn and wheat.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana, an entrepreneur from Melitopol where she sells women’s clothing in the local market, is married with two children. She started her business venture over seven years ago and presently has about $1000 in inventory and earns a monthly profit of about $500.

Svetlana is a skilled and experienced entrepreneur, tracking market trends in order to keep her business relevant to the demand of customers. She is seeking a loan of $1,100 to acquire assorted merchandise, boost her sales and provide for her family needs. She is hoping to use business profits to invest in her children’s college education. Svetlana has been working with Nadiya Ukraine for over three years.

loans.use: To increase product variety.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola sells cosmetics and perfumes at different offices and markets. She sells her products on credit. Her clients pay her either every day, or on a weekly or every fortnight basis. Her house is located in the area Bolognia in the city of La Paz. She rents her house and this is the first time she is requesting a loan with Impro. The loan will be use to increase her working capital and to buy more merchandise (Perfumes, cosmetics, deodorants, creams and others). She tells us that the demand of her products has increased and she has many potential clients that if she serves them properly for sure her income will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Paola se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes en las oficinas y mercados. Otorga su producto a crédito, para poder cobrar cada día, a la semana o cada quincena. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Bolognia de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en Alquiler Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. El crédito será destinado para aumentar su capital de Trabajo y comprar más mercadería (Perfumes, cosméticos, desodorantes, cremas y otros), pues ella indica que la demanda por dichos productos ha aumentado y tiene muchos clientes potenciales que si los atiende adecuadamente con seguridad sus ingresos mejorarán.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her perfume and cosmetics business.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Bintou D. is a 42-year old widow with five children in her care. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics that she can use to craft and sell clothing. This loan will also allow her to buy and sell baobab fruit. This is her first loan, which she will repay all at once in full at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Bintou D., 42 ans est veuve et a à sa charge de 05 enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter des tissus, en confectionne des habits qu’elle va revendre. Ce prêt lui permettra en même temps d’acheter et de revendre du pain de singe. voici son premier prêt qu’elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Making and selling clothing.  Buying and selling baobab fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To smart a small business of selling costume jewelry in the community

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 42 years old and the mother of 6 children. All her children are currently in school. Grace treks to the nearby villages to buy her products and retails them in Kumasi, where she has good sales and gets additional income to support her family. She wants to buy more farm products to avoid price hikes as the country enters the farming season. She wants to use the loan to buy plantains and cocoyams. Grace is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral in order to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bunches of plantains and bags of cocoyams

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is 51 years old and a widow with 4 children. She has been selling farm produce in the local market for 20 years now. Due to her low income, she has not been able to support her children for them to acquire employable skills or the level of education needed to earn a living. She wants to use the loan to buy more produce to enable her to save some money to enable 2 of the children to learn a trade, as her children are grown, and they need to work so that they do not become social deviants.

She believes she can buy more for the lean season, when demand for the produce would be high and would give her a good income. Afua is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral in order to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and plantains

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of a large variety of cakes, sweets, and other goods to sell to small groceries stores and cafeterias.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
I have a plot of land that has some construction work on it, but I need to build a room on it because my wife and I are currently living in an old, broken down bus. We do not have any children because of our current living conditions. I am requesting a loan of $800.00 USD in order to obtain at least a safe and steadier roof over our heads so we can sleep.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuento con un terreno semiconstruido, tengo la necesidad de construir un cuarto en el, por que lo que tengo de casa para vivir es un autobús descompuesto, vivo con mi esposa aun no tenemos familia por las condiciones en que nos encontramos, es por esto que les solicito la cantidad de $800.00 dlls. Para poder tener al menos un techo mas firme y seguro donde dormir.

loans.use: Construction of one room

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is married with 2 children. The children are currently in school. She hawks smoked fish in her village, where her loyal customers buy smoked fish for vegetable soup, popularly known as light soup in Ghana. This is a Ghanaian delicacy either with cooked yams or plantains and cocoyams. Augustina wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of the fish to increase her inventory to avoid price hikes and also to make a good income to pay her children’s fees. She is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral in order to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To make a fresh start of a small clothing store in order to improve her family's financial situation

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 40 years old and a divorced mother with 4 children. She sells cosmetics in her village market to earn a living to take care of her 4 children. All her children are currently in school. Charity says trading in cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore wants to use the loan to buy more boxes of cosmetics to increase her inventory and income. She believes this loan would help her to save for her children’s future. Charity is a member of the group called Anointed Ladies. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral in order to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics

loans.name: Têtêh Egbégnon

texts.fr:
Mr. Teteh Egbegnon N. was born on January 27, 1981 in Lome. He is a retailer and married to Mrs. Amenouglo Essi, also a retailer in the Agoe district. After leaving school in 2004, he opened a general grocery store selling milk, rice, boxes of canned food and soap.

Mr. N. would like to increase his inventory to provide better service for his customers. To achieve this, he is requesting his first loan to purchase five (5) sacks of rice, four (4) crates of milk, and ten (10) boxes of soap.

.Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 27 janvier 1981 à Lomé, monsieur N’KONOU Têtêh Egbegnon est un revendeur et s’est marié à madame Amenouglo Essi qui est une revendeuse dans le quartier d’Agoè. Depuis 2004 qu’il a quitté les bancs d’école, il a ouvert une boutique d’alimentation générale dans laquelle il vend du lait, du riz des boîtes de conserve et du savon. Il désire augmenter son stock afin de mieux servir ses clients. A cet effet il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de riz, 4 cartons de lait et 10 cartons de savon.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grocery items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a divorced mother of 5 children. Two of her children are currently in school. She has been selling yams since her husband died 10 years ago in order to support her children. She buys the yams from the city market, Kumasi, which is very expensive, and therefore she does not get a good income from the sales. She wants to use the loan to buy the yams from the farmers instead of buying from the market dealers. This she believes would increase her sales and income to support the 2 children who are in school. Mary is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral in order to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of fresh yams

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjovi F. was born in the city of Lome in 1983. She is married and the mother of one child. In 2005, she opened a store selling hardware articles. She secured a small loan allowing her to provide additional basic household necessities for sale.

Mrs. F. is a loyal customer who is repaying her first loan on schedule. She would like to increase her business and is requesting a second loan to purchase four (4) cartons of strong glue, four (4) bundles of nails, and four (4) boxes of paint. Also, she would increase her existing inventory to provide additional sales.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Madame F. Adjovi est née en 1983 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a ouvert depuis 2005, un magasin de vente des articles de quincaillerie, activité à laquelle elle a ajouté la vente des produits de premières nécessités après l’obtention de son premier crédit. Elle est un client fidèle qui se comporte bien dans le remboursement. Elle désire renforcer son activité et sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter quatre cartons de colle forte, quatre paquets de cloue et quatre boîtes de peinture. Ainsi elle augmentera son stock et pourra mieux vendre.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware articles

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in a large variety of fruits and vegetables to add to her stock in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr:
Mrs. Essohanam A. is married, 29 years old and the mother of one child. She earns her income from the sale of her corn at the Agoe Assiyeye market, one of the local markets in the city of Lome. This lively market is open five days a week and attracts many buyers from the different quarters of the city. Mrs. A. started this business in 2003 and purchases her inventory in the Village of Kara, where she was born. She now has an increased number of clients and is requesting this first loan to purchase eight (8) sacks of corn to meet the higher demand.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 29 ans, madame A. Essohanam est une femme mariée qui et a un enfant. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de maïs dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé l’un des marchés local de Lomé. Ce marché qui s’anime tous les cinq jours accueille beaucoup d’acheteurs venant de différents quartiers. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2003 et s’approvisionne dans son village natal qui est Kara. Actuellement sa clientèle connaît un accroissement et elle désire être à la hauteur et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter huit (8) sacs de maïs.

loans.use: Purchase of 8 sacks of corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of many goods to restock a small grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to produce cakes, ice cream and sweets.

loans.name: Moussoura

texts.fr:
Mrs. Moussoura I. is a widow, born in 1947, at Kouna in the state (prefect) of Tchaoudjo. She makes her living selling yams, peanuts and fruits and has been doing this since 1999. She adapts to the season, selling what is available at the time. At the moment, she is selling mangos and yams She has previously made a business loan and it was duly repaid. She is requesting this second loan to purchase 10 baskets of mangos and 30 yam tubers to increase sales.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame I. Moussoura est née en 1967 à KOUNA dans la préfecture de Tchaoudjo. Elle est veuve et a pour activité principale la vente d’ignames, d’arachide et de fruits. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1999 et adapte son activité à chaque saison. Elle vend actuellement des mangues et des ignames. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et s’est bien comporté dans le remboursement. Ce second prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 paniers de mangues et 30 tubercules d’ignames afin de mieux vendre.

loans.use: Purchase of mangos and yams

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
I previously expanded my house, but I have not been able to do the finish work on it, such as install windows, security bars, and a fence. I would like to finish construction on my house to give it a better look while at the same time protect my home and family. I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Anteriormente realice a mi casa una ampliación la cual no he podido darle los acabados como son ventanas, protecciones y poner un barandal y quisiera darle seguimiento a esta construcción para darle una mejor vista, y de esta misma forma proteger mas mi vivienda y a mi familia. Solicito la cantidad de $1,200.00 dlls.

loans.use: Installation of windows, security bars, and a fence

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: David

texts.es:
I own a fruit cocktail business, which is in good shape and very hygienic. This business is how I make a living everyday, and it is my family’s source of income. I would like to expand my business and sell other types of food, such as barbequed pork and pork rinds, thus increasing both production and the family income. I am requesting a loan of $500.00 USD to be able to broaden my business horizons.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuento con un negocio propio donde vendo cócteles de frutas, todo en buen estado e higiénico, esto es de lo que vivo todos los días, y el sustento de mi casa, quisiera ampliar mi negocio y vender otro tipo de cosa como carnitas y chicharrones, de esta manera seria más producción y más entrada de dinero para mi familia. Solicito la cantidad de $500.00 dlls... así podré abarcar un poco mas en este negocio.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
I have a small business in my home in which I provide necessary items, such as water, soft drinks, bread, and cleaning products, to name a few, for the residents of my area. For this reason, I would like to provide my customers with greater ease in obtaining what they need for their home, while at the same time boosting my sales. My offering more products would be easier for my customers to find what they need close to home, thus they can avoid having to travel too far. I am requesting a loan of $300.00 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un pequeño negocio en mi vivienda donde brindo a la comunidad de mi colonia servicios necesarios para su hogar, como puede ser agua, refrescos, pan y algunos artículos de limpieza por mencionar algunos, por esto me gustaría darles mayor facilidad de conseguir lo necesario en su hogar y así también aumentar mis ventas, contando con mas cosas seria mas fácil para las personas encontrar cerca de su domicilio lo que solicitan y no tener que trasladarse a una tienda mas lejos. Solicito la cantidad de $300.00 dlls.

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Affiwavi Kafui

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Affiwavi Kafui was born on March 27, 1981 in Agoè. She is married and has one child. She did not pursue a higher education, choosing instead to complete a course in secretarial computer services. In 2007 she opened a small business office, equipped with a computer, and started offering her secretarial services. This service is limited to word processing as her photocopier has broken down. This is Mrs. A.'s first loan and she is requesting it to purchase a new “Sharp” photocopier.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 27mars 1981 à Agoè, madame A. Affiwavi Kafui est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle n’a pas fait de grandes études. Dès qu’elle abandonne les études elle a fait une formation en informatique bureautique. Ainsi elle a ouvert en 2007 un petit bureau équipé d’ordinateur qui lui permet de faire des prestations de services bureautiques. Cette prestation se limite essentiellement au traitement de texte car sa photocopieuse est tombée en panne. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une nouvelle photocopieuse de marque sharp.

loans.use: Purchase of a Photocopier.

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es:
I have been working at a school as a prefect for years now. My wife has been working at a factory for many years as well. I am requesting a loan because I need to set up a small general store in my home so that my wife can work in our own business because she has been doing heavy work for a long time. This way, we would increase our income and she could rest. I am requesting a loan of $1,000.00 USD so that we can start our small general store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Yo trabajo en una escueL. D. prefecto hace ya años, mi esposa trabaja en una maquiladora D. igual manera por muchos años, es por esto que pido un préstamo por que tengo L. necesidad D. poner una miscelánea en mi casa para que mi esposa pueda trabajar en un negocio propio ya que lleva mucho tiempo trabajando y es un poco pesado, D. esta manera tendríamos ingresos mas propios y elL. pudiera descansar. Solicito el préstamo D. $1,000.00 dlls. Y así poder poner L. tienda D. abarrotes.

loans.use: Set up a small general store

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
I have a small tool business, which has been successful. It is my second source of income for my family since the company for which I work pays me minimum wage. With this business, I can cover the necessary household expenses. I am requesting a loan of $200.00 USD so that I can purchase more merchandise and have a well-stocked tool business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuento con una pequeña venta de herramienta, la cual me va bien es un segundo ingreso que aporto a mi familia ya que en la empresa donde laboro es mínimo el salario, de esta manera puedo sustentar mas lo s gastos necesarios en mi hogar, solicito préstamo por $200.00 para de esta forma comprar mas mercancía y tener surtido mi pequeño negocio de venta de herramienta.

loans.use: Supply tool business with merchandise

loans.name: Las Conquistadoras Group

texts.es:
The group is maD. of 13 partners. Twelve women and one male. The group is from the Kiswaras area. An area of a few resources, but the people have a big heart and integrity. The majority of the partners are artisans. They do blankets, macramé, fabric painting, among others. Mrs. Bertha, the group treasurer, she does gold rescue in a mining center of the city. Mrs. Bertha mentions that this business is profitable and what she earns is for the studies of her children. Mrs Bertha also has an individual loan, that she has always paid in time and she plans to keep on working with Agrocapital. Mrs. Eliana is a proprietor of the house where they meet and where photo was taken. Eliana has a shop at her house.

El grupo está conformado por 13 socias. Doce mujeres y un varón. El grupo es D. la zona D. Kiswaras. Una zona D. pocos recursos pero con gente D. gran corazón y mucha honradez. La mayoría D. las socias son artesanas, se dedican al tejido D. mantas, macramé, pintura D. telas y otros. Doña Bertha, tesorera del grupo, ella se dedica al rescate D. oro en un centro minero D. la ciudad. Doña Bertha comenta que este negocio es rentable y lo que gana es para el estudio D. sus hijos que ella tiene. Doña Bertha también tiene un crédito individual, donD. la señora no tiene retrasos mas al contrario esta pensando en seguir trabajando con Agrocapital. Doña Eliana es dueña D. la casa donD. se reúnen y donD. se tomo la fotografía. Eliana tiene una tienda en su mismo hogar.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Verónica

texts.es:
Maria Verónica G. is 35 years old, and the single mother of three school-aged children. She has run a general store from her home for the past 10 years, a business she was able to start thanks to a small inheritance left to her by her mother. She has had to take great care of the business, and manage it well, as it is the only means of income for the family.

What she worries most about is having enough money to provide an education for her children, which is why she wants to invest further into her enterprise to augment her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Verónica G. tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, quienes están en edad escolar. Tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace ya 10 años, negocio que pudo empezar gracias a una pequeña herencia dejada por su mamá, y la que ha tendio que cuidar y administrar muy bien ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia. Lo que más le preocupa es poder tener suficiente capital para poder darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos, y por eso va a invertir más en su negocio para generar más ganacias, va a comprar granos básicos para invertirlos en su pulpería y tener más utilidades

loans.use: Purchase staple grains for her general store.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Juana is 39 years old who, sixteen years ago, used her savings to start a small business selling fried pork door-to-door using a cart. She has been able to grow her enterprise, and she now also sells baho (a traditional Nicaraguan dish made from a mix of meat, green plantains and yucca cooked in banana leaves), sodas and other products.

She thinks that now is a good time to grow her business further, which is why she is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs so she can offer a better quality of service to her customers.

After making this investment, she will build her own location from which to sell her goods. Juana is married and has two children who are now living on their own. Her husband works as a refrigeration technician and helps Juana with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Las Semillitas De Rsr Group

texts.es:
This Group is maD. of 15 persons 25 % males and 75 % women. The name of the group comes from another institution from which they come. The Semillitas RSR started their second cycle. The first cycle they worked with integrity and honesty making all their payments on time excepting for one person who this cycle did not join for the same reason. The hope of every one is to be able to keep on being capitalized further and not to depend anymore on loans and to be able to work with their own capital, and this way to create their own micro company for the benefit of their families.

Name of the partner, Sex ,Activity, Years working

Grupo conformado por 15 personas 25 % varones y 75% mujeres. El nombre del grupo sale D. un grupo creado en otra institución D. la cual ellos vienen. Las semillitas RSR ingresó a su segundo ciclo en el primer ciclo trabajaron con honestidad y honradez sin fallar ninguna D. sus cuotas exceptuando una persona que en este ciclo no ingreso por la misma razón. La esperanza D. cada persona es poder seguir capitalizándose para mas adelante ya no depender D. prestamos y poder trabajar con capital propio, D. esa manera crear su microempresa para el provecho D. su familia. loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel is 40 years old and lives in his own home in the east side of the city with his wife and three children of 17, 15 and 14 years old respectively. Angel is a mechanic and works for a dairy company. He also recieves income from daily rental of two motorcycles that that are used as public transport. There is not a lot of competition in his first area of employment as it is a permanent and secure job, while in the other area the competition is average due to the number of people that are dedicated to the same activity, however we emphasize that also there is the demand for this method of transportation. With this loan he will acquire a motorcycle that costs approx. US$500. Please note that we only have a photo of his wife, who is the co-debtor, as he was not at his job and it is quite difficult to locate him during the day. This is his third loan with our institution and he has proven that he has an excellent record in making his loan repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Angel cuenta con 40 años de edad y vive en su casa propia que está ubicada en la zona este de la ciudad junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 17, 15 y 14 años de edad respectivamente. Angel es mecánico de profesión por lo que trabaja como tal en una empresa de Lacteos y paralelamente recibe ingresos por la renta diaria de dos motocicletas que trabajan en el transporte público de pasajeros. No hay mucha competencia en su primer rubro ya que es trabajador fijo y seguro, mientras que en el otro rubro la competencia es media debido a la cantidad de personas que se dedican a la misma actividad, cabe recalcar que así también es la demanda por este medio de transporte. Con el presente crédito el adquirirá una motocicleta con un precio aproximado de $us. 500.-. Se hace notar que sólo se tomo foto a su esposa que es la codeudora ya que el no estaba en su trabajo y es bastante difícil ubicarlo en el día. Este es el tercer préstamo en nuestra insitución y el demostró tener un excelente cumplimiento en el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Maria Esperanza is a 35-year old woman who dedicates herself to farming, her primary activity being the harvest of pineapple. She was able to start the business thanks to a family member who sold her some land at very affordable prices and she wanted to take the opportunity to start up in agriculture.

On her land, she plants pineapple which is a sought-after product both for export and import. Ticuantepe is a municipality that is, almost in its entirety, cultivated with pineapple crops. The plantings need careful maintance to yield healthy pineapples, and with the loan she would purchase products to apply to her crop so she can have a successful harvest to distribute to her primary purchasers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Esperanza es una mujer de 35 años de edad que se dedica a la agricultura, su actividad es la cosecha de piña, pudo inicarse en este negocio gracias a que un familiar le vendió unas tierras a precios módicos y ella quiso aprovechar la oportunidad para comenzar a cosechar. En sus tierras ella siembra piña producto muy solicitdao tanto para la exportación como para la importación. Ticuantepe es un municipio que casi en su totalidad se encuentra sembrado de piña. Estos siembros necesitan de un mantenimiento cuidadoso para que la piña pueda salir completamente sana, y con el crédito adquirirá insumos agrícolas para aplicárselos a los productos y así poder tener una cosecha muy exitosa y distribuir las piñas a sus principales compradores.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies to maintain her pineapple crops.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is 45 years old and at present lives in her own home, which is located to the north, with her husband of 48 years old who works part-time in a sugar refinery, and their two children of 22 and 12 years old respectively. Martha has a beauty salon in her own home. She developed this business some years ago and has a lot of experience. They also recieve daily rent from a vehicle which is used as a taxi on interprovincial routes. In both activities the competition is average, but what allows them to continue is the number of years they have had both businesses. Their loan request is to purchase items for the beauty salon, to a total price of US$1000. Martha has a good credit record and currently has debts with two financial entities.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Martha cuenta con 45 años de edad y actualmente vive en su casa que es propia y que está ubicada al Norte, en esta cas vive junto a su esposo de 48 años de edad quién trabaja medio tiempo en un ingenio azucarero, Sus do hijos tienen 22 y 12 años de edad respectivamente. Martha tiene un salón de belleza que está instalado en su propio domicilio, desarrolla esta actividad desde hace varios años atrás por lo que tiene muchas experiencia. También reciben una renta diaria de un vehículo que trabaja como taxi en rutas interprovinciales. En ambas actividades la competencia es media, pero lo que les permite seguir adelante es la antiguedad de ambos en sus negocios. La presente solicitud es para la compra de artículos para el salón de belleza, el precio total aproximado de estos equipos es de $us. 1,000.-. Martha tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios y actualmente tiene deudas con dos entidades financieras.

loans.use: Purchase of salon equipment

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria is a seamstress, dedicating herself to sewing for the past four years. She lives in the Ticuantepe municipality, is 58 years old, single, and her children have now grown and live on their own. The roof on Maria Elena’s house has deteriorated over time, and she seeks a loan to buy zinc to replace a part of it. The rains are impacting her given that water is entering into the home. She hopes in the future to open her own tailoring shop to be able to capture more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria se dedica a la costura, es modista dese hace 4 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera y los hijos que tuvo ya los puedo formar y ahora son independientes a ella. El techo de la casa de habitación de doña Maria Elena se encuentra muy deteriorado debido al tiempo, y solicita el préstamo para compra de zinc y cambiar parte del techo de su casa, debido a que las lluvias la están afectando y se le está metiendo el agua en su casa. Espera en un futuro poner un taller de costura para así poder captar más clientes.

loans.use: Purchase zinc to repair the deteriorating roof on her house.

loans.name: Jorge Willan

texts.es:
Jorge has a family that is made up of his son of one year old, both reside in his parents' house. Jorge works as an electrician in a sugar refinery, as well as receiving daily income from rental of a motorcycle, both of which he has been doing for a number of years. There is competition in public transport but not in his permanent job as he has held it for so long. His current loan is to purchase a plot of land. Jorge has very good credit references in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Jorge tiene una familia que está conformada por su hijo de un añito de edad, ambos residen en la casa de sus padres. Jorge presta servicios como electricista en un ingenio azucarero, por otra parte renta una moto por la cual recibe un ingreso diario, ambas actividades desde hace varios años atrás. En el transporte público tiene competencia pero no así en el lugar de trabajo fijo debido a su antiguedad. La presente solicitud es para la compra de un lote de terreno. Jorge tiene muy buenas referencias creditias en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana is a women who lives in a common law marriage. She is pregnant. Because of this she now feels the tremendous necessity to achieve a higher income in order to be able to improve the life of the baby that is on its way. The income of her spouse is not sufficient although he works as a shoe shiner. His income is not sufficient to be able to do much in the house, or above all else to have better quality of life. She was told that selling shoes from a catalogue is a good business, and that was it easy to collect sales. Because of this she decided to do it, and for one and a half years she has been selling shoes. It has allowed her to have a better income.

She needs a loan of USD $300 that she will repay in 6 months in order to buy more shoes, and to satisfy the needs of her clients quickly and with this she will generate more earnings and recommendations.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana es una mujer que vive en unión libre y esta embarazada, por lo mismo ella siente ahora la tremenda necesidad de percibir un ingreso mas alto para poder sacar adelante a su bebe que vine en camino, el ingreso de su esposo no es suficiente ya que el trabaja de bolero (aseador de calzado) y su ingreso no es suficiente para poder dar algo mas en la casa y sobre todo tener mejores condiciones de vida. Le comentaron que era buen negocio la venta de zapatos por catalogo y que era fácil colocar ventas así que ella decidió hacerlo y ya lleva 1 año y medio vendiendo, lo que le ha permitido tener mejore ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más zapato, y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes rápidamente ya que esto le generara más ganancias y recomendaciones.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Gabriela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gabriela is a 21-year old youngster, who is married and has three small children. She lives in the Edgard Munguía neighborhood. Her husband is in sales, and they both put forth a great effort to help the family get ahead.

Gabriela runs a general store from her home, having started eight years ago selling candy. She has managed to grow her business substantially. She is asking for a loan to invest in her enterprise, wishing to buy more merchandise so she can vary the types of product she has to offer to customers. She hopes that with this business, as well as the support of her husband, they will be able to provide an education for their small children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabriela es una joven que a sus 21 años ya está casada y tiene 3 pequeños hijos, habita en el barrio Edgard Munguía. Su esposo se desempeña como auxiliar de ventas y ambos ponen todo su empeño para poder sacar adelante a la familia. Gabriela tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, hace 8 años empezó vendiendo golosinas y ya su negocio ha crecido mucho. Está solicitando el crédito para inversión de su negocio, desea adquirir más productos para aumentar la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes. Espera que con este negocio y la ayuda de su esposo pueda sacar adelante a su familia y darle educación a sus pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise to be able to provide a greater variety of product to her customers.

loans.name: Gloria Leticia

texts.es:
Gloria is married and she has three children who are 16, 13, and 4 years old. She began the business when her husband got laid off from his job, and she put part of the severance in a business because she didn't want to go through so many problems because after the layoffs happened it took a lot of time to find another job, and she suffered a lot for want of money that they suddenly didn't have in order to support their family or to pay for the house. Because of this she decided to have a business so that that situation would never happen again. She has had her paper store for three years, and she has successfully grown a base by her efforts and those of her family. Now her eldest son he helps her attend the store.

She needs a loan of USD $500 that she will repay in 6 months in order to invest in her business, buying merchandise. With your help, Gloria will move her life upwards and onwards!

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 13, y de 4 años. Inició el negocio cuando liquidaron a su esposo de su trabajo y entonces ella invirtió una parte de la liquidación en el negocio aparte porque ya no quisieron que pasaran por tantos problemas porque cuando lo liquidaron tardo mucho tiempo en conseguir otro empleo y sufrió mucho por la escasez de dinero ya que no tenían para la manutención de su familia ni para pagar su casa de así que decidió tener un negocio para no volver a pasar por eso. Desde hace 3 años tiene su papelería la cual ha logrado hacer crecer en base a su esfuerzo y el de su familia ya que ahora su hijo mayor le ayuda a atenderla.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para poder invertirlo en su negocio, comprando mercancía. Con tu apoyo Gloria saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #56598

loans.name: Erika Yamileth

texts.es:
Erika is a small-business owner who runs a small general store in her home. She lives in the El Riguero neighborhood, is married and has a 12-year old son. Her husband works in construction. Erika started selling soft drinks and food, using savings generated from this activity to start buying a variety of products to start her store. The loan would be invested in the purchase of basic grains and cleaning products to augment her enterprise’s inventory, so she can continue to grow it and make her business more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Erika es una pequeña comerciante que en su casa de habitación tiene una pequeña pulpería. Habita en elbarrio El Riguero, es casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años. Su espsos es albañil. Erika empezó vendiendo refrescos y comida, con las ganacias generadas por esta actividad pudo empezar a comprar diversos productos para poner una pulpería en su casa de habitación. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos y productos de limpieza para aumentar el inventario de su negocio, para así continuar con su crecimiento y hacer su negocio más rentable.

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning products and basic grains to increase the inventory in her store.

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
The group Progreso consists of 15 members, all women, who meet in the house of Ms Doris M. located on pagador street.

They meet every Thursday afternoon in accordance with their weekly plan.

Se reunen todos los días jueves por L. tarD. D. acuerdo a su plan semanal.
